<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In Shell Internal Audit and Investigations (SIAI) we work with all businesses in all parts of the world. We aim to deliver Independent, Courageous and Actionable insights from our audits and investigations and support learning and improvement at all levels of Shell. By doing so, we support sustainable delivery of Shell’s strategic goals: being a World Class Investment Case, upholding a strong Societal License to Operate and Thriving in the Energy Transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shell Global Helpline and SIAI’s Integrity investigations unit is a cornerstone of Shell’s ethical culture, providing a trusted safe space for the raising of concerns and a dedicated investigations team on potential Code of Conduct violations, which is relied upon respected and supported by leadership up to Ethics and Compliance (EC) and Board level.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Senior Investigator within the Audit and Investigations – Integrity team, you will plan and execute investigations into possible violations of the Shell Code of Conduct, Shell General Business Principles, Ethics and Compliance manual, company policies, and relevant laws, including evidence gathering and analysis, conducting interviews and writing high quality reports for an audience of leaders in the organization up to and including the Executive Committee. You will act as a role model and mentor for other investigators and will be a champion of quality, continuous improvement and learning across the organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Subject to Covid 19, the role requires travel of up to approximately 40% of time although this is variable depending on location and requirements to assist with investigations in other Regions and countries as required.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates who demonstrate the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Previous substantial experience in the field of corporate investigations with an instinct for objectivity, critical analysis, and balanced assessment, combined with courage and empathy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent people relationship skills with an ability to deploy a range of engagement and interviewing styles and the credibility to engage with the most senior levels in our organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The self -assurance to deliver difficult messages and questions, while at the same time role modelling the values of honesty, integrity, and respect for people.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Thorough knowledge in the application of data analytics and forensics in investigations utilizing multiple data sources.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrable ability to project-manage complex and potentially impactful investigations of diverse types, from accounting fraud to bullying and harassment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The self -assurance to deliver difficult messages and questions, while at the same time role modelling the values of honesty, integrity, and respect for people.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent writing skills and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate complex issues to senior level clearly and concisely.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline such as accounting, forensics, or law.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are hiring at all levels from graduate to highly seasoned professional in our Transformational Change Practice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell’s Transformational Change practice leads the management of change across the business’ digital agenda. We are passionate about leading, driving and partnering to help our business gain the most of their investment in technology. We have over 400 highly skilled and experienced practitioners working across our global internal consultancy. Most have joined us from a premium consulting organization and others have joined us from a blue-chip background, all finding their home in a company that truly values people and is on an unprecedented transformation journey.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We work on a huge array of initiatives from using drones and AI to support predictive maintenance through to driving behavior change in cyber security or working on one of the world’s largest SAP S\u002F4 implementations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Hands-on leading, managing and driving change on digital initiatives across Shell’s business. Depending on your experience you will scope work, build comprehensive integrated change plans, run and manage change impact assessments, work with the business to design and implement mitigation strategies, build business readiness criteria and manage change initiatives through to successful stabilization. You’ll also design and execute communications plans and manage stakeholder engagement as well as designing and implementing learning and development approaches. More senior practitioners will also design and drive value enablement and realisation work as well as partnering to drive organisational design, development and alignment activities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Depending on your level of experience, you will bring a deep knowledge of method and tools that drive change and will have experience working on large digital initiatives. You’ll be a team player who is energized by getting involved in building a consulting practice and always looking for ways to approve approaches and share knowledge. You will be a practitioner that rolls up your sleeves and delivers programmes. You will have skills and expertise in:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Change Management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Stakeholder Engagement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Communications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Learning and Development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Organisation Design<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Development and alignment and value realisation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Continuous Improvement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will have a minimum of an undergraduate degree and will likely have excelled academically.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll be excited by the energy transition and motivated to work with a likeminded group of change managers as well as wider group of industry-leading technology and business professionals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If this sounds like you then we are excited to tell you more about the opportunities to lead the change at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description<\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. We’re looking for students and graduates, whose energy and passion for change can help us achieve our goals of providing cleaner energy solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We have a range of Assessed Internship opportunities for you to explore. No matter your discipline, you’ll have the chance to work on meaningful projects that directly impact our business – and the world. Dedicated mentors will support you every step of the way and help guide your progression in a company built around inclusivity and collaboration. Join us on our journey to develop tomorrow’s energy solutions today.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Shell Internship Programme<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our internships are fully assessed and will allow you to get involved in projects specifically matched to your interests and abilities. You’ll receive regular and structured performance evaluations from your mentor and direct supervisor, and you’ll find out what the energy industry is really like, from the inside.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A Shell internship gives you the opportunity to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Build valuable networks for future career goals<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Discover potential job areas, fields of specialisation or area of future study<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gain exposure to the energy industry<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work on projects that have a real business impact<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Practical experience of the theories and concepts you have learned<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As you'll be assessed entirely on how well you perform during your internship, you could even secure an offer to join Shell full-time when you graduate - <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Deadline: <\u002Fb>The deadline for application is<b> 31 March 2023.<\u002Fb> Early application is strongly recommended as Shell recruits on a rolling basis.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> This posting covers all internship opportunities across Commercial, Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) and Functions (Information Digital Technologies, Finance, and Contracting &amp; Procurement). Shell matches you into a particular programme based on your skills and preference.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Job Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell, we believe everyone has a part to play in the global transition to cleaner energy – especially you. We’re looking for students and graduates, whose energy and passion for change can help us achieve our goals of providing cleaner energy solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We have a range of Assessed Internship opportunities for you to explore. No matter your discipline, you’ll have the chance to work on meaningful projects that directly impact our business – and the world. Dedicated mentors will support you every step of the way and help guide your progression in a company built around inclusivity and collaboration. Join us on our journey to develop tomorrow’s energy solutions today.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Shell Internship Programme<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our internships are fully assessed and will allow you to get involved in projects specifically matched to your interests and abilities. You’ll receive regular and structured performance evaluations from your mentor and direct supervisor, and you’ll find out what the energy industry is really like, from the inside.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A Shell internship gives you the opportunity to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Build valuable networks for future career goals<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Discover potential job areas, fields of specialisation or area of future study<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gain exposure to the energy industry<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work on projects that have a real business impact<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Practical experience of the theories and concepts you have learned<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As you'll be assessed entirely on how well you perform during your internship, you could even secure an offer to join Shell full-time when you graduate - without the need for a further interview.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we look for:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for ambitious students to help us tackle the energy challenge.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> You must be in your penultimate year of study <\u002Fb><b>and likely to graduate in 2024.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> For Commercial and Functions roles, you’ll need to have, or be studying towards, a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> There are no specific academic requirements for grades, however we do expect candidates to have a strong academic record.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Please note that you must be lawfully authorised to work in the country in which you’re applying for.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading and Supply (T&amp;S) is an energy trading operation that combines a global network of trading companies, with shipping and maritime capabilities, and an integrated network of supply and distribution activities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Commercial Operations organization works in partnership with T&amp;S to deliver capabilities that enable them to “run” the business, as well as build capabilities that “change” the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Programme Project Delivery (PPD) sit in Commercial Operations and:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> support T&amp;S with cross business line Programme, Project, PMO, Assurance and Change management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> delivers a methodology that enables effective Programme, Project, PMO, delivery and embeds change<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> acts as the custodian of the overall Programme and Project agenda for T&amp;S, enabling prioritisation activity and cross business line stakeholder alignment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The portfolio of projects is diverse and varies in scale and complexity. Current Programmes\u002FProjects span Risk, Compliance, Process, Data &amp; Systems. However, the portfolio is expected to evolve to meet the demands of Shell’s Powering Progress Strategy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The PPD team are a new, highly driven team of Project management and PMO experts focused on delivering real solutions, that add business value and help drive the T&amp;S agenda forward.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is a great opportunity for an individual who is eager to grow their Project Management and PMO capabilities and looking to learn and work on high stake projects with senior leaders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Project analyst within PPD, you will be expected to manage the Project Management Office for T&amp;S projects. Reporting to the PPD PMO lead, the Project analyst has responsibility for:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Overseeing and monitoring projects to ensure that cost, quality, and delivery are controlled, and targets achieved.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Championing and following project management standards and best practice, including continuous improvement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Project Analyst will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Delivery planning - support Project Managers &amp; PMO Lead in developing detailed resource-based project plans, which show dependencies and clearly defined delivery roles.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Governance - support Projects Managers &amp; PMO Lead in establishing a fit for purpose Governance framework.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Tracking - support Project Managers in providing progress reports and delivery metrics for T&amp;S projects and making interventions to reduce risk or manage issues. This includes progress against plan and budget, projects change through change control process, risks, and issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> KPIs - Track the KPIs to support data-driven decisions and measure how effective the projects are performing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Financial Management - monitor, report and manage project budgets and expenditure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Standards - follow the processes and standards for the Project Management Office to manage risks and issues, change control, financial management and records management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Previous experience in a PMO office and executing PMO processes and standards<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting the PM, in collaboration with workstream leads and wider stakeholder group to understand project progress and provide appropriate facilitation to drive the execution of project deliverables (especially when there is a need to make critical decisions to address underlying risks or issues blocking the progress).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Planning and RAID management - Ability to create and maintain project plans, including risks, actions, issues, dependencies and deploy interventions to mitigate risk. Ensure project activities are up-to-date and that actions owners are followed up with.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Reporting - Ability to produce reports to the highest quality. Develop slides to report on progress to support both the programme Governance and report out to the Portfolio level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Financial tracking and management of the project budget.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Facilitate project meetings and workshops and take minutes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Stakeholder management – ability to understand your stakeholders, their needs, their ways of working and adapt your style accordingly. Proven ability to navigate push back from stakeholders and develop an aligned way forward path.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Confident presentation skills, with the ability to use a range of Microsoft tools to produce professional and informative data for stakeholders as needed<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ideally have knowledge and\u002For competence in Trading, Supply, Risk, Compliance, Process, Data, or Systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Learner mindset - Eagerness to learn, with proven ability to get up to speed quickly and solve business problems, without being a subject matter expert.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Aligned with Shells values of Honesty, Integrity, Respect with a focus on Safety.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ideally have knowledge and competency in change management, with the ability to support the Project\u002FProgramme manager to deliver and embed sustainable change outcomes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge and competency in strategic problem solving and project management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to deliver in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Quality focused – ability to administer all aspects of the role to the highest quality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Professional qualifications in project management desired e.g., PRINCE 2, Agile project management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience and knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor's degree from an accredited university (or equivalent work experience).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will help to communicate Shell's strategy in a compelling and creative way by writing and editing external speeches, articles, long-form social media posts, talking points and occasional video scripts for members of the Executive Committee. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The CEO and other EC members are the most important voices and faces of Shell in the outside world. Their speeches at some of the world's most prominent speaking platforms must show thought leadership for the industry and society, helping to build support for Shell's reputation with key audiences.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Challenges:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> The role requires flexible skills. A speechwriter\u002Feditor must be able to write and edit a range of editorial materials as needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must research, write, and edit speeches\u002Ftalking points for Executive Committee members to deliver at strategic external speaking platforms that open doors for new business and support Shell's reputation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> This work involves developing fresh ideas and building solid intellectual arguments for major speeches.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Requires the ability to build trust and a close working relationship with senior leaders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Speechwriter may encounter conflicting viewpoints among senior leaders and need to manage such conflicts diplomatically.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll ideally be\u002Fhave:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in researching, crafting, and editing speeches and articles working with senior leaders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sound research methodology – familiarity with information sources, capacity to search efficiently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perceptive and diplomatic interview skills, eliciting key information from internal and external sources.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Open, flexible, and creative approach. Results-focused and able to solve issues and problems quickly and independently.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to distil complex information into memorable and easily understandable messages to audiences, lifting out key interest points and relating to specific audience interest and needs\u002Frelevance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of working in a large multicultural company or organisation an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Journalism experience with a leading news organisation an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the UK more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>The Speechwriter\u002Feditor will support the coaching and training of colleagues in Corporate Relations and in other teams to help develop writing skills.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shipping &amp; Maritime organization provides maritime expertise to all Shell Group businesses and leads the industry in safety, technology and developing solutions to challenges such as decarbonization. Expertise comes in the form of developing strategy, providing input to industry bodies, commercial shipping advice and contracting, technology innovation and project design, maritime risk management and assurance, HSSE, fleet management and operations, and extracting value through innovation and digital along the entire end to end maritime value chain.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shipping Economics Advisor is a part of the Commercial Shipping team; the position enables the delivery of accurate, timely and relevant advice to Shell businesses on shipping investments, enabling informed decision making. The role will encompass developing expert modelling, market analysis, business insight, and stakeholder liaison.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>In this role, you will apply your expertise to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Provide economic analysis and advice to support group investment projects, contract renewals and in the evaluation of shipping acquisitions\u002F disposals and period charter offers in oil, LNG and any other required area.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop methodologies for evaluating new areas (particularly in relation to the shipping decarbonization) and drawing insights from data (e.g. freight emissions data, emissions reporting and impact analysis of environmental regulations, vessel performance data).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Standardize existing evaluation tools and methods to create a suite of ‘off the shelf’ tools for the team, linking in with digital solutions across Shipping &amp; Maritime.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support shipping strategies and charter contract negotiation strategy development; including contributing towards overarching strategic priorities related to decarbonization, maintaining customer centricity and delivering stakeholder value.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide fleet supply, forecasts and long-term fundamentals analysis in crude, products and\u002For LNG.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide governance support towards compliance, settlements and contractual matters related to long-term charters.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Proven analytical skills; confident with complex numerical analysis, demonstrating commercial, economic and financial acumen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Previous modelling experience in Excel and other tools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to create modelling methodologies to evaluate new opportunities in new areas and to standardize existing ones.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to synthesize complex data into concise and focused analysis, often against tight deadlines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to tell the story and explain the ‘so what’ for commercial stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work with multiple sources of data, to understand and incorporate uncertainty appropriately and provide advice with incomplete information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of shipping, LNG and\u002For oil markets would be a benefit, but is not a prerequisite.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-starter, able to plan and adapt own workload in the face of changing priorities whilst maintaining on time and accurate delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexible and capable of adapting previous knowledge to find solutions to new challenges.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to develop and demonstrate learner mindset and key leadership behaviours required to thrive in this exciting and well-rounded role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy Europe &amp; Environmental Products is seeking a meteorologist. This position is responsible for supporting traders in Gas and Power commodities with analysis developed from a deep understanding of weather-based drivers such wind, solar, Hydro, etc. affecting power generation, or temperature affecting demand in Europe. This position must build credibility with internal customers so that such foresight can be translated into commercial gain primarily in the trading business function. The emphasis is on developing both qualitatively and quantitatively advantaged capabilities, supported as appropriate by models, tools and techniques that yield high quality insight. Collaborating with peers in the Meteorologists team to build scalability in this respect is essential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver short term to long term weather view for use in fundamental power analysis techniques to support trading and asset optimisation decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand the fundamentals drivers related to power and gas that can be influenced by weather inputs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and improve weather derived models to be used as inputs for price modelling.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor and back test weather forecasts from internal and external providers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with short and mid-term natural gas and power analysts in market view development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide weather data and forecast for asset optimisation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop new products and tools to improve trading making decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Excellent knowledge of the global weather models is essential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Relevant years of experience with weather forecasting ideally within the energy industry or trading environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very strong numerical and analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of weather regimes in Europe, climate drivers and their implications on the weather forecast.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both written and oral.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent IT skills incl. ability to model in main languages as Python and in the MS Windows environment (particularly Excel), Experience interfacing with databases (SQL).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s Degree in meteorology or Maths\u002FPhysics with a link to Meteorology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working with reanalysis and netcdf\u002Fgrib files.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to use, modify, deploy weather models or statistical models (MOS) is a strong advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shell Energy Europe &amp; Environmental Products (SE-EE) Contracts team supports the SE-EE trading business and is responsible for managing the entire trading contracts process from drafting and negotiating agreements through to timely confirmation and reporting of individual trades.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will report to the Team Lead Contract Coordinators, part of the Shell Energy Europe &amp; Environmental Products (SE-EE) Contracts Team and will work closely with other members of the SE-EE Contracts team as well as the SE-EE business and support functions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Your primary purpose as a Contracts Coordinator is to validate trades entered into by SE-EE, working closely with the trading teams to ensure the accuracy of the Energy Risk &amp; Trade Management (ETRM) system, and confirm trades with SE-EE's counterparties.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your accountabilities would include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Draft (whether automatically through STP tools or manually) and ensure timely dispatch of all Counterparty Confirmations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Receive and reconcile all Counterparty Confirmations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Chase outstanding and overdue Confirmations to ensure receipt within contractual deadlines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor electronic Confirmations (both Broker and Counterparty) for failures and resolve through to successful match<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Reconcile broker recaps and investigate any mismatches<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure compliance at all times with the Global Contracts Control Framework and relevant SOX Controls<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the provision of regular KPIs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain desktop procedures to reflect current processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Handling any other ad hoc Trading \u002F Confirmation requests and queries as required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You should be able to demonstrate the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience of working in a commodity trading environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to absorb technical information and apply that information in practice and via processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> High level of attention to detail and accuracy in carrying out tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities to meet internal and external deadlines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A Continuous Improvement mindset with enthusiasm to identify risks and inefficiencies, solve problems and implement solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A good appreciation of the need for, and use of, KPIs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in reviewing and maintaining internal procedure documents<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A dynamic individual, who demonstrates enthusiasm and self-motivation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven ability to collaborate within a team and as part of a wider organisation, openly sharing views and perspectives and encouraging others to share opinions<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit In<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Payment and Reward Implementer works within the payment and loyalty team. Leading, alongside the Paylo Team lead, all payment and reward touchpoints within the UK mobility function and the Shell Go+ loyalty programme.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shell Go+ programme is one of the biggest growth drivers and marketing cost centres for Shell UK and global Mobility Marketing. This job is a fantastic opportunity for someone with experience in payment and reward systems and an interest in marketing and loyalty to make a significant impact on business results nationally<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><br> Ensures Pay at Pump is fully operational on all sites. Measures and drives performance through marketing activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to manage a payment project from end to end<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures all payment point of sale, information and training material is accurate and in the right place.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sets up sites to ensure they can process card payments (Tids and P43s)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Oversees retailer\u002Fdealer reimbursement, acting as a billing liaison for the various stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works with the Operations team to resolve payment issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitors payment systems for fraud.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Refunds and corrects duplicate payments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Has oversight of chargebacks, pays payment provider invoices.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Focal point (product owner) for all local payment and voucher systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manages gift vouchers and Gestures of Goodwill systems and stocks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manages credit flowing back into the Go+ loyalty margin budget.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manages 3rd party payment voucher and payment providers eg Hyperjar, Paypal, Adyen maximising potential and introducing new payment solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to assist in placing rewards onto the reward platform.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures rewards placed on the reward platform burn as expected by testing onsite.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Tests app changes as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Competencies<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Analytical problem-solving skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong stakeholder engagement skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication skills. Requires communicating using different methods, in a variety of formats, to people in many countries.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Team player, good interpersonal skills. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Ability to articulate and communicate complex issues and ideas in a clear and concise manner whilst understanding the perspective and experience of others.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> This is a role for a person who brings diversity of thought, who is not afraid to speak up.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactively identify and communicate potential issues with the appropriate teams or stakeholders. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Head of Liquidity &amp; Foreign Exchange (LFX), the role is a key interface between Shell and external financial markets, dealing foreign exchange, investing Group cash and ensuring that operating companies are funded. You will be a key member of the Treasury Front Office team who are accountable for the Group’s cash investment strategy, liquidity and foreign exchange dealing. You will have a broad network of interfaces across Treasury departments and Group Finance, as well as day to day contact with the Group’s broad banking relationships. This role provides a fantastic opportunity to gain an overview of all areas of Shell Treasury and Group funding, building upon your expertise in financial markets and banking.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You’ll be working closely with other Front Office team members in both London and Singapore, and with wider stakeholders in Treasury. You will manage group foreign exchange (~$250bln per year), utilising world-class technology and defining market strategies while operating within defined risk tolerances. You will also invest group cash (&gt;$20bln), managing the portfolio based on credit risk, liquidity and yield. The role requires high levels of engagement and coordination with stakeholders throughout Treasury and the wider business; you will be involved in implementing intra-group funding around the world, engaging with Treasury Managers on M&amp;A and refinancing projects, advising on FX and execution.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specific duties include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> FX trading including spot &amp; forward FX and currency swaps, and interest rate exposure management. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Cash investment, focussing on money market funds, reverse repo and term deposits. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Execution of intra-group funding including loans, derivatives and current accounts. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Developing and maintaining external relationships with approx. 25 relationship banks.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll be an experienced Treasury dealer, comfortable utilising trading platforms such as Bloomberg, and working across Treasury Management Systems. You will have knowledge and experience of market best practice and a range of instruments in the FX and Money Markets. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Treasury Dealer will have significant experience with Financial Markets and\u002For be a qualified Treasurer (Association of Corporate Treasurers or equivalent) or hold similar professional finance qualification, demonstrating expertise across the spectrum of Finance competences. We’re keen to hear from applicants with a problem-solving mindset and experience in coaching colleagues as a subject matter expert. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Candidates will build the following finance competencies through this role:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Corporate Treasury<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Risk management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Value management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Business performance management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Finance process excellence<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Financial Controls<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Governance &amp; Assurance<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading &amp; Supply integrates a worldwide trading network with an unsurpassed global portfolio in crude oil, reﬁned products, natural gas, electrical power and chemicals. Shell Trading &amp; Supply is one of the world’s largest energy traders and is a key part of the Royal Dutch Shell portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy - Europe Gas &amp; Power and Environmental Products (SE-EE) markets and trades natural gas and power across Europe and manages Shell's environmental products business globally. SE-EE's counterparties include major resource holders of gas, upstream producers, investment banks, trading houses, utilities, power generators and large industrial and commercial gas and power users.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Regulated Activities Analyst plays a key role in the Transaction Reporting (TR) process, ensuring that SE-EE remains compliant with its European and Asian regulatory reporting obligations, primarily REMIT, EMIR and MAS.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Regulated Activities Analyst, the chosen candidate will be part of Shell’s Energy business while working closely with our Trading and Supply teams. In addition, you will also need to leverage on your collaboration skills to work with our trading teams to improve accuracy of deal entry with respect to Transaction Reporting.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Furthermore, your accountabilities are as follows:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Monitor Transaction Reporting tools on a daily basis and investigate any issues or discrepancies to ensure trades are reported within regulatory timeframes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perform root cause analysis on errors and work with internal IT and external service providers (Equias, ACER, DTCC, ICE) to develop fixes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain trade booking \u002F trade confirmation system mappings across different counterparties and markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop new processes and tools to improve Transaction Reporting completeness, timeliness and accuracy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with commercial and compliance stakeholders to understand requirements for new business and implement solutions to increase Transaction Reporting capability as the businesses expands into new markets and products.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactively stay informed about internal system changes and external regulatory developments. Work with IT and compliance teams to keep Transaction Reporting infrastructure up to date.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate in industry working groups to build knowledge and remain up to speed with industry best practices in Transaction Reporting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What do we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from individuals who have a Bachelors or Masters degree. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of energy trading regulations (primarily REMIT, EMIR and MAS) but Dodd Frank, ASICS and FINFRAG would be valuable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong proficiency with software applications, including MS Excel, Visual Basic and SQL.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to analyze expansive data sets and quickly extract useful information and\u002For spot discrepancies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of developing new tools and processes to meet changing business requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify risks and ineﬃciencies in existing processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate clear recommendations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to manage multiple conﬂicting priorities to meet internal and external deadlines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiarity with oil, natural gas, electricity and financial markets and experience in a trading environment is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to collaborate within the team and as part of the wider organization, openly shares views, perspectives and encouragi others to share opinions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
