<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>If you have a keen interest in the Energy Transition and are energised by the opportunity to shape and deliver the Talent strategy of Shell, this could be an opportunity for you. The Energy Transition and Future of Work trends will change the business environment, the way we work and types of capabilities\u002Fskills we will need.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As Graduate Recruiter<i>,<\u002Fi> you will support a portfolio of business partners across various functions and classes of business, understanding the business context and talent strategy in order to secure top talent for Shell’s Graduate Programme (SGP). Working in a global team, this position will be responsible for graduate recruitment in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We’ll entrust you to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop trusted relationships and 2-way engagement with business partners (hiring managers, talent, HR) to understand business strategy and priorities, roles, and talent needs both short and longer term.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Hold professional Job Brief Meeting with hiring managers to fully inform resourcing strategy and ensure DE&amp;I priorities are established.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working across Graduate vacancies, partner with the sourcing and marketing teams to determine the right sourcing and marketing strategy for identifying high-fit candidates.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage the successful recruitment (quality, speed, cost and diversity of end-to-end pipeline) of approximately 40-45 graduate target positions per annum.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Differentiate candidate capabilities to shortlist and guide business on objective ratings to differentiate candidates<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be the key engagement point for Candidates ensuring an excellent candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead the offer making process to secure smooth, timely selection and appointment of candidates.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Build a continuous, collaborative delivery partnership with key Resourcing teams: Global Sourcing, Resourcing Operations, Talent Operations and Recruitment Marketing. Ensure clarity and alignment across stakeholders to enable coordinated, effective, posting, screening, assessment and offer management. Contribute to collaborative engagement with virtual network of team members, engaging them on the context and needs of the hire.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attend networking and recruitment events and generally build a pipeline of possible candidates for designated skill pools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure data quality and timely, accurate tracking and recording of information in recruiting systems for positions and candidates.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a visible Shell Ambassador in the external market, engaging with relevant networks and associations, as relevant to the portfolio of roles.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identifying and leading work to improve the ongoing delivery &amp; operational effectiveness of Resourcing, e.g., Continuous Improvement scope, or assessment upgrades<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a frontline bastion of integrity in Shell decision making for hiring. Understand &amp; adhere to high standards of compliance across all accountabilities. Take personal responsibility for data protection, equal opportunities always in addition to HSSE and Shell governance policies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role supports a portfolio of business and skill pool segments in the UK, understanding the business context and workforce needs in order to manage end-to-end graduate recruitment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role requires a resilient, passionate professional who thrives in a highly demanding operational environment. Strong business partnering skills are essential in the engagement with (senior) stakeholders across the business and the role requires the incumbent to be proactive and engaging.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Furthermore, you will have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Proven experience in Graduate Recruitment, Campus Recruitment, or Early Careers space, preferably in a matrix global environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good relationship and collaborative skills to work with a variety of partners, stakeholders, and peers. (True Business Partnering)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commitment and appetite for Continuous improvement and Operational Excellence<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to balance out the workload and manage Operations whilst keeping candidates and stakeholders happy<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Monitoring &amp; Surveillance (M&amp;S) team has global responsibility for the monitoring &amp; surveillance of the trading practices and business communications in T&amp;S. The Specialist M&amp;S reports into the Senior Regional Specialist M&amp;S and is based in the regional hub.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Purpose and Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage monitoring &amp; surveillance of activities related to specialist product\u002Fmarket area(s), investigating potentially suspicious activity from initial escalation through to resolution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Act as SME in chosen product\u002Fmarket area(s), supporting others’ investigations related to these products, upskilling the team, and actively identifying ways to improve the coverage, effectiveness or efficiency of surveillance undertaken, based on strong understanding of the product\u002F\u002Fmarket area(s) and associated risks and regulations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Specialist Monitoring\u002FSurveillance will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Conduct investigation of escalated trading activity, business communications or transactions based on automated alerts, leveraging a strong understanding of market dynamics and a wide range of risks and how they may manifest, to assess for potential market integrity, compliance risk or financial crime.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Act as SMEs for position limit monitoring undertaken by Analysts and assist with exemptions, account mapping and breach escalations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Take ownership of the escalated alerts and conduct level 2 investigation into suspicious activities. Ensuring escalations follow the M&amp;S processes including peer review and team leadership oversight, analysis is completed in a timely and quality manner, assessing whether all avenues have been explored to make the correct determination.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assist and provide feedback to Analysts on alert escalations and provide weekly reporting and metrics to management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conduct quality assurance on closed level 1 alerts, assessing that M&amp;S processes have been followed and analysis is of sufficient quality, with the right decisions being reached. Provide feedback and training to Analysts as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Periodically assess and managed the monitored population.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactively review trends and emerging risks\u002Fregulations against existing monitoring to assess current coverage and risk areas requiring additional monitoring.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Undertake targeted monitoring of individuals, desks or transactions based on trigger events, including analysis of trading and communications activities and other available data points, to assess for potential market integrity or other compliance risks, focusing on high-risk and high-complexity areas, while supporting targeted monitoring by Analysts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Regional Senior Specialists in producing analysis and documentation of information required for STOR\u002FSTR filings, investigations and RFI responses.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and lead changes to surveillance process and automated alerting to drive effectiveness or efficiency improvements, based on market and risk understanding.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support compliance change projects as an SME in specific product area, providing insight into requirements and testing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver training for M&amp;S team in specialist product\u002Fmarket or risk areas.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Continually enhance specialist product area knowledge and deep understanding of market integrity risks. Proactively develop insight into chosen area and continually look for ways to improve surveillance coverage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work collaboratively with the other Specialists in the region to deliver as one team. Liaise also with Specialist in other regions to share knowledge and learnings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with and seek advice from Compliance Advisory and other Compliance SMEs as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with business stakeholders as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> Monitoring and Trade Surveillance<\u002Fb>: Proficient understanding of market integrity risks and how they would manifest themselves across Oil and Energy markets based on strong knowledge of previous cases and the firm’s activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Regulatory Landscape Insight<\u002Fb>: Proficient understanding of market integrity, compliance and financial crime regulations and expectations and the ability to apply these to assess whether the firm’s activities are in line with regulations\u002Fexpectations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Market and Product Knowledge<\u002Fb>: Advanced understanding of oil and energy products and how they trade, including physical markets logistics (covering multiple product areas), and therefore the ability to identify unusual behaviours across complex activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Data Manipulation and Analysis<\u002Fb>: Desirable: Proficient data manipulation and analytical skills allowing for large data sets to be assessed to identify trending and outliers to support investigations into trading activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Language Skills<\u002Fb>: Desirable: Additional European or Asian languages<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Core Soft Skills<\u002Fb>: Proficient communication and collaboration skills, demonstrating the ability to set the right tone and relay information succinctly and\u002For persuasively to get tasks completed in a timely manner. Advanced business analysis and report writing skills in order to process information, make critical judgements and present findings in a clear and concise manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Management<\u002Fb>: Ability to manage small teams, providing training, support, and mentorship to a small number of individuals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy is part of Shell’s Trading &amp; Supply division. Our focus is on natural gas, power, LNG and environmental products markets through major hubs in London, Houston, Dubai, Singapore and Brisbane. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>We are at the heart of the energy transition; delivering Shell’s ambition to become a provider of more and cleaner energy solutions for the future in a highly dynamic and challenging environment. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Our people are spread across the globe, bringing energy marketing and trading experience, a wealth of market knowledge and a deep understanding of supply chains that allow us to innovate and develop tailored energy solutions and products, while also helping our customers decarbonise their businesses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy has significant growth ambitions over the coming years. In order to meet our company’s growth and decarbonisation targets, we are embarking on a major foundational programme of work to modernise our <b>Energy Trading Risk Management System<\u002Fb> (ETRM) platform. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>This multi-year programme will initially involve the replacement of old, legacy ETRM systems in Europe and North America. Our intent is to implement new cloud hosted (Azure) <b>Endur <\u002Fb>systems, utilising the latest in stream data technologies and system integration and connectivity methodologies. At the same time, we need to support our growing Asian and Australian gas and power businesses and our world leading LNG trading businesses by sustaining and enhancing our current version 19 Endur system.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for ETRM specialists seeking a significant challenge and an opportunity to grow their careers as part of a team intent on pushing the boundaries of ETRM systems. That team sits at the core of an industry leading organisation at the very heart of the energy transition; helping to ensure a brighter future for everyone.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Lead Endur Business Analyst you will be aligned to a specific commodity (Power, Gas or Environmental Products) and\u002For a specific functional area (for example, Front, Middle or Back-Office).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Joining at the start of this ambitious programme you would work with business and IT stakeholders to define the scope and shape of the to-be solution. You would lead the identification and documentation of business requirements, working with technical teams to determine feasible solution options. You will then lead the business analysis activities for your workstream through to delivery.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your role will vary depending on the specific area of expertise, however typically you would perform the following day to day activities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Planning, delivery, and assurance of your workstreams business analysis deliverables<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Driving and managing scope and design for a workstream, including assessing the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Point of escalation for issues within your workstream<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coaching and mentoring of the wider business analysis team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generating innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stakeholder management - building relationships with key stakeholders, keeping them informed and managing expectations<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What you will bring<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Business Analysis \u002F Project Delivery Experience<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Track record of end-to-end project lifecycle delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in shaping processes and solutions, including capturing business problems, value drivers, and functional\u002Fnon-functional requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong leadership, sound analytical skills and change management capabilities,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstratable stakeholder management skills, working with stakeholders at different levels in the organization and confidant providing legitimate challenge<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience performing a quality assurance role on workstream deliverables<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working in Agile project delivery<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Energy Trading Experience<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience of energy trading markets, with a strong understanding of one of the following markets considered an advantage:\n    <ul>\n     <li> European Power, European Gas and\u002For Environmental products<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> A working knowledge of different trading instruments, including:\n    <ul>\n     <li> OTC transactions – Including forwards, swaps, and simple options<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Exchange traded futures &amp; options lifecycle including cascading<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Detailed knowledge of at least one of the following functional areas:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Trade capture - complex deal modelling and pricing<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Market Risk<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Risk Valuation<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Back-Office processes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Accounting processes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Migrating between ETRM systems<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> As a Lead BA you’ll have SME knowledge of either one the commodities or one of the functional areas detailed above to allow you to lead the workstream<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> ETRM\u002FCTRM experience<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> The ideal candidate will have ETRM\u002FCTRM experience<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Endur skills are considered an advantage, however this is not essential as this programme will provide a fantastic opportunity to build or grow skills in this area<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Hands-on configuration experience of vendor applications is also considered an advantage<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>We are seeking a talented and motivated individual to join the team as Fundamental Analyst in the Gas Fundamental Analytics Team, part of the Market Analysis unit within Shell Energy Europe and Environmental Products.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Gas Fundamental Analytics Team generate trading ideas based on fundamental research and data analysis to add value directly to the bottom line of the trading business. Analysts build detailed fundamental supply and demand models, create forecasting and visualisation tools and maintain gas fundamental data. The team coordinates with other analytics teams within SE-EE and across the group to share market insights across different commodities and geographies.<br> <br> Trading is a fast paced and dynamic work environment necessitating timely and commercially relevant analysis. Markets are constantly developing and changing, responding in interrelated way to developments not just in supply &amp; demand, but also global macroeconomic conditions and regulation. Candidates need to be comfortable handling uncertainty and working under time pressure. The rewards are a transparent ability to directly impact the bottom line of the company, and a diverse range of challenges which offer significant scope for personal development.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Building supply and demand models to perform fundamental analysis of the European gas market at a high level of precision and detail, covering production, transport, storage and consumption across different tenors and geographical locations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Development of predictive forecasting models using various quantitative and qualitative methods<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Development of analytical tools and processes to standardize, improve and automate existing analysis, and to expand the current reach of gas analytics, in collaboration with IT<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Written reporting and verbal presentation of analytical results<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ad hoc project work in support of gas traders<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will require:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Degree in a numerate and analytically focused discipline e.g. maths, sciences, engineering, finance, economics.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prior experience in an analytical or quantitative function<\u002Fli>\n   <li> An ability to communicate complex information effectively and succinctly<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative approach to problem solving as part of a team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In addition, knowledge of traded markets, the European energy system, and programming skills in SQL and Python would be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative oil and gas company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Join the global leader of business mobility!<br> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Are you willing to shape Shell’s energy transition by accelerating our customer’s journey to e-mobility? Do you want to co-create the ‘Amazon of business mobility’? Are you a leader that is looking for personal development in a rapidly transforming environment? Would you like to be part of a business that continues to grow year on year, with significant contribution to Shell’s bottom line?<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> If your answer is YES to all above, this is what we’re offering\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The largest B2B direct customer base in Shell Downstream (200k B2B customers) in 47 markets<\u002Fli>\n    <li>One of the largest payment platforms in the world<\u002Fli>\n    <li>A suite of business mobility offers from secure energy payment, over mobility services (e.g. VAT reclaim, toll clearing or parking) to vehicle solutions (e.g. maintenance, leasing) for passenger car and light duty transport vehicles (less than 16 tons)<\u002Fli>\n    <li>A passion for helping customers in their mobility needs and challenging them to find fit-for-purpose solutions together<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Roles that provide unmatched personal growth opportunities<\u002Fli>\n    <li>A fantastic, positive, team environment with the passion to deliver this growth challenge<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> This is what we are looking for<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> “Let’s do it!” mentality, with strong positive attitude<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Passion about customers - how to delight them, how to help them<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Curiosity and courage to understand customers’ real needs and to challenge them to offer the right solutions<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Commercial drive to make $ today and more $s tomorrow<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Genuine curiosity and interest in e-mobility, payment and mobility solutions.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Innovative mind to always be ahead of competition;<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Learner mindset, daring to fall and get up again stronger and quickly<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Grit - never, ever give up.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>A team player with all parts of the E2E supply chain, including Operations, our partners across the company<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you are keen on accelerating the energy transition for our Fleet customers and you want to build something special with us… we want to hear from you<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Head of Fleet Solutions (HoFS) is part of Retail and focuses on selling fuels, services and mobility solutions to all B2B customers via the Shell Card.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of the Head of Fleet Solutions UK role is to lead and develop the Shell Fleet Solutions Sales team in UK to grow Fleet Solutions business through selling mobility solutions (fuels and services via the Shell card through direct and indirect channels and to deliver financial and volume targets, whilst striving towards Goal Zero.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the HoFS for UK, you will have multi- channel and multi-layer leadership responsibility for a total team of appr. 19 FTEs (Sales, Marketing, Business Development). The role includes a broad cross functional responsibility in order to deliver the business results as well as investing in the future growth of the business, through close collaboration with customer operations, finance, marketing, Shell Recharge Solutions and Retail B2C business (Mobility)<\u002Fp>\n  <p> It is an exciting time to join this business with Energy Transition and Digitalisation. The mobility market-place is rapidly changing because of this and Shell is in a great place to leverage from it with our product offering and therefore bringing this to our customers. UK Market is responding to energy transition very strongly, with Fuel demand for passenger cars and light-medium commercial vehicles decreasing y.o.y ca 4% and replaced by EV\u002F Hybrid vehicles. Electrification is supported by the UK government to reduce the CO2 emissions caused by ICE-vehicles.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> In Shell Fleet Solutions, with our Accelerate to Zero programme, we help our customers reduce their Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) and be on-track to deliver their net 0 CO2 targets. This would mean monetizing the new CVPs to decarbonize our customers while we continue to bring digital mobility solutions, next to the traditional fuels business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key accountabilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Ensure full adherence to Fleet Solutions HSSE plan and Shell Ethics and Compliance framework (ie Code of Conduct, Competition law, Antitrust and Sales Contract Management framework, etc).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Beat annual financial and business targets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead further implementation of UK 2025 SFS Strategy and deliver relevant CVPs in each segment to continue to grow the customer base and the business; set fees, discounts, payment terms in line with the OU Manual of Authorities and country strategy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Closely collaborate with Regional Pricing Manager for setting the List price for National and International customers, recruit, develop and coach a winning and diverse B2B sales team by demonstrating Sales leadership and being a role model in Sales 1st behaviors and activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Implement Sales 1st: Sales coaching, pipeline development with the support of Salesforce; work as an authentic coach for team and a credible consultant to channel partners for accelerated growth.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead the Route to Market (RTM) Strategy supported by the marketing team, and implement of the Channel strategy, Marketing plans and the T&amp;R.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead and drive collaboration with Retail B2C, Shell Recharge Solutions, Customer Operations, T&amp;S and all support Functions (finance, HR, credit, legal) to ensure maximum value for Shell and provide the right level of service to customers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the development of innovative and complex CVPs to be able to move from a supplier to a partner relationship in a value-led environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify and drive delivery of Continuous Improvement (CI) solutions at Shell and at our customers premises.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from You<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> As Head of Fleet Solutions, you act in a fast developing and fast changing environment with regards to decarbonization (e-mobility) and digitalization. For that role acts as “change agent” ensuring that the entire team is an integral part of that journey.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure business ethics gets into the DNA of the indirect channel team &amp; indirect business partners<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and gain knowledge of market new trends and competitive intelligence initiatives in order to better understand competitors offers, strengths and weaknesses in global and local Marketing Departments to identify create new Cards RVP and CVP's to grow the business.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Passion to meet and beat targets and to grow customer base and value<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deep understanding of value generation, financial dimensions (P&amp;L) and risk evaluation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Help the team to manage complex customers aiming to sell full CVP package<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Apply all Sales 1st Coach-the-Coach Standards for developing the team and the business (all channels &amp; roles)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Mastery in Insight-, Value- and Challenger Selling<\u002Fli>\n   <li> High capabilities in understanding and analyzing market trends and bring those in line with our decarbonization ambition and ecosystems<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute to market and competitive intelligence initiatives in order to better understand competitors offers, strengths and weaknesses to identify and create growth opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Closely working with internal &amp; external decarbonization experts and helping to developing strategies for accelerated business growth, as well as identifying potential customer needs in order to offer tailormade solutions and to win market share.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Readiness for business travel and overnight hotel stays<\u002Fli>\n   <li> English (fluent), IT skills (CRM, Excel, Power Point, Retail BI, Power BI etc), Driver’s license<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This job offers a challenging opportunity to be part of a trading team in a fast moving, dynamic and successful trading company.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Derivatives Trader (CERT) is part of the team that is accountable for almost all financial trading (futures, swaps, options) interface of Shell LNG Marketing &amp; Trading organization. The desk services hedging requests from the physical SLMT Trading desks in Singapore, Dubai, and The Hague, and some other Shell affiliates. In addition, the desk trades for its own account.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Trades are on a range of underlying indices; in particular, but not limited to Brent, Henry Hub Natgas and European Gas (NBP, TTF), JCC (Japanese crude cocktail) and JKM (Japan \u002F Korea Marker for LNG). Also, the desk provides advice to others in SLMT with regards to exposure management, pricing formulae, and market views.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities\u002FResponsibilities include but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Proprietary trading and generate return on Value at Risk (VAR).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute trades to service all requests of other SLMT trading desks for derivatives and offer 1st class execution of trades.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures compliance with Regulations, Governance, Risk and Assurance policies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and maintain relationships with large number of trading counterparties including internal, external counterparts and brokers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advise SLMT LNG Trading desks with regards to books hedging, pricing and market views.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evolve and implement tactical plans covering day to day trading for profit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage FX exposure generated by non-USD based trades.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop Options Trading in SLMT as Risk Management tool and as value driver.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> As part of the team be accountable for delivery of annual business targets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good expertise in risks management tools and technique.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of regulatory rules and policies with a good compliance track record.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge of derivatives markets, fundamental and technical analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to perform under pressure with no errors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High numeracy with good analytical capability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very good communication and relationship management skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good to expert product knowledge in at least one of the following instruments (JKM, Crude, European Gas, US Gas) a strong plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of option pricing and trading. Quantitative background and expert knowledge a strong plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Derivatives execution experience with strong familiarity with T&amp;S ETRMS (DEX\u002FENDUR) a strong plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This job offers a challenging opportunity to be part of a trading team in a fast moving, dynamic and successful trading company.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Derivatives Trader (CERT) is part of the team that is accountable for almost all financial trading (futures, swaps, options) interface of Shell LNG Marketing &amp; Trading organization. The desk services hedging requests from the physical SLMT Trading desks in Singapore, Dubai, and The Hague, and some other Shell affiliates. In addition, the desk trades for its own account.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Trades are on a range of underlying indices; in particular, but not limited to Brent, Henry Hub Natgas and European Gas (NBP, TTF), JCC (Japanese crude cocktail) and JKM (Japan \u002F Korea Marker for LNG). Also, the desk provides advice to others in SLMT with regards to exposure management, pricing formulae, and market views.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities\u002FResponsibilities include but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Proprietary trading and generate return on Value at Risk (VAR).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute trades to service all requests of other SLMT trading desks for derivatives and offer 1st class execution of trades.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensures compliance with Regulations, Governance, Risk and Assurance policies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and maintain relationships with large number of trading counterparties including internal, external counterparts and brokers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advise SLMT LNG Trading desks with regards to books hedging, pricing and market views.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evolve and implement tactical plans covering day to day trading for profit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage FX exposure generated by non-USD based trades.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop Options Trading in SLMT as Risk Management tool and as value driver.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> As part of the team be accountable for delivery of annual business targets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good expertise in risks management tools and technique.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of regulatory rules and policies with a good compliance track record.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge of derivatives markets, fundamental and technical analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to perform under pressure with no errors.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> High numeracy with good analytical capability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very good communication and relationship management skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good to expert product knowledge in <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The UK Short Term Power Trading team forms part of the European Power trading organisation. The Operations Analyst is part of a team which is responsible for supporting the commercial and operational management of SE-EE (Shell Energy Europe &amp; Environmental) power activities in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The SE-EE power portfolio is an industry leading mix of remotely operated distributed generation assets, flexible renewable generation, and algorithmically controlled storage assets. The UK Short Term Power Team was the first team to ever control aggregated generation units in the UK Balancing Market and the first team to ever control storage assets via the use of algorithms. The team continues to be the market leader in terms of short-term optimisation of physical assets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Remotely operating assets in the UK power portfolio.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting the Trader to optimise portfolio using physical assets, wholesale market trading and balancing market trading.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure compliance with customer asset restrictions such as emissions limits, running hours and availability.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for the accurate nomination and physical scheduling of remote power assets including batteries, gas reciprocating engines, offshore wind and CCGTs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for ensuring Shell HSSE standards are maintained throughout all remote physical asset instructions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor UK Balancing Market and ensure all data facing the system operator is updated accurately and in a timely manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maximise commercial opportunity by competitive pricing in the Balancing Mechanism.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor performance of all assets\u002Fcontracts and liaise with customer where necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is an evolving role as part of the expansion of power trading within Shell, as such the processes and procedures change rapidly which requires team members to keep appraised on areas that affect their operational activities. Part of the role will be in liaising with the on-call power operations desk to deliver additional value and work towards building one cohesive and aligned gas and power trading team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position is for a role as part of the UK Short Term Power Trading team, the role involves working outside of normal office hours, including weekends and bank holidays.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Along with a numerical degree, we hope to see the following in your CVs:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge of European power markets and asset operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working knowledge of relevant power codes and the implications on physical asset trading<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experienced user of IT systems, skilled in MS office and preferably the ability to write basic programming code.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-starter, able to effectively multi-task<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very strong attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to assimilate large amounts of data quickly and make informed decisions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability and confidence to take ownership of issues, managing to resolution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent analytical skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commercially focused individual able to demonstrate delivering additional value.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to work accurately in a fast-paced and pressured environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be flexible, working as part of a shift team in London.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>This is an exciting opportunity for you to be part of the Hydrogen Industry organization. This is a key role to realize our hydrogen ambition. We are looking for someone who is curious, collaborative, pragmatic, highly motivated, seeks challenge, driven, committed to improvement, and highly determined.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell regards hydrogen as the enabler for deep renewable energy penetration, distribution, and system resilience while at the same time contribute to the decarbonization of the “hard to abate” sectors.<br> <br> Shell Hydrogen is fast growing to develop the business and deliver opportunities. Shell needs to be a first mover to make and shape the industrial market for clean hydrogen that ultimately creates value for Shell.<br> <br> Shell Hydrogen cherishes a learner mindset, entrepreneurial attitude and cooperation across teams and lines of businesses. We work closely with Power and Gas Trading, Downstream, Renewable Generation, CCUS, Project &amp; Technology, in-country teams, Policy and Advocacy, and functions to develop customer backed clean H2 industrial value chains.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the Hydrogen Value Chain Structurer, you will be part of the Hydrogen Industry organization, and report to Hydrogen Value Chain Structuring Lead.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Hydrogen Value Chain Structuring team within H2 Industry is a commercial function accountable for the valuation and risk assessment of H2 business opportunities that takes ownership of the valuation and deal management methodology. The main activity of the Hydrogen Value Chain Structuring team is close collaboration with originators to develop business opportunities that add value and to support growth of the portfolio within the H2 Industry across the globe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To support the growing activities of the business, the Hydrogen Value Chain Structuring team is looking for a Value Chain Structurer who combines the quantitative and analytical skill set with a commercial mindset and the ability to manage a complex stakeholder environment across Shell. The role requires an agile, creative mind and strong work ethic to keep pace with the market developments.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities for the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The main responsibility of the role is to collaborate with the business developers and support the growth of the portfolio, while being accountable for the methodology of the valuation and risk assessment of business transactions.<br> <br> You will have a key role in developing the business through integrating the end-to-end value chain for both green and blue hydrogen opportunities globally. At any point in time, you will be working on multiple opportunities in parallel and be exposed to external counterparties. You will be part of a multi-disciplinary team (local and internationally based) whilst contributing to a culture underscored by HSSE, diversity and inclusiveness and a learner mind set.<br> <br> You will work closely with colleagues across Shell to advance a local customer backed hydrogen business.<br> <br> This includes:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Understanding of the green value chain from renewable power to green hydrogen production to supplying to customers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Producing ideas and structure for power procurement pricing, H2 market pricing<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Developing H2 value chain exposure analysis<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Producing ideas and structures to integrate and optimize the value chain for each opportunity in hydrogen industry funnel<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and own valuation methods and models for pricing and risk assessment of business opportunities. Identify value drivers and risks inherent in the H2 value chain transactions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interfacing with other Shell’s teams to optimize power and hydrogen integrated value chain opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to speak from individuals with extensive commercial analysis and structuring experience. You’ll also call on your bachelor’s or master’s degree in Economics, Business, Finance, Engineering, or similar fields with high numeracy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Thorough understanding of the evolving power market, renewable energy certificates and regulatory framework<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent analytical \u002F financial skills, business acumen, and demonstrated achievement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in financial modelling\u002F commercial analysis\u002Fstructuring\u002F risk management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong quantitative skills, with attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perseverance and ability to cultivate strong positive working relationships internally and externally to get things done<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement and relationship building skills, as well as the ability to achieve results through influencing others.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Credibility and respect with internal and external industrial stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Pragmatic, capable of working with a wide range of people and work activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Comfortable operating in a semi-structured environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Capable of handling different tasks in parallel<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Programming skills e.g. Python is beneficial<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Head of Compliance Strategy and Delivery, the Project Delivery Specialist is a member of the Strategy &amp; Delivery team within Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Compliance. You will be a key enabler in the delivery of T&amp;S Compliance second Line of Defence (LoD2) projects and strategic initiatives to enhance to the overall T&amp;S Compliance Framework, the digitalisation of global T&amp;S Compliance processes, and supporting projects under the Risk Portfolio Board programme of work delivered by the T&amp;S business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Compliance Delivery team is a group of highly driven Compliance professionals focussed on using their broad knowledge of Compliance frameworks, risks and controls to deliver solutions to enhance the T&amp;S Compliance Framework. The projects within the portfolio will range from initiatives to continually review and improve Compliance tools, processes and data to implementation of new regulatory requirements and integration of new T&amp;S businesses \u002F acquisitions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Use your compliance risk expertise to support the team in establishing a projects pipeline in alignment with overall T&amp;S Compliance strategy and priorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with the functional teams to identify and scope strategic, operational, or tactical solutions to complex issues in order better manage Compliance risk or enhance operational efficiency.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide input into project prioritisation process for compliance or regulatory projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver a portfolio of projects using a combination of other permanent resources within the team, flexible contractor \u002F consultant resources and Subject Matter Experts from within the rest of the Compliance team. This will require you to use their broad knowledge of compliance frameworks, risks, and controls to:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Capture compliance functional team risk issues, value drivers and high-level requirements to define the problem statement and obtain buy-in for each project from a diverse and senior stakeholder community.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Define scope and compliance team outcomes of any project as well as delivery approach with resource, timeline and budget (factoring in any interdependencies with other compliance projects and BAU deliverables).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Establish fit for purpose governance to ensure each project delivers against its objectives, has effective decision-making processes and maintains senior stakeholder support.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Assess risks, feasibility, opportunities and compliance team impacts of various solution options.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Partner with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver each project to plan and budget.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Effectively manage and report on status, risks and issues within each project, with escalation as needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Transition project deliverables into compliance functional teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Capture and share successes and learnings to enhance future projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain strong and collaborative working relationships with a wide range of stakeholders across the wider T&amp;S Compliance team, T&amp;S businesses, IT and external 3rd parties as needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate and represent Shell in external working groups in efforts to ensure best practices for Compliance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide advice and support of more junior Delivery team resources.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Along with your bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or equivalent work experience, we hope to see the following in your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n outside of a direct of reporting line and remain focused and productive under pressure and recover quickly from setbacks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Robust written and verbal communication skills
