following:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Accountable for all work performed and delivered for the respective process Areas.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for timely delivery of Change requests, Data requests, Incidents and Requests, as per business needs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Rich Skillsets in SAP Functional &amp; Technical Skills for supporting Projects and Enhancements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Regular Reporting to Competency Centre Lead.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Connect with Business excellence, Information Management and Information Technology, Service Operation Management, and Project organizations to ensure collaboration and to add values to overall Shell business success.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good communication sills across other Team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Functional Analyst, you would need to have the following expertise and skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Substantial experience SAP Materials Management &amp; Warehouse Management areas<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven domain exposure in Procurement, preferably in Service, Manufacturing, or Oil and Gas Industries<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Hands on MM Functional with WM &amp; cross functional SD<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good exposure in setting up and work with Workflow and interfaces<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good exposure for Invoice processing &amp; Accounts Payable<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Awareness in Basic ABAP with good knowledge on S4\u002FHANA<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Certification in S4 HANA - Procurement Process - is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a member of the Commercial department in Shell UK Upstream, you will have the opportunity to shape the future and create long term value for the Group, building on our existing oil and gas business and driving towards a cleaner energy portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Commercial department provides commercial support to both the operated and non-operated oil and gas business, pursues Mergers and Acquisitions activities, drives energy transition projects and provides economic analysis across the asset and projects portfolio. As an integral part of the Commercial department, the Economics team (8 persons strong) provides economics support for all aspects of the UK Upstream business: capital investments, commercial negotiations, business planning and reserves reporting.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As an Upstream and Energy Transition Economist you will:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Act as a core member of multi-disciplinary teams, contributing to quality conversations by integrating valuation assumptions in decision analysis and delivering value insights to decision makers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver commercially sound, accurate, timely and fit-for-purpose economic analysis that supports efficient and effective decision making (including appropriate Risk and Uncertainty analysis).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> When necessary, modify, build and assure new economic models to cope with changes in business models and\u002For commercial architecture.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support and influence the preparation of commercial negotiating strategies and other external submissions as required by the business.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead or provide economics support to the business planning and reserves reporting processes for your assigned assets \u002F projects across the Economics team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support strategy work and Energy Transition \u002F New Business \u002F Exploration activities as required.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> We have multiple roles for candidates with varying levels of relevant experience. <\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Substantial Upstream or Energy Transition experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prior commercial \u002F valuation experience. Demonstrable expertise in constructing and developing discounted cashflow models will be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong numeracy skills – able to pay attention to detail whilst not losing sight of the bigger picture.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performance focus – performs with a high degree of independence and delivers as promised.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stakeholder management skills – manages the balance between support and challenge.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integration – willing to lead and integrate across functions to solve problems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continuous improvement – always seeking to improve, displays a learner mindset.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven leadership skills. Able to build an environment where care, diversity and inclusion are at the core.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Introduction<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the growing global energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. In our Powering Progress strategy, we have set a target to become a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050 and to provide reliable electricity to 100 million people in Africa and Asia by 2030 to those who do not yet have it.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we believe in the value of developing a diverse workforce of bright and creative minds from a wide range of backgrounds where every voice is heard equally. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where anyone can express their ideas, extend your skills, and reach their potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender and ethnicity pay gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay, by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology or by equipping our diverse talent with development opportunities to further progress in their career.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation, ethnicity, or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The UK Short Term Power Trading team forms part of the European Power trading organisation. The Shift Trader is part of a 24-hour shift team which is responsible for the commercial and operational management of SE-EA’s (Shell Energy Europe &amp; Africa) power activities in the UK and Netherlands.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The SE-EA power portfolio is an industry leading mix of remotely operated generation assets, flexible renewable generation (primarily wind and solar), and algorithmically controlled battery storage assets. The UK Power Shift Trading Team was the first team to ever control aggregated generation units in the GB’s balancing market and the first team to ever control storage assets via the use of algorithms. The team continues to be the market leader in terms of short-term optimisation of physical assets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Physical optimisation of the UK and Netherlands power portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Trading to deliver material P&amp;L from the portfolio using physical assets, wholesale market trading and balancing market trading<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure compliance with contractual customer obligations, alongside REMIT and Transmission Constraint License Condition (TCLC) and other Shell policies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the accurate trade allocation, nomination and physical scheduling of remote power assets including batteries, gas reciprocating engines, offshore wind and CCGTs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for ensuring Shell HSSE standards are maintained throughout all remote physical asset instructions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor power and gas markets, short term fundamental supply\u002Fdemand and SE-EE portfolio balances<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimise exposure to imbalances where appropriate<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support development of commercial opportunities with SE-EE Business Development and Limejump<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor the actions of algorithmic trading strategies in both UK and NL<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is an evolving role as part of the expansion of power trading within Shell, as such the processes and procedures change rapidly which requires team members to keep appraised on areas that affect their operational activities. The role involves working outside of normal office hours including weekends, bank holidays and overnight.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Along with a numerical degree, we hope to see the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience trading on exchanges and using an ETRM including a qualification to trade UK power on EPEX<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience managing assets in the UK Balancing Mechanism<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experienced user of IT systems, skilled in MS office and preferably the ability to write programming code<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Self-starter, able to effectively multi-task<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Very strong attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent analytical skills, with an ability to assimilate large amounts of data quickly and make informed decisions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Track record of managing risk and delivering profit<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability and confidence to take ownership of issues, managing to resolution<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Commercially focused individual able to demonstrate delivering additional value<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to work accurately in a fast-paced and pressured environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good knowledge of European power markets and asset operations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working knowledge of relevant power codes and the implications on physical asset trading<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Be flexible, working as part of a 24\u002F7 shift team in London<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Are you passionate about innovation? Do you want to play a part in accelerating the energy transition? If yes, please read on…<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Information and Digital Technology (IDT) Strategy Centre of Excellence is a team of experienced strategy consulting professionals within Shell. We work globally, across the entire Shell group, developing leading-edge IT and digital strategies to address our most critical business transformation challenges, and deliver Shell’s future as a net-zero emissions energy organisation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The strategies that we work on are extremely varied in nature. These could include IT and digital strategy development in support of new revenue streams, new business models, new\u002Fchanged business capabilities or innovative new technologies to enable the energy transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are seeking experienced IT and Digital Strategy Consultants to join our team to both shape and deliver leading-edge strategies, and to help build and develop a growing team across the UK and Netherlands.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> The role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be joining a talented team that is focused on business transformation: looking at ways IT and digital can drive both Shell’s business performance and the energy transition. Your experience in strategy consultancy means that you excel at navigating broad business and technology strategy issues and are confident operating in a complex IT environment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will act as a facilitator, consultant, and advisor to senior IT and business leaders and will work in multi-disciplinary project teams, to define bold, value driven IT and digital strategies.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Working well under pressure, you bring structure and clarity to unstructured problem statements. You analyse business strategy and goals, technology portfolios, trends and innovations in the market and understand and synthesize the dynamic landscape your internal clients operate in. This allows you to work towards strategic insights and provide your clients with structured and actionable advice, such as technology investment roadmaps, new customer products and innovation opportunities, backed up by a solid dataset and business case.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your excellent communication skills will be crucial, to create clear and impactful strategies and importantly your facilitation skills to bring people together and collaborate.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We would like to hear from talented IT and\u002For digital strategy consultants who have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in IT or digital strategy consulting, working on complex strategy projects within large organisations, preferably with a top-tier consulting firm<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of working internationally, within multi-national organisations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills; ability to collect, understand, model data quickly and effectively<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong communications skills, with the ability to bring clarity to complex problems, nurture stakeholder relationships and work in highly collaborative teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good understanding of frameworks and approaches to facilitate strategic problem solving and collaborative strategy development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Awareness of business strategy methods: from research and industry challenges to business direction and problem solving<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Business and technical acumen: including business models, operating models, M&amp;A, business value metrics and enterprise architectures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entrepreneurial spirit to continuously improve team working practices and increase team effectiveness<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent academic record including a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell is looking for candidates that are passionate about the energy transition and have a track record of successful Finance partnering in Solar, Offshore wind\u002FOnshore wind, Hydrogen and Energy Solutions space. We are seeking candidates for the role of Finance Advisor to be part of a dynamic and collaborative Renewable &amp; Energy Solutions team supporting ambitious growth targets for Shell to be a leading player in the energy transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Finance Advisor reports into the Finance Manager in Renewables &amp; Energy Solutions Europe. The role provides financial leadership and support across the whole finance spectrum from Deal Delivery through implementation and Join Venture\u002Fcontract governance. Areas of focus in deal delivery include deal structuring, tax, treasury, accounting, ownership of valuation output; credit and market risk. We focus on new fuels for transport, such as hydrogen and charging for battery-electric vehicles, power, which includes investment low-carbon sources such as on and offshore wind and solar, nature-based solutions, and ventures.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combining your knowledge of commercial drivers the role can challenge strategic rationale and integrate important financial analytics and insights into business decision-making. Advisor will work independently with the business in shaping deals, commercial decision making, risk management, implementation, operations, and performance management.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Finance business partner in Organic\u002FInorganic Renewables opportunities in Europe<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accountable for deal valuation, including assessment and framing of value and risk of full opportunity. Work with Valuation teams for modelling of investment opportunities and development projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support business development PPA (Power Purchase Agreements) origination activities through the creation and maintenance of PPA tender models.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the preparation and present decision materials in connection with tenders, auctions, and Mergers &amp; Acquisition activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Influence project outcome by ensuring value and risks are made transparent and understood in both decision making and in performance management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring budgets and performance management tools in place to allow for strong decision quality.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaising with the many different stakeholders and helping to bridge the gap between finance and the rest of the business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates who have a Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Masters degree or Professional Qualification in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Business preferred.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience, ideally within Power, Renewable energy sectors in either a project development or banking setting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficient and experienced in working in Excel with discounted cash flow valuation, risk modelling, and impact on accounts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A curious and can-do attitude, with demonstrated ability to influence and constructively challenge.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to effectively manage multiple stakeholders, internally and externally, and strong interpersonal skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent collaboration and communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven track record of delivering complex projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continuous Improvement mindset essential<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Some travel may be required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n As a Senior Business Analyst, you will identify and define the business needs of their clients and stakeholders whilst helping to determine solutions to meet business needs or resolve business problems. The role may be part of an IT project development environment or an individual contributor at the business interface.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will work as part of a global team in the IDT (Information &amp; Digital Technology) organization. IDT drives business value through providing world class technical, functional, and consulting expertise to deliver the right skills, at the right time.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You would be joining a company where technical talent, growing careers, developing leading edge skills, and deepening Shell business knowledge is a high priority. You would bring your business analysis and domain skills to join our IT team in the UK working as one team together with other Shell IT hubs globally (Bangalore, Houston, Netherlands).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Senior Business Analyst, you will support the Design Engineering Capability working in projects for various Shell business units such as Chemicals &amp; Products, Sectors &amp; Decarbonization, Lubricants, Business to Business(B2B), Shell Energy, Trading &amp; Supply, Acquisition &amp; Divestment, Retail, Finance and Capital products. You will experience a great opportunity to participate in delivering IT solutions in support of Shell’s Energy transformation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Come and join a team, who are committed to delivering excellence and value to the business. You will have opportunities to invest in your skill development and career growth. You would be working alongside IT professionals who love what they do and enjoy sharing their knowledge, skills, and enthusiasm. Many opportunities will be available to learn and explore, building up new areas of expertise and different business domains.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> You would lead the identification and documentation of business requirements, working with technical teams to determine feasible solution options. You would actively manage the requirements through the end-to-end solution delivery lifecycle to developing handover and expertise to the support team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Your role will vary depending on the projects in your portfolio, typically you would perform the following day to day activities:<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for the successful planning and delivery of the project(s) business analysis methods, tools, and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for assuring functional design, resolves technical design issues and is accountable for solution design decision making.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Acts as product SME for the associated delivery teams, developing a position as trusted advisor.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Close alignment with Business and IT Manager teams to align on product roadmap, demand pipeline, capacity, and capability requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to coach and mentor wider business analysis team - playing a key role in elevating the overall capabilities around the Business domain and product knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide leadership to the teams and be responsible for each team members development plan and performance management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Point of escalation for issues which adversely affect systems performance, design, or functionalities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong leadership, sound analytical skill and change management capabilities to work independently on transformation, improvement initiatives, liaising effectively with senior stakeholders and vendors on complex problems etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Describe technology in terms easily understood by business customers and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with stakeholders to build trust and understand their goals, motivations, constraints, risks, and operating environment<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What you will bring<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive IT experience and substantial IT BA Experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ideally knowledge of Commodity Trading and deal life cycle<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of ETRM Systems and\u002For Front Office &amp; Back Office Processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience of using Business Analysis techniques and tools with significant experience in project deliverables including the ability to:<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Precisely capture business problems, value drivers, and functional\u002Fnon-functional requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working in Agile project Delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in managing complex data and analysis<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working in geographically distributed teams<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> About Shell<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development program. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalization and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> An innovative place to work<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b><i>Are you an experienced IT and\u002For Digital Strategy Consultant with top-tier Consulting experience? Are you passionate about innovation? Do you want to play a part in accelerating the energy transition? If yes, please read on… <\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Information and Digital Technology (IDT) Strategy Consulting Centre of Excellence is a team of experienced information and digital technology strategy consulting professionals within Shell. We work across the entire Shell Group, developing leading-edge IT and digital strategies for our Businesses in support of Shell’s future as a net-zero emissions energy organisation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We work closely with business, IT and digital leaders across our organisation and focus on our most complex business transformation challenges.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The IT and digital strategies that we work on are extremely varied in nature. These could include (but are not limited to) IT and digital strategy development in support of; new revenue streams, new business models, new\u002Fchanged business capabilities or innovative new technologies in support of delivering the energy transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> We’re seeking Senior IT and Digital Strategy Consultants to join our CoE leadership team to both shape and deliver leading-edge strategies, and to help build and develop a growing team across the UK and Netherlands.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> You will be working within a talented team that is focused on complex projects, new business and IT domains, looking at ways IT and digital can drive both Shell’s business performance and the energy transition. Your experience in IT and Digital strategy consulting means you enjoy working on leading-edge technology strategies and are confident working in a complex and challenging IT context.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You are well versed in using structured problem-solving techniques and - acting as a facilitator, advisor, and consultant - will support the shaping and development of long-term IT and digital strategies across the different Shell businesses, allowing our most senior decision makers to create business value and set our future direction.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Working well under pressure, you will help shape and structure unstructured problem statements, analyse Business strategy and goals, existing technology portfolios, review trends and innovations in the market and understand and synthesize the dynamic landscape your internal clients operate in. This allows you to work towards strategic insights and provide your clients with structured and actionable advice, such as technology investment roadmaps, identification of new customer Products and Services, and\u002For partnering\u002Finnovation opportunities, backed up by a solid dataset and business case.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your excellent people skills will be crucial here, as you nurture stakeholder relationships at every level to influence and drive our strategies, and importantly your facilitation skills to bring people together and collaborate on bold strategies.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will also act as a leader and mentor in supporting skills development of our more junior resources across the CoE.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from applicants who have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, preferably in IT and\u002For Management, along with experience in senior IT or Digital Strategy Consulting roles, and knowledge of digital technologies. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Extensive experience in IT or Digital Strategy Consulting, working on complex strategy projects within large organisations, preferably with a top-tier consulting firm<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leadership of teams, people development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working internationally, within a multi-national organisation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills; ability to collect, understand and model data quickly and effectively.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding frameworks and approaches to facilitate strategic problem solving and collaborative strategy development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge of business strategy, from data analysis and industry challenges, to business direction and problem solving.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong understanding of the terminology, metrics, and calculations relevant to business-specific measures and KPIs, such as return on investment (ROI), stakeholder value, benefits realization and capability improvement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong communications skills, with the ability to work within a team that’s collaborative and customer-centric, and nurture relationships with a range of stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p>Shell is working with our customers and across sectors to accelerate the transition to net-zero emissions. This requires development of new business opportunities, including onshore and offshore renewable power generation, and development of new technologies and technology areas. Integrated, flexible grids are key, and an important area of focus is the assessment and development of concepts and technologies for power transmission and distribution. This has close links to the generation and direct use of renewable power, and to the conversion of renewable power into molecules for which the key candidate is hydrogen via electrolysis of water. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We welcome highly motivated electrical engineers with experience in the fields of power systems and power electronics to help realize our target to become a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>In Power Technology you will support decarbonization by electrification, and work along a wide range of experts in the different areas of Renewable Power Generation, Electric Mobility, Energy Storage &amp; Integration, and Electrification, with a strong interface with the green hydrogen teams<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>We have multiple roles for candidates of varying levels of relevant experience and can offer flexibility in locations for the right candidates. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The role of the Electrical Engineer Grid Connection Technology will be to support the Wind and Solar Technology Programs to deliver innovations for Shell’s Renewables and Energy Solutions businesses and will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Techno-economic optimization for grid connections for far and large offshore windfarms<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Grid integration design for both AC and DC solutions, with an emphasis on the power quality, power electronics control and overall system dynamic stability under normal and fault conditions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Evaluating options to incorporate storage in renewable power generation assets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Optimizing power conversion in wind and\u002For solar assets for both power and hydrogen export<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support ongoing external technology collaborations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with sector decarbonization projects involving power transmission and distribution<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Sound engineering know-how in the field of electrical engineering, closely collaborating with internal experts and stakeholders:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> A learner mindset showing you are driven to understand, instead of to assume<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven eagerness and ability to build expertise in a fast-evolving area<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong team player whilst also able to act autonomously, in a global\u002Fvirtual team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in contributing to or managing technology development activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to link business drivers to deep technical understanding and vice versa<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A commitment to HSSE especially in design for operability<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for the following range of competencies:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Core Technical competences<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Preferably Ph.D degree (or equivalent) in Electrical engineering and\u002For a Master’s degree (or equivalent). Relevant working experience in power transmission and distribution, renewable power generation and its system integration is a plus or a requirement depending on the position<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of primary\u002Fsecondary power transmission\u002Fdistribution components (e.g. subsea cable\u002FOHL, power transformer, circuit breaker, shunt reactors\u002Fcapacitors, FACTS, HVDC) and their application in the context of renewable generation, power transmission and industrial electrification projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Electrical power system and engineering experience obtained via offshore wind developer, EPC contractor, TSO\u002FDSO, research project or providing consultancy\u002Fengineering service<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Electrical System Design and Studies<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Using Industry-relevant electrical engineering software packages for RMS and EMT modelling (e.g. PSCAD, PSSe, DigSilent) and script-based automation of these (e.g. PYTHON)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performing relevant power system design and engineering studies (e.g. dynamic, harmonic, transient, control stability, protection and control) throughout the life cycle of project development, execution, and operational phases,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Power system component testing and hardware in the loop testing<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Power electronics applications (e.g. wind, solar, FACTS, HVDC, STATCOM) and their interaction with power systems<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Power System Optimization and Digital\u002FProgramming<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Power system planning and operation working with or for TSO\u002FDSOs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Programming or scripting skills (e.g. PYTHON, R, Matlab) and experience with GitHub<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Software engineering experience with both front-end and back-end experience, preferably in the domain of power system engineering<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Artificial Intelligence \u002F Machine Learning model development and life-cycle management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Using cloud services (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and app deployment in cloud environment (e.g. Dash)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Power Electronics and HVDC<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> High power electronics application design, manufacturing, testing, and commissioning obtained via offshore wind developer, EPC contractor, TSO\u002FDSO, research project or providing consultancy\u002Fengineering service<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Rating and design choices for main circuit of power electronics application and its interface to other primary\u002Fsecondary equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Auxiliary circuit design and engineering for power electronics application (e.g. auxiliary power supply, cooling circuit)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Protection\u002Fcontrol design demonstrated in a relevant project\u002Fproduct development environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> HVDC product development, and project development<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Primary\u002FSecondary Equipment Design, Installation, and Commissioning <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Primary\u002Fsecondary component design, manufacturing, testing, and commissioning obtained via offshore wind developer, EPC contractor, TSO\u002FDSO, research project or providing consultancy\u002Fengineering service (AC and\u002For DC Circuit breakers, AC and\u002For DC GIS, AC and\u002For DC power cables, reactive power compensation and associated control and protection)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> QA\u002FQC roles in project\u002Fproduct development environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Power system primary\u002Fsecondary component testing and hardware in the loop testing<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Power electronics applications (e.g. wind, solar, FACTS, HVDC, STATCOM) and their testing and commissioning<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Head of Compliance Strategy and Delivery, the Project Delivery &amp; Strategy Analyst is a member of the Strategy &amp; Delivery team within Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Compliance. You will be a key enabler in the delivery of T&amp;S Compliance second Line of Defence (LoD2) projects and strategic initiatives to enhance to the overall T&amp;S Compliance Framework, the digitalisation of global T&amp;S Compliance processes, and supporting projects under the Risk Portfolio Board programme of work delivered by the T&amp;S business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Compliance Delivery team is a group of highly driven Compliance professionals focussed on using their broad knowledge of Compliance frameworks, risks and controls to deliver solutions to enhance the T&amp;S Compliance Framework. The Project Delivery &amp; Strategy Analyst will provide business analyst support to a range of initiatives and projects which support the development and delivery of the T&amp;S Compliance Strategy to ensure T&amp;S’ regulated businesses are able to meet their regulatory obligations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be expected to work closely with project managers and strategy team members to help:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Define scope and compliance team outcomes of any project as well as delivery approach with resource, timeline and budget (factoring in any interdependencies with other compliance projects and BAU deliverables).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish fit for purpose governance to ensure each project delivers against its objectives, has effective decision-making processes and maintains senior stakeholder support.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capture compliance functional team risk issues, value drivers and high-level requirements to define the problem statement and obtain buy-in for each project from a diverse and senior stakeholder community.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gather and analyse data relating to risks, feasibility, opportunities and compliance team impacts of various solution options.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partner with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver each project to plan and budget, including assisting with change management activities such as transition planning, training and communications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effectively manage and report on status, risks and issues within each project, with escalation as needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Transition project deliverables into compliance functional teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capture and share successes and learnings to enhance future projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Write business plans and strategy reports to communicate T&amp;S Compliance strategy, priorities and performance to senior stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analyse and report on T&amp;S Compliance budget spend and recommend initiatives to optimise bottom line.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Build a board network of internal relationships across T&amp;S Compliance and other functions \u002F T&amp;S businesses as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Along with your bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or equivalent work experience, we hope to see the following in your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in Project Management or Business Analyst type roles in consulting, financial services, trading organisations and regulators.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in creating and maintaining project plans, including risks, actions, issues, dependencies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in documenting processes, pain points and detailed requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Some experience in writing business plans \u002F strategy reports.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Some experience across trading compliance functional domains and knowledge of global financial regulatory compliance requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Some project management, change management and continuous improvement experience would be <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Successful candidate will be accountable for the following: <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Accountable for all work performed and delivered for the respective process areas.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for supporting the Competency Centre (CC) Lead in staffing &amp; operational activities such as resource planning, mobilization, recruitment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with the Natural teams to achieve better collaboration &amp; be a part of driving continuous improvements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Process Adherence, Business Continuity (BC) compliance and participation in Audits.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for timely delivery of Change requests, Data requests, Incidents and Requests, as per business needs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Rich Skillsets in SAP Functional &amp; Technical Skills for supporting Projects and Enhancements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Regular Reporting to CC Lead.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Connect with Business excellence, Information Management and Information Technology (IMIT), Service Operations &amp; Management (SOM) and Project organizations to ensure collaboration and to add values to overall Shell business success.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify and work with Shell Staff and Vendor Partners on Continuous Improvement Initiative.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exploring ways to achieve Cost Savings for the Organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good communication sills across other Team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with extensive experience in SAP MM &amp; WM areas with a knowledge of SAP Workflow and proven domain exposure in Procurement, preferably in Service, Manufacturing, or Oil &amp;Gas Industry.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beyond that, we hope to see as many of the following areas touched by their experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Candidate with a 4-year degree<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Certification in S4 HANA - Procurement Process is a plus.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Hands on MM Functional with WM &amp; cross functional SD.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good exposure in setting up and work with Workflow and interfaces.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good exposure for Invoice processing &amp; Accounts Payable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Awareness in Basic ABAP with good knowledge on S4\u002FHANA.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead a Project with quality deliverables &amp; manage resources.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Customer Operations’ core purpose is to deliver a best-in-market customer experience (CX) and deliver business value at an affordable cost. The Customer Experience Insights Lead sits in Customer Operations. This person will collaborate with stakeholders across Shell’s Downstream businesses in setting up, managing, and optimising the voice of customer programme (Tell Shell) to generate CX insights and drive improvements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Purpose<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Help Downstream businesses design and implement a successful relationship survey programme:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Survey design – questionnaire design, sampling strategy, distribution, reporting<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Project manage survey builds in Medallia, manage stakeholder expectations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Design and implement closed loop (‘follow up’) processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Help Downstream businesses get the most out of their relationship survey programme:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Provide analytic support by identifying root causes of poor CX using survey feedback<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Provide advanced statistical analyses (e.g., key driver analysis, predictive modelling, target-setting, etc.)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Evolve survey designs to meet Downstream businesses’ changing informational needs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Help the Downstream organisation mature its CX practice:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Provide thought leadership and subject matter expertise on CX best practices and ‘what good looks like’<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Support the Customer Experience Insights &amp; Analytics Manager in evolving the Tell Shell programme to provide a more holistic view of the customer journey, documenting survey processes, and installing controls to ensure programme integrity<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Focal person and subject matter expert for Tell Shell’s relationship survey programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Guardian of relationship survey design – questionnaire, sampling strategy, distribution, reporting<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Guardian of the deployment and operationalisation of new relationship surveys<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project manager of improvement initiatives aimed at optimising the Tell Shell programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project manager of change-and-engage activities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Guardian of relationship survey stakeholder engagements and communications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advocate for businesses to use CX insights in decision making and product development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Customer Experience Insight &amp; Analytics Manager in scaling and optimising the relationship survey programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Operational Excellence<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Work with business partners to design, implement, and optimise relationship surveys<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with business partners to promote the use of CX insights in daily operations and strategic planning<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conduct regular reviews of survey questionnaires to meet businesses' changing informational needs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage key interfaces with stakeholders in Sales, Marketing, LSC, S&amp;D and Fin Ops to ensure survey questionnaires identify improvement areas<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Define and collect sufficient samples to allow meaningful insights<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Measure relationship survey programme performance (response volumes, response rates, dropout rates, regionalities, etc.)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive sample size improvement through global and local initiatives; work with business focals and Medallia to ensure response rate maximisation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Educate the business on sampling and response rate maximisation best practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Educate local OTC teams on the use of Medallia in monitoring trends and extracting insights<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Design, implement and update reporting hierarchies in conjunction with business partners<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Energy Europe &amp; Environmental Products is seeking a Power Market Fundamental Analyst for Europe. This position is supporting traders with analysis developed from a deep understanding of the drivers such as generation (wind, solar, gas fired, coal fired, etc.) transmission, regulatory, and demand. This position must build credibility with internal customers so that such foresight can be translated into commercial gain primarily in the trading and investment business function. The emphasis is on developing both qualitatively and quantitatively advantaged capabilities, supported as appropriate by models, tools and techniques that yield high quality insight. Collaborating with peers in the Power Fundamentals team to build scalability in this respect is essential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Deliver market view to support trading and investment decisions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Research and understand the fundamentals drivers related to supply\u002Fdemand\u002Ftransmission in the context of modelling focused on developing forward pricing views.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor market developments in market design\u002Fregulatory issues that could impact prices.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with natural gas and emission analysts in market view development.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Good knowledge in energy economics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong knowledge of the European Energy Markets<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Very strong numerical and analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both written and oral.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent IT skills incl. ability to model in main languages as Python and in the MS Windows environment (particularly Excel), Experience interfacing with databases (SQL)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or any related degrees required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated understanding of power fundamentals.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
