<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is part of and supports a global team. This role will primarily work with the Shell North America Crude and Products business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role offers the candidate the opportunity to participate in the growing Trading and Supply businesses. There will be many ‘new’ and ‘first’ for the candidate to be part of. The role is responsible for working with business and IT to deliver solutions in projects or enhancements for the business needs.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The role is expected to work in predominately the DevOps way of working. The role will be working directly with business to understand business issues, fact finding, analyse impacts and dependencies, recommend end-to-end solution design, independently or work as a team, to implement the solution, or solve an incident or problem.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will work in project and\u002For application support teams in the delivery of projects and may include tasks from every part of the software development lifecycle, including task management, requirements gathering and traceability, prototyping, design, and development, testing and release\u002Fpatching.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role may also support turn-key\u002FSaaS solutions, which needs to work with third party suppliers to implement change requests, support end-to-end internal and user testing, testing\u002Ftrials of software patches\u002Fupgrades, support deployment, post deployment validation and business acceptance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role may also involve the prototyping and delivery of a solution or new technology, which may include new development, configuration, and installation of third -party packages, and software integration efforts. It may include tasks from every part of the software development lifecycle, including design, development, programming, and software deployment (both the installation and decommissioning of software).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Deliveries process and activities, standards, and communications, will be in accordance with the enterprise\u002Fteam guidelines, tooling, processes and norms (e.g., attending and providing sharing sessions, attending scrum calls, process improvements, etc)<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Capture and document user requirements into specifications, from inputs from subject matter experts and Design Authority.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding business requirements, to pilot and prototype new solutions and technologies, including procurement, setup, development, demonstration, and deployment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Projects and Support teams in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including Requirements Gathering, Analysis, Design, Coding, Testing, Implementation, and Production support for software systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Determine and design solutions that are scalable and sustainable for a global business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish and maintain stakeholder satisfaction levels. Build and develop strong trust relationships with the stakeholders demonstrated through clearly owning, resolving, and communicating issues and problems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute\u002Fparticipate in local and global IT community activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Intermediate\u002FExpert level of experience in successfully providing application support \u002F development in a corporate setting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Full life cycle development experience in a project development role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in supporting a diverse application landscape, including change management, application testing, data integrity management, patch management and end-user support and training.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience designing or changing business critical reports\u002Fprocesses to gain full value from technology solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Energy\u002FCommodity Trading and Risk Management domain experience required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Specific experience with Trade Capture, Risk Management, Scheduling &amp; Operations, or Settlements &amp; Accounting is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Corporate IT experience as Endur Developer.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Skills and Knowledge desired<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Knowledge in specific areas of Energy Trading and prior experience with Energy Trading systems development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of development life cycle and support of applications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understands mature software design\u002Farchitectures, software quality management and coding standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Independent working in a highly competitive environment with other team members, business stakeholders, is a special challenge that requires a great deal of flexibility and understanding.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing multiple delivery priorities and multiple demand requests.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to perform in virtual, cross-functional, cross-cultural teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Has work experience of the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Openlink Endur (v14+) development experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Endur AVS\u002FJVS coding skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> In-depth knowledge of Endur’s DB schema.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive knowledge of Endur’s Simulation Results and AVS\u002FJVS Libraries.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experienced in handling memory management issues with AVS\u002FJVS scripting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiar with Microsoft Azure DevOps tools (such as VSTS and GIT).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiar with Software Engineering processes (such as Configuration Management, Change Management, Release Management, etc).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Secondary experiences which are valued:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience with software development using MSFT C# and ASP.Net.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with software development using Java.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Crystal Reports development experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The ideal candidate can work as part of a global team with a strong track record of working as part of Power, Gas, LNG &amp; Environmental Products (EP) trading business focusing on trading activities. They will have knowledge of the energy commodity trading life cycle from setting up counterparties in operations system, message communication with counterparties\u002FETRM application. They should have worked on various operations systems and possess good understanding of UK &amp; European Market. They will have recent experience of delivering IT solutions to large consumers of European Power, Gas, LNG and Environmental Products and the supporting business processes that enables a business to serve customer needs. Knowledge of how the Power\u002FGas\u002FLNG is bought from the wholesale market via a trading division, and working of ETRM Systems like Aligne\u002FEndur would be an advantage<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Sr. Business Analyst is primarily responsible for leading the identification and documenting business requirements and working with technical teams to determine feasible solution options. The role is focused on Energy Commodity Trading &amp; Operations, in addition to usage of Energy Trading &amp; Risk Management Tools. There is an expectation it will encompass the end-to-end solution delivery lifecycle from idea and inception to assisting the support team, once the solution is live, with expert knowledge.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What We Need from You<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following experience and qualificatio<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive experience in non-retail processes and IT BA experience in the Power\u002FGas\u002FLNG Trading<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Front Office &amp; Back Office Processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working with energy commodity Operations (Scheduling, Nomination, Forecasting, Actualization)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Business Analysis techniques and tools with significant experience in project deliverables including the ability to:<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Precisely capture business problems, value drivers, and functional\u002Fnon-functional requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options\n    <ul>\n     <li> Experience in ETRM Systems (Aligne or Endur)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience working in Agile project Delivery<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience working in geographically distributed teams<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Personal Attributes<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Team player and able to collaborate, proactively communicates and shares understanding and experience within a team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Keeps up-to-date knowledge of the energy industry and energy trading<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Comfortable talking to business users and can translate business needs into tangible user stories or requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Clear communicator and able to work in a multicultural\u002Flingual environment<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Energy Operations (SE Ops) is responsible for the execution of all deals and trades for Shell Energy which encompasses the global LNG business including downstream LNG and gas and power trading in Europe and the Americas. SE Ops will also act as a talent pool for SE commercials.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SLMT (Shell LNG Marketing &amp; Trading) is the Global LNG Trading organization, and the Commercial Cargo Operator sits within STO which is the Operations arm of Shell Trading. Shell is a global leader in the LNG business. This is a global business with supply projects in both Atlantic and AP basins and customers spread across Asia, Europe, Middle East, and South America. The nature of this high-value trade is evolving fast with the mix of long- and short-term contracts changing fast.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Commercial Operations provides end-to-end commercial operations and logistical support to SLMT and is as such responsible on a day-to-day basis for the timely implementation and execution of freight and commercial transactions to ensure that all obligations arising from the LNG contract and charter party are met and carried out professionally. This requires working closely with Traders to maximize the value-add for profitable operations and minimize the profit leakage from the flexibility and optionality embedded in the LNG contracts and Supply programs. Operations are also involved in the development of projects and new contracts.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The LNG operations team is responsible on a day-to-day basis to be able to implement and execute commercial deals and review standard LNG contracts. In addition to cargo operations, this incumbent may be expected to cover freight operations and be able to operate LNG ships under SLMT’s responsibility working closely with the chartering team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Areas of Responsibility<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure that LNG operations fully comply with Shell’s internal standards including compliance and HSSE, paying special attention to HSSE hazards and risks that may have an impact on Shell’s license to operate<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all commercial and operational obligations arising from the contracts are carried out and that any necessary requirements are complied with<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deal with cargo and freight counterparties and terminals on a regular basis regarding all pre and post-deal activities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Appoint independent inspectors and expeditors and be able to investigate matters relating to LNG quality<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all operational information is entered timely and accurately into Trading systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide guidance for necessary cargo invoicing work, diversion payments, and clearances of accruals for both external and internal deals<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with counterparts and support team to ensure smooth operations, avoid delays and minimize demurrage costs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Multi-task on priorities and think on your feet to deal with contractual problems ensuring that they are managed professionally and optimally for the trading business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Specifically seek to add value by exercising embedded commercial and logistical deal options and by a pro-active approach to problem-solving<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support commercial colleagues on the feasibility of proposed contractual arrangements for new projects, new contracts, and spot cargoes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Agree with supply schedules with third parties and calculate cargo pricing understanding the mechanisms and indices employed<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and exploit synergies with other parts of Shell Trading<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support short term initiatives to continuously improve the efficiency of all aspects of the commercial operations for the movement of cargoes and port interaction<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage in highly complicated contract mechanisms for reconciliations involving large datasets to be completed in a timely fashion<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage relationships with external stakeholders, counterparties, and service providers e.g. suppliers and customers, regulatory bodies, inspectors, and survey companies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Actively engage and support local team when engaging with the freight and cargo operations team across the other hubs to ensure the process alignment, business continuity, and commercial added value to meet current and future business needs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Pro-actively close out operational related disputes with external and internal counterparts or support and guide less experienced team members where necessary<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage with external parties (outside of Shell) to gather best practices, digital solutions, and exchangeable learnings<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support LNG Ops and SLMT Digitization strategy in close liaison with Project Lead. Drive continuous improvements, automation and commercial value add<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display visible leadership and commitment to HSSE within the team. Engage with external partners to echo and reinforce our strong focus on HSSE<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Whilst key accountability lies with the regional team, the operator is expected to understand contractual constraints globally and collaborate with the cargo and freight operations team in other regions to resolve the issues<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The operator will handle global 24\u002F7 trading activities and whilst colleagues are available in other time zones, the operator is expected to respond flexibly to requests outside of normal office hours<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> To increase the LNG Commercial talent pool, professionals with IT or Finance background will also be considered provided they meet the above requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in commercial operations (preferably LNG) will be a strong advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A key criterion is to be able to operate within a non-standard environment where the counterparty requires and expects considerable support and at the same time be able to gently introduce standardization and efficiency.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Had experience in Supply Chain in a Trading &amp; Supply organisation and possessing the strong analytical capacity<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to apply analytical competencies and critically analyse scenarios to best determine actions and decision making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Digitalisation driven with the ambition to leverage suitable technologies to unlock new capabilities for commercial operations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexibility to adapt wholeheartedly and accommodate team requirements as and when required and deal with conflicting priorities where managing difficult stakeholders must be conducted professionally<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ambassador of continuous improvement and able to identify and implement solutions to ruthlessly eliminate complexity and waste in terms of processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effective verbal and written communication skills, adapting to varying audiences to clearly articulate key messages for influence. A high level of fluency in the English language, both written and spoken is required; others such as Spanish be an advantage but not a must.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deploy a commercial mindset in parallel with critical HSSE elements to achieve a balance of objectives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display learner mindset and challenge commercial decisions where applicable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Make decisions under time pressure based on available information and resilient under pressure while managing own well-being with consideration for others<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to engage, listen and understand diverse perspectives whilst providing effective feedback to peers and management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Take personal accountability and pride to ensure timely delivery of commitments<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify risk and opportunity in complex operational circumstances<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to leverage functional support and provide high-quality options and opinions to commercial stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Can identify areas of operational and commercial risk in new and existing contracts, with a track record of successfully implementing changes to limit risk or increase optionality<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of building trust among peers, stakeholders, and external counterparties<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n to support the acquisition of vessels for Shell and Shells powering progress strategy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n plan approval, design discussions with builder, attendance and witness at factory acceptance tests, commissioning and trials.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effective liaison with personnel from professional bodies, shipyard managers, Shell Shipping fleet management operation units and Shell Group discipline engineers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Follow policies and interpret legislative requirements with some guidance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Keep abreast of industry developments and recognize potential for economic implementation of innovative ideas as a means of increasing operational safety or reducing costs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Design, installation commissioning, certification and repair of equipment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> May be designated as a Technical Authority (TA), or Subject Matter Expert (SME).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Member of the Maritime Design &amp; Engineering Global Technical Discipline.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree, preferably a Master’s degree (in order to ease transition to a Chartered Engineer Status at a later date) qualified in an Electrical\u002FElectronic Engineering related subject.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> At least 5 years sea going experience or 5 years with a marine\u002Foffshore biased equipment vendor, design or construction position. (EPC, oil rigs, FPSO’s)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive practical and theoretical knowledge of electrical power systems or electrical control systems and of relevant issues in marine and offshore construction, design and operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Chartered Electrical Engineering license is advantageous.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in Power Systems, Control Engineering, Instrumentation, Project Delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing Sub-Contracts and Contract Management is nice to have.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Full understanding of the relevant Electrical Engineering Standards and Safe Working Practices.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of electrical equipment suitable for use in hazardous areas and hazardous area installations and ability to analyze and develop proposals and solutions to a wide range of technical and operational problems seeking guidance from Senior’s where necessary.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A team player with the necessary communication (oral and written) skills to interface with other disciplines and the ability to produce written reports of a high quality in the English language.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assess personal competencies and development to close any competency gaps and to enhance professional skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in Heavy Electrical Power, Refineries, Off-Shore Engineering and Shipbuilding industries preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain a contemporary knowledge base within own area of expertise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Primarily located in London office, with opportunities for working from home but there may be site offices set up during ship builds\u002Frepair where staff may be seconded to.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>This is a chance to join a company with a dynamic approach to digital content hosted on our global website Shell.com and shared across channels including Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook and YouTube.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Your responsibilities will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Creating and maintaining high-quality content on Shell.com, including producing new web pages and sourcing pictures and other visual elements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Generating, writing and editing digital content for our award-winning Inside Energy story channel and for amplification on social media channels. This includes written stories, social posts and sometimes scripts for videos and infographics<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting the managing and editing of posts in our LinkedIn Leaders programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Using data-driven insights to improve the performance of Shell’s content across a range of digital channels<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Helping to shape Shell’s strategy for content in a fast-moving digital landscape<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working with all parts of Shell’s business to develop compelling, high-quality content for Shell’s digital channels<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will need to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Be a strong team player able to work across cultures, diverse backgrounds and virtual teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with other writers to develop and co-ordinate the production of stories<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Handle tight deadlines and work at speed without sacrificing quality<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for a talented digital content editor to join the global editorial team at Shell. You will need to be a strong writer and editor, with solid experience in digital journalism, and\u002For corporate digital editorial, with a nose for stories and a proven track record in producing creative and compelling content.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Ideally, you will also have some experience of working in a multicultural corporate environment, or creative agency.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You should also demonstrate the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Strong and proven skills in writing and editing (in native-level English), attention to detail and experience in creating content for digital and social media<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to understand sometimes complex information and communicate it in a simple, easily understood way<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Potential and determination to develop as a writer and editor to produce high-quality content for Shell.com for promotion on digital and social media<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An understanding of the changing nature of digital platforms and the different ways audiences engage on each one<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A creative and proactive approach to identifying and developing strong, human stories that appeal to a wide global audience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the UK more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell is currently having journey towards S4 from ECC. This project is a huge project and hence we are going phase by phase to implement S4 HANA solution and this journey will continue till 2027 or more. As part of this long journey, we are looking for passionate professionals who have hands on to support us in various areas of S4 Finance implementation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> As a Senior Application Analyst – Finance, you should have the following responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><br> Experience in delivering complete S4 HANA Finance solutions to the business, proficient in analyzing and translating Business\u002FProcess requirements to technical requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performs the S4 HANA configurations &amp; ensures that Build standards are adhered to best practices.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understands the S4 HANA configurations &amp; master data activities with cross functional area Integration with other modules.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of Business requirements and develop the IT Solution by working along with Process Architects\u002FDesign Authorities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Works with Lead Business Analyst\u002FProcess Experts to develop technical design specification for solutions with high complexity<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performs Unit Test, and supports Integration Test for the applicable solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Undertake Problem Analysis to identify root causes of incidents, escalating findings within the Line and Business, to minimize such incidents re-occurring<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive resolution of defects during test cycles and hyper care as well as for critical incidents. Supports the resolution of Production issues in meetings with the Run &amp; Maintain organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Define and Safeguard IT solution to ensure Robust, Supportable &amp; Scalable to ensure IT documentations are updated prior to CAB meetings.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Propose any possible functional improvement in the existing solutions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Has detailed functional understanding of the application \u002F module in their scope and how this is supporting the business process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure that all changes are properly and extensively documented.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fully comply with and adhere to, all Group and Upstream IT standards and Processes<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set:<br> <br> Expertise in S4 HANA Finance, Joint Venture Accounting (JVA) areas with development capabilities for the Finance Business area in Upstream Oil &amp; Gas industry solution.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Substantial experience in Senior Application Analyst role in Finance or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Certain degree of knowledge in S4 HANA Joint Venture Accounting (JVA) modules is desired<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Has an executional role in design and development projects or acts as an expert tester who designs test scripts and provides overall project guidance and planning support.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborates across team(s) and has some exposure to \u002F interaction with business leadership.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Works independently under broad managerial supervision. Works largely independently within defined projects\u002Fwork streams and is checked on end results.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> S4 HANA certification is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The NextGen ERP Programme has been set up to ensure Shell Enterprise-wide programme migration towards the SAP S\u002F4 and Master Data Management over the next decade. Through 2020 Shell’s businesses and functions have begun to draft roadmaps for this journey.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> SAP S\u002F4 is a “once in a generation opportunity” to transform, simplify and automate many of our transactional processes. It will enable Asset Management on its Asset Management System (AMS) journey – with simplified common processes, data, and systems across Upstream\u002FIG and Downstream. Increasing reliability, productivity and safety is our goal. Procurement, Finance and Logistic processes will be simplified – using market standard – end to end processes in SAP S\u002F4.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Process and Data design work are ongoing for both the Upstream\u002FIG businesses and a Central Finance (CFIN) solution that will provide a Digital Core to transform and radically simplify financial processes across Shell. Significant IT design and delivery has already kick-started from Q3, 2021.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key accountabilities for the Integration Consultant will be:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Work closely with Business Analysts and business users to translate integration requirements into system configurations against S\u002F4 Design standards.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop Interfaces and configure integration components across SAP and Non-SAP technologies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support end to end unit and scenario testing of all integration configuration items for full-scale Business implementations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support Business Analysts and Business end-users through the change journey including testing and addressing configuration issues in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as a key collector of product gaps and improvement opportunities, appropriately document these items and flow these opportunities along with a value case to the appropriate route with SAP (Oil &amp; Gas Consortium, CIO office, Architecture, other SAP engagement bodies as appropriate)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Technical - <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Extensively worked in <b>SAP Cloud Platforms Integration (CPI)<\u002Fb> Design, Development &amp; Deployment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven experience to Integration Design Patterns for connecting various systems with reference to On-prem and Cloud<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant experience on <b>PI\u002FPO<\u002Fb> for on-prem to on-prem integration scenarios<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant experience in managing complex integration scenarios and interfaces between on-premises and cloud systems - also with legacy systems<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven working experience handling complex projects in <b>SCP \u002F BTP &amp; S4 skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant working experience in configuring sender &amp; receiver adapter – IDOC, FTP, SFTP, OData, HTTP, SOAP, RFC, Ariba, AS2, OpenConnectors, and other <b>Adapters<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven experience in Design, Build, Monitoring and troubleshooting of SAP Cloud Platform services<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to End-to-End Integration with <b>Cloud Application like Ariba, Concur, etc<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven experience in <b>Groovy Script, XSLT, Value Mapping, Message Mapping, API Hub &amp; CPI Standard pre-packaged integration<\u002Fb> Content reusability<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven understanding of Authentication and Authorizations with reference to CPI<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to Message Implementation Guidelines and Integration Advisor<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to Performance <b>Optimization, Error Handling &amp; Reprocessing<\u002Fb> using Data Stores in CPI<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to Biztalk and other Integration tools<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Soft skills - <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>A commercial mindset coupled with a strong interest in the business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to shape and translate a technology-enabled vision into the delivery of successful business outcomes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to motivate and retain key skills in what will become a very competitive technology in the market<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to quickly gather vast amounts of knowledge across all businesses of Shell Plc and numerous ERP’s to understand current solutions, challenge real needs and incorporate them into a singular design. As such ability to quickly develop relationships across multi teams\u002FLoBs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to build strong collaborative partnerships with process owners and senior finance stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Active participation in a high performing IT natural teams aligned around driving greater business value<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilience, courage, and the willingness to challenge and manage business expectations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in developing business cases and in managing IT budgets through the IT demand management and planning process<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding and experience of the various Agile frameworks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Nice to have Agile certifications\u002Ftraining and expertise in Agile tooling (ex - Azure DevOps)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy Europe &amp; Environmental Products is seeking an experimented Power Market Fundamental Analysis for Europe. This position is supporting traders with analysis developed from a deep understanding of the key short-term and mid-term drivers such as generation (wind, solar, gas fired, coal fired, etc.), transmission, regulatory, and demand. This position must build credibility with internal customers so that such foresight can be translated into commercial gain primarily in the trading business function. The emphasis is on developing both qualitatively and quantitatively advantaged capabilities, supported as appropriate by models, tools and techniques that yield high quality insight. Collaborating with peers in the Power Fundamentals team to build scalability in this respect is essential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deliver market view to support trading decisions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Research and understand the fundamentals drivers related to supply\u002Fdemand\u002Ftransmission in the context of modelling focused on developing forward pricing views.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor market developments in market design\u002Fregulatory issues that could impact prices.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with short-term and medium-term natural gas and emission analysts in market view development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Improve or follow project improving models used by the team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Propose trading strategy evaluating expected profit, risks, timing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Share best practice, knowledge within the team and outside.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Good knowledge in energy economics<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong knowledge of the European Energy Markets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very strong numerical and analytical skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both written and oral.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent IT skills incl. ability to model in main languages as Python and in the MS Windows environment (particularly Excel), Experience interfacing with databases (SQL)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or any related degrees required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Relevant years of experience in Power Fundamentals and trading environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated understanding of power fundamentals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. operation that combines a global network of trading companies, with shipping and maritime capabilities, and an integrated network of supply and distribution activities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Commercial Operations organization works in partnership with T&amp;S to deliver capabilities that enable them to “run” the business, as well as build capabilities that “change” the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Programme Project Delivery (PPD) sit in Commercial Operations and deliver cross T&amp;S projects\u002Fprogrammes:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> support T&amp;S with cross business line Programme, Project, PMO, Assurance and Change management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> delivers a methodology that enables effective Programme, Project, PMO, delivery and embeds change<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> acts as the custodian of the overall Programme and Project agenda for T&amp;S, enabling prioritisation activity and cross business line stakeholder alignment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The portfolio of projects is diverse and varies in scale and complexity. Current Programmes\u002FProjects span Risk, Compliance, Process, Data &amp; Systems. However, the portfolio is expected to evolve to meet the demands of Shell’s Powering Progress Strategy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The PPD team are a new, highly driven team of Project management and PMO experts focused on delivering real solutions, that add business value and help drive the T&amp;S agenda forward.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a project manager within PPD, you will be expected to deliver projects that vary in size, scale, and complexity across a global business. Reporting to the Senior Project Manager, the Project Manager has responsibility for:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Defining the business problem statement and developing the solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Delivering project outcomes within time, budget, scope, and quality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Transitioning the project outcomes at project closure to the appropriate business, operations, or risk teams to allow them to embed the changes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Project Manager will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Business case - define the problem statement with the business and obtain business buy-in for the project.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Initiate project - define scope and business outcomes, determine delivery approach with resource, timeline and budget requirements, check feasibility.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Planning - develop detailed resource-based project plans which show dependencies and defined delivery roles.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Governance - establish fit for purpose Governance to oversee management of the projects to ensure they deliver against their objectives, have effective decision-making processes, and maintain senior stakeholder support.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Tracking - track project progress against plan and budget, manage projects changes through change control process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Risk and Issue management - Identify and manage risks and issues to keep delivery on track, making interventions to remove project barriers or escalate early for support in resolution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Reporting - Consistently report progress to senior management using executive summaries supported by key delivery metrics.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Change Management - Develop the case for change, assess the Business impacts and develop a robust change management plan <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Delivery - motivate and lead a cross functional team (internal and external) to deliver to plan and budget. And actively develop the culture of a high performing team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project closure - assess project status against closure criteria and manage transition into business-as-usual. Evaluate successes and challenges to enhance learning for future projects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Dimensions:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> No direct reports but expected to manage and lead cross functional teams (internal and external) and deliver project outcomes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Represent project status in Governance forums with senior leadership.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Professional Skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Relevant experienced in project management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Delivery focused – driven to deliver on commitments even when the situation is ambiguous and vague.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to manage multiple projects and key relationships across a very complex organisation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strategic problem solving - Ability to grab a problem that is abstract or poorly defined, and transform it into one that is clear, understood and has all stakeholders in alignment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to tease out requirements and key issues to harness ideas and drive the stakeholders towards solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Professional qualifications in project management desired e.g. PMP, P3O, PRINCE 2, Agile project management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience and knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor's degree from an accredited university (or equivalent work experience).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Business Skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Knowledge and\u002For competence in Trading, Supply, Risk, Compliance, Process, Data, or Systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Learner mindset - Eagerness to learn, with proven ability to get up to speed quickly and solve business problems, without being a subject matter expert.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Aligned with Shells values of Honesty, Integrity, Respect with a focus on Safety.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Stakeholder management – build strong stakeholder relationships and influence them to drive sponsorship, buy-in and sign-off during projects. Proven ability to navigate push back from stakeholders and develop an aligned way forward path.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Change Management - Knowledge and competency in change management with the ability to deliver and embed sustainable change outcomes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Personal Effectiveness skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Executive presence – “show up,” inspire confidence and make an impact.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advise &amp; lead - optimise a team’s performance (internal and external) and consistently demonstrate and share best practice.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Communication skills - actively listen, synthesise and playback ideas, in a way that engages, inspires, and influences your stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilient, adaptable and thrives under pressure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Quality focused – ability to administer all aspects of the role to the highest quality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to deliver in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
