<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Senior IT Operations Specialist is responsible for the support and maintenance of the applications of the Treasury IT portfolio. This includes Shell’s Treasury Management System (TMS) Quantum, SWIFT, market data and connectivity to several SaaS providers. The role involves supporting front and back-office Treasury operations and finance users.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will be responsible for the below:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Providing application support for the TMS and connected applications, this includes minor changes including report development, as appropriate for each application.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Analyze and resolve application incidents and problems working with internal infrastructure teams and software suppliers, where necessary.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> To participate in the requirements analysis, design, build, testing and transition to support of projects involving the applications for which you are subject matter expert (SME).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Follow the processes for efficient handling of incidents, problems, and changes in compliance with SOX and IT control requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support of internal and external audit requests and requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Significant experience of application support, maintenance skills, system integration experience, ideally in a Finance environment, preferably Treasury.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Banking systems, Quantum, SWIFT, Zema and Bloomberg will be advantageous.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to handle a mixed workload, providing support to business users, projects, and enhancements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work experience with senior business leaders to understand business drivers and design IT solutions to address them.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to take end-to-end accountability with minimal support.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical issues to all levels.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work under pressure with tight deadlines, sometimes after hours\u002Fweekend work.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Support\u002FMaintenance skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience supporting SaaS solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Application monitoring using Application Manager or Splunk<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Crystal reporting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> SQL Server<\u002Fli>\n   <li> .Net standards (Shell)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> 3rd Party API utilization. Restful API maintenance, Feature improvement and addition (Finastra)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> API’s<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Nuget package management\u002Fknowledge<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Visual Studio 2019, 2022<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Proposition <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>It is recognised that the size and complexity of Shell Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) has increased substantially over the past few years and the expectations around risk management from a regulatory perspective have also shifted for Energy Trading, for example, with the FCA’s Senior Managers and Certification Regime (SMCR) applying in the UK from December 2019. As a result, and also recognising the potential to unlock additional value from enhanced risk management of our trading activities, a strategic decision has been made to make a major investment over the next 3-4 years to strengthen the risk management capabilities of the organisation from a people, process, data and systems perspective in both the first and second lines of defence. A new Chief Risk Officer (CRO) was brought into the organisation in March 2020 who is leading the efforts for the second line of defence and added a number of new roles to the organisation to drive these changes forward.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The new Risk Reporting and Analytics (RRA) team focuses on the delivery of regular and ad hoc risk reporting and portfolio analytics to the commercial teams, the risk management teams and various other stakeholders such as the T&amp;S Leadership Team (TSLT), Shell Executive Committee (EC) and the production of risk information which will flow into external financial reporting. This includes merging the activities of the previous Enterprise Risk Advisor. The RRA team also partners closely with the Risk Transformation and Shell IT teams to contribute to the planning and delivery of risk systems\u002FIT change projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Senior Analyst Quantitative Methods (Europe) role’s primary stakeholders are commercial teams and risk managers located in T&amp;S hubs of London, Houston, Rotterdam, Dubai and Singapore, with global activities. The role focuses on providing pre- and post-deal quantitative analytics to support these teams, in particular covering businesses in the European and Asian time zones.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Successful candidate will be accountable for the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide ad hoc advanced analytics at a transaction level such as for the calculation of pre-deal exposures (potential future exposure, expected exposure, expected credit loss etc). Transactions can be long-dated and complex, often with embedded derivatives and may extend into illiquid parts of the curve.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Collaborate with and support Commercial \u002F Credit \u002F Market Risk \u002F Valuation teams with production reporting of complex modelled contracts e.g. complex LNG contract modelling, market risk price stochastic models, structured credit agreements, multi-variate options, as well as other ad-hoc requests from commercial senior management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure analytics methods and tools have clear and appropriate documentation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide leadership and support to RRA colleagues, including the Shell Business Operation (SBO) teams based in Chennai and Manila that support with daily operational tasks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) to reporting and analytics related projects as part of the transformation agenda within Risk<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as a centre of expertise for SME’s across Risk, providing ‘thought leadership’ and helping them to interpret the quantitative drivers for the portfolio and specific transactions booked in T&amp;S<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interface with stakeholders in Shell IT, Commercial, Risk Transformation, and broader Risk etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates who have prior quantitative risk analytics experience desirable, with a deep understanding of at least one commodity market in which T&amp;S operates (e.g. Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG or Oil) and the quantitative risk methods commonly used, including how to apply them and where a simpler approximation might be suitable.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Exposure to the types of quantitative and data challenges faced in a complex trading environment with multiple ETRM’s and other data sources.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong communications skills (both written and verbal), including an ability to concisely explain complex concepts to non-specialist stakeholders in terms of intent and application.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent attention to detail, methodical, organized.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilient when working under pressure, with the ability to prioritise tasks to meet deadlines and exercise good judgement when providing advice, questioning discrepancies and escalating issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Learner mindset: innovative and creative, excellent critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficiency with SQL, Python or other programming languages is desirable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> CQF would be a bonus<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>In this role, you will apply your expertise to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Lead cutting edge development through measurable transformation of process, people and IT technology. Expert on operational processes and systems<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Apply a strong focus on innovating IT solutions to support decision making and drive process efficiency<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Understand current process structure, measure performance and use data \u002F KPIs to continually improve processes and ensure a continuous drive for automation and top quartile IT solutions <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p>Capture and share learnings and best practice from both internal and external experiences to Shell to drive improvements in commercial and operational performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Act as a focal for innovation in Operations, connecting the various pockets of excellence in Shell to leverage the best that the organization can offer to improve operational performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure a stable foundation. Own system set-up, in-house and 3rd party IT performance<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> While it is understood that Excel solutions continue to have an appropriate place in our business the drive is to automate manual steps and eliminate Excel solutions where possible. Champion technology to eliminate manual effort, drive enhancements to existing IT solutions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Coordinate activities required to bring deals into delivery and onboard bespoke or new deal types<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Coordinate upgrades to process and IT in order to keep pace with existing and new regulatory requirements and internal system landscape upgrades<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Design and implement appropriate business controls to ensure robust and compliant business operations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Understand system interfaces and architecture. Monitor performance of IT applications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate an innovative commercial mindset while at the same time being able to structure and shape delivery of solutions <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Working experience of Endur or Endur implementations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deep knowledge of European power operations, networks and regulatory frameworks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Passion for digitalization - identifying and driving automation and improvement opportunities. Able to simultaneously manage a range of business and IT projects and improvements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to develop business relationships with stakeholders, customers and IT vendors<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent analytical skills, be able to make accurate decisions under pressure in a dynamic environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate a Learner Mindset to continuously improve performance of the business and oneself<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Operations Innovation and Markets Senior Specialist (Power) will be based in London and will report to the Innovation and Markets Team Lead who sits on the SE Operations Leadership Team. The role will work closely with Power Trading, Origination, Shell Energy Europe and Africa Operations, IT and other support functions. This role has line manager supervisory responsibilities for a team of Innovation and Markets Specialists (Power) accountable for all aspects of managing the team and individual performance and development.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will have working experience of Endur and or Endur implementation experience and will develop a deep understanding of SE-EA’s power portfolio to proactively collaborate with a wide and diverse set of stakeholders in a constructive manner for the delivery of business goals in support of the energy transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>In this role, you will apply your expertise to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Leading and building a high performance team of Innovation and Markets Specialists (Power). Managing all aspects of performance and personal development. Responsible for prioritization of efforts and building capability of the team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Lead cutting edge capability development through measurable transformation of process, people and IT technology. Expert on operational processes and IT systems:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Apply a strong focus on innovating IT solutions, champion technology to eliminate manual effort, drive enhancements to existing IT solutions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Accountable for the Power Operations Improvement Roadmap, providing excellent visibility on progress against plan, estimating and tracking investment budgets, setting governance, escalating risks and championing achievements to assure recognition<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Shape, gain buy-in and commitment for delivery of improvements, monitor and report out on delivery through implementation lifecycle from concept to adoption of improvement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Partner with IT, Business Managers and Commercial Delivery teams to select and implement (full lifecycle; scope, design, build test &amp; deploy) the Digital solutions of the future<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Lead Commercial Operations (Power) Endur design and implementation efforts as part of a significant ETRM transformation project<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure a stable foundation:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Go-to subject matter expert to initiate dialogue on Endur implementation, new Power opportunities and for escalation of complex and \u002F or stubborn operational issues for investigation and resolution<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Accountable for the Power Operations Performance dashboard<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Understand current process structure, measure performance and use data \u002F KPIs to continually improve processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Facilitate culture change within Operations:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Proactively lead engagements with Trading, Commercial Delivery, New Energies, IT and other functions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Champion use of Continuous Improvement tools and techniques<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Listen to and understand the needs of stakeholders and seek out new Digital solutions that will meet these challenges and bring competitive advantage to Shell. Build business cases and gain support for delivery<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Re-energise collaboration, excellent stakeholder engagement to bring together teams and cross business capabilities to deliver new solutions necessary to make new deals and new market entries possible<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Lead \u002F bring together focus groups for innovation in Operations, connecting the various pockets of excellence in Shell to leverage the best that the organization can offer to improve operational performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Capture and share learnings and best practice from both internal and external experiences<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Opportunity for membership and active participation in the SE Operations Extended Leadership Team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Stepping up to provide cover for the Markets and Innovation Team Lead when necessary<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Passion to lead improvement delivery and collaborate with others<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working experience of Endur or Endur implementation experience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deep knowledge of European power operations, networks and regulatory frameworks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Passion for digitalization - identifying and driving automation and improvement opportunities. Simultaneously manage a range of business and IT projects and improvements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive for cross commodity innovation and automation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop business relationships with stakeholders, customers and IT vendors<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactive in developing the capability and managing performance of Power improvement specialist team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent analytical skills, be able to make accurate decisions under pressure in a dynamic environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrate a Learner Mindset to continuously improve performance of the business and oneself. Promote achievements both personal and of the team. Partner with others to achieve greater outcomes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Energy Operations (SE Ops) is responsible for the execution of all deals and trades for Shell Energy which encompasses the global LNG business including downstream LNG and gas and power trading in Europe and the Americas. SE Ops will also act as a talent pool for SE commercials.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit n<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SLMT (Shell LNG Marketing &amp; Trading) is the Global LNG Trading organization and the Commercial Freight Operator sits within STO which is the Operations arm of Shell Trading. Shell is a global leader in the LNG business. This is a global business with supply projects in both Atlantic and AP basins and customers spread across Asia, Europe, Middle East, and South America.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The nature of this high-value trade is evolving fast with the mix of long- and short-term contracts changing fast. Commercial Operations provides end-to-end commercial operations and logistical support to SLMT and is as such responsible on a day-to-day basis for the timely implementation and execution of freight and commercial transactions to ensure that all obligations arising from the LNG contract and charter party are met and carried out professionally.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> This requires working closely with Traders to maximize the value-add for profitable operations and minimize the profit leakage from the flexibility and optionality embedded in the LNG contracts and Supply programs. Operations are also involved in the development of projects and new contracts.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Commercial Freight Operations team is responsible to operate LNG ships under SLMT scope, working closely with the chartering team. In addition to freight operations, the incumbent is also expected to gain necessary experience to implement and execute commercial deals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Key roles and responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ensure that LNG Operations fully complies with Shell’s internal standards incl. compliance and HSSE, paying special attention to HSSE hazards and risks that may have impact on vessels voyage or port operation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all obligations arising from the charter parties are carried out, and that any necessary requirements are complied with.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Promote good relationships with Owners\u002FMasters to continuously monitor and improve operational efficiency; in addition to meeting TCP (Time Charter Party) obligations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborate with MTA (Marine Technical Advisor) to establish and maintain good relationships with Ports and Terminals, including resolving issues that may arise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage internal stakeholders e.g. Traders, Optimizer Traders, Finance, STASCO Shipping and Global Operations Commercial Services.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage relationships with external stakeholders, counter-parties and service providers, regulatory bodies, ship owners and agents.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the wider team and provide guidance in understanding commercial impacts of marine technical actions. Ensure open communication with the business, with correct information flow to aid Trading decisions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with and support Cargo Operations team, to gain deeper understanding of LNG contracts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all operational information is entered into Trading systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Liaise with counterparts to ensure smooth operations, avoid delays and minimize demurrage costs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Efficiently manage the trade-offs between bunker consumption, boil-off and vessel speed, i.e: heel management, and instruct the vessel’s Master accordingly.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Arrange Bunkers and OPL (outside port limit) activities as required by the vessel<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Devise optimal voyage plans working with the vessel and commercial colleagues<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide guidance for necessary freight invoicing work, diversion payments and clearances of accruals for both external and internal deals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Close out the charter party accounting for all costs, including TCP claims and obtain sign-off from Chartering<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support short-term initiatives to continuously improve the efficiency of all aspects of freight operations, e.g: in cargo movements and port interaction<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify and exploit synergies with other parts of Shell Trading<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Pro-actively close out operational-related disputes, including COU (Conditions of Use) issues, with external and internal counterparts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coach and support team members in Operations and SLMT organizations, including guidance of less experienced team members.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Whilst key accountability lies with regional team, the operator is expected to understand marine constraints globally and collaborate pro-actively with Cargo and Freight Operations teams in other regions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The operator will handle global 24\u002F7 trading activities and whilst colleagues are available in other time zones, operator is expected to respond flexibly to requests outside of normal office hours.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Act with personal integrity, be guided by personal values and beliefs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilient under pressure and ability to manage own well-being with consideration for other<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong sense of initiative to independently seek out information<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to apply analytical competencies and critically analyse scenarios to best determine actions and decision making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Digitalisation driven with the ambition to leverage suitable technologies to unlock new capabilities for commercial operations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexibility to adapt wholeheartedly and accommodate team requirements as and when required<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ambassador of continuous improvement and able to identify and implement solutions to ruthlessly eliminate complexity and waste in terms of processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Embrace and adapt to change with full commitment and a holistic perspective<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effective verbal and written communication skills, adapting to varying audiences to clearly articulate key messages for influence<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deploy a commercial mindset in parallel with critical HSSE elements to achieve a balance of objectives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deal with conflicting priorities where managing difficult stakeholders must be conducted professionally<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display learner mindset and challenge commercial decisions where applicable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Make decisions under time pressure based on available information<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to engage, listen and understand perspectives whilst providing effective feedback to peers and management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Take personal accountability and pride to ensure timely delivery of commitments<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Impeccable work ethic with exceptional work standards and the desire to learn and grow through experiences<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify risk and opportunity in complex operational circumstances<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to leverage functional support and provide high-quality options and opinions to commercial stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Can identify areas of operational and commercial risk in new and existing contracts, with a track record of successfully implementing changes to limit risk or increase optionality<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of building trust among peers, stakeholders, and external counterparties<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to understand the diversity of thought and incorporate different views in decision making<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Confident and able to adapt communication style across groups in various layers of the organisation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Can foster a positive work environment even in challenging circumstances. Shows care for colleagues<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Had experience in Supply Chain in a Trading &amp; Supply organisation and possessing strong analytical capacity<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> To increase the LNG Commercial talent pool, professionals with IT or Finance background will also be considered provided they meet the above requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in commercial operations (preferably LNG) will be a strong advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A good level of fluency in the English language, both written and spoken is required; others such as Spanish, Japanese, Mandarin and Korean would also be an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p>Experience on marine (preferably LNG) vessels and \u002F or marine technical experience will be a strong advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> A key criterion is to be able to operate within a non-standard environment where the counterparty requires and expects considerable support and at the same time be able to gently introduce standardization and efficiency.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. of the energy business and climate debate read on.<br> <br> The world is changing fast and Shell is changing, too – not only to keep up with developments – but to anticipate and shape a better future. Shell’s newly integrated global Corporate Relations (CR) function brings together professional communicators, brand experts, government and community relations professionals and specialists in non-technical risk and social performance to work with commercial and technical colleagues and deliver company goals. The CR team will provide analysis and external perspectives, policy solutions and integrated advocacy, communications and content to strengthen Shell’s brand, reputation and global businesses. Drawing on a strong base of professional excellence, we aspire to be the best at achieving successful integrated outcomes for the business through effective engagement and communication with stakeholders and audiences.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will be someone who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, is a creative thinker, a natural storyteller and an excellent writer in English with a proven track record of building strong relationships and knowing how to successfully influence audiences. You will be given the space to push boundaries and spearhead creative activations which will result in brand-building for Shell’s ‘shop window’ and will ultimately change peoples’ perceptions in countries all around the world.<br> <br> You will be a key member of the global Mobility &amp; Lubricants Corporate Relations team and can be based in either London or Krakow. The position reports to the Senior Corporate Relations Adviser Mobility &amp; Lubricants (E-Mobility) based in Krakow.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will be responsible for planning, developing, and executing a global communications programme across Shell’s exciting and rapidly evolving electric mobility activities. You will work closely with the Senior Corporate Relations Adviser Mobility &amp; Lubricants to develop cohesive narratives and a suite of communications tools that strengthen the business license to operate and position Shell as a world leader that can thrive through the energy transition. More specifically, you will:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Lead and support the integration of the messaging around Shell’s diverse portfolio of E-Mobility products, services and solutions into a single, cohesive narrative for key stakeholders, including customers, partners and investors<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead and support multi-channel integrated external communications campaigns for significant milestones and events such as acquisitions and product launches<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Help ensure consistency and accuracy of Shell’s e-mobility communications across business units and regions as well as Shell-owned portfolio companies. Support portfolio companies to comply with Shell’s communications policies and standards.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and implement integrated plans to support the EVPs of Mobility and Lubricants, including stakeholder engagements aligned with business objectives and strategy<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Specific Challenges<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A global remit which involves working across multiple markets, time zones and cultures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment requiring a positive attitude, dynamism and resilience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll ideally have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> The ability to communicate complex technical matters using accessible, plainspoken language<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to handle crises and highly sensitive issues<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Very strong written English with ability to create stories that are relevant, simple to understand and engaging on an emotional level<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A self-starter mindset with high degrees of personal initiative, drive and desire in order to spearhead new business-targeted solutions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with digital and social channels<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to be a truly collaborative team player who has a can-do attitude and is prepared to take on new challenges<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Passion about purpose, customer-centricity and our brand<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Additional Information<\u002Fb><br> While this position can be based in London or Krakow, the line manager for this position (Senior Corporate Relations Adviser Mobility &amp; Lubricants) is based in Poland. You will need to be comfortable working virtually with your line manager across time zones, including occasional out-of-hours work and weekends.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Description of business<\u002Fb><br> With over 46,000 sites in nearly 80 countries, and an ambition to protect one in eight engines and machines with Shell lubricants worldwide by 2025, Shell is a world leader in both mobility retail and lubricants, and the newly formed Corporate Relations team for Mobility and Lubricants is at the heart of Shell’s relationship with its customers in both of these areas.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Just as Shell is the leader in mobility retailing today, we aspire to be the leading EV charging solutions provider in the future. That is why we have set ambitious targets to operate over 500,000 charge points by 2025, up from around 90,000 today. We currently install a new charge point for customers roughly every 20 minutes of every day and already operate charge points in over 30 countries across the globe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Additional Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> While this position can be based in London or Krakow, the line manager for this position (Senior Corporate Relations Adviser Mobility &amp; Lubricants) is based in Poland. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable working virtually with his or her line manager across time zones, including occasional out-of-hours work and weekends.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> A written test will be undertaken by all short-listed applicants.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The <b>IT Business Analyst<\u002Fb> is responsible for identifying and defining the business needs of their clients and stakeholders and helping to determine solutions to meet business needs or resolve business problems. This work is typically within a specific business area. The role may be part of an IT project development environment or an individual contributor at the business interface.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position has the following accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Able to link technical solutions with business strategy when working with business partners. Has knowledge of how competitors are using IT solutions to gain competitive edge, applies that knowledge to projects. Leading stakeholder management activities. Creates opportunities to make the stakeholder feel valued and develop trust.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Broad and extensive knowledge, often in own specialized field especially Retail Business, to provide interpretive, advisory or facilitating services for the use of others to achieve results. The job requires extensive knowledge of working on Retail Point Of Sale, Back Office Sale and Integrations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Precisely capture business problems, value drivers, and functional\u002Fnon-functional requirements, including health, safety, security, usability, data, and supportability considerations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participates in team effort to create new best practice material based on identified gaps. Serves as an SME for specific tools, techniques, or business areas.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assess and model processes, data flows, and technology to understand the current value and issues, and identify opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Create clear documentation to communicate requirements and related information; keep updated to align with the solution over the project lifecycle.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure traceability of requirements from business needs and requirements, through testing and scope changes, to final solution.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interact with software suppliers, designers and developers to understand software limitations, deliver elements of system and database design, and ensure that business requirements and use cases are handled.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Configure and document software and processes, using agreed standards and tools.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Create acceptance criteria and validate those solutions meet business needs through defining and coordinating testing.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Expertized in working on Retail Site System Landscape, understanding POS, BOS, HOS and functional domains like NFR, Loyalty, Site Operation, Wet Stock Business, Payments\u002F Settlements and Fleets etc. Familiarity working with UK site specific markets.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> Special Challenges: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Guide business stakeholders to gain acceptance \u002F sign-off. Manage requirements to the smallest set that will provide the biggest impact in advancing business objectives and end-user buy-in.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Describe technology in terms easily understood by business customers and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Work closely with stakeholders to build trust and understand their goals, motivations, constraints, risks, and operating environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive experience in IT Business analyst role<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of systems engineering concepts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Has a comprehensive knowledge of the technical specialism of IT Business Analysis.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in Agile\u002F Waterfall\u002F Hybrid Methodologies of Software Development and Delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficient in the majority of the Retail Business Domains viz Site Systems (POS, BOS, HOS), Business Domain (NFR, Fleet, Loyalty, Fuel Pricing etc).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Have an insight of UK Retail Site System specific landscape, platforms\u002F products.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to take a systematic and analytical approach to problem solving and pay close attention to detail.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to act as a focal point for a specialized area (technical or business); able to lead teams while managing multiple competing priorities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Has a comprehensive understanding of business process improvement, benefit and risk management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal skills, communication, presentational skills and stakeholder engagement.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>This role is for a Business Analyst in the Upstream, IG and R&amp;ES team within the Design Engineering Capability Center in IT Engineering. The analyst will be working in R&amp;ES – Asset Management for Electrolyzers as the first project assignment.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Programme Scope<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> The scope of this project is to perform feasibility assessments, on tools &amp; integration. Look for internal &amp; external best practices \u002Fcost models and opportunities<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Understand H2 high level requirements i.e. processes, KPIs, data, process grouping<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand AMS, point C tools in DS &amp; UP\u002FIG, mapping to H2<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand data sources\u002Fsystems\u002F and required integration<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand 3rd party support &amp; processes (i.e. ITM Power)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand the cost models and required investments for new tools<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Evaluate the scope of the requirements vs available tools.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand business capability mapping<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> As a BA you get to learn new dimensions of application design and exposure to various domain \u002F process areas.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit In<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shell UK Mobility business has a company owned presence of over 525 service stations in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Within that the Convenience Retail (CR) UK business manages a broad spectrum of retail categories from confectionary through to carwash and represents a significant growth channel within the future mobility strategy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> To drive long term sustainable growth, the business is focused on developing an ever-evolving offer that satisfies the needs of a diverse customer base. Each service station must provide customers with the best mobility offer and must cater to customers with different retail shopping missions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Within the Convenience retail business we manage a number of different formats including our Shell Select proposition as well as other formats with Alliance partners (eg Waitrose).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Category Manager within CR, you will be responsible for a group of categories and their performance across the breadth of formats that we operate.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Further Background:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Mobility is a core face of Shell. It touches the lives of 30 million customers every single day. This makes Mobility a primary driver for the Shell brand. We take this responsibility seriously, placing customers at the heart of our daily business, treating each interaction as a chance to bring our purpose to life and making people’s journeys better.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> It is an exciting time to be joining Mobility UK as Shell evolves from a ‘fuels retailer’ to ‘mobility retailer’, innovating to meet changing customer expectations in respect to convenience, quality, digitalisation and services. Shell is at the leading edge of the energy transition, expanding into alternative energy such as LNG, hydrogen, EV charging or biofuels.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Within CR UK we look beyond the forecourt, forming strategic partnerships with leading brands to offer a broader breadth of products and services, helping customers optimise their fast-paced modern lives. In the UK, our CR alliance partnerships cover a wide range of areas incl. Costa Express, Jamie Oliver (healthier food-for-now), Waitrose, Budgens (extended grocery for Top Up shopping), Halfords (truck, car care range) and Uber Eats (home delivery).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> All of the above means CR UK continues to drive record performance year after year, delivering growth overhead of the market. This is an exciting opportunity to join a high performing team in a role that will allow the successful candidate to make their own mark.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of this role will be to manage assigned Categories &amp; Alliance Partners for the UK business, ensuring the key KPI metrics are met.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> This will require best-in-class category management skills and the successful candidate will be required to build extensive knowledge of their categories and the wider dynamics of the retail environment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> He\u002Fshe will be expected to define, shape, manage and monitor their categories; working with internal and external stakeholders to optimise an ever-evolving offer whilst delivering against business targets. Pivotal to the role will be interaction with suppliers and partners, negotiating then managing the execution of annual Joint Business Plans.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Key role activities and approach:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage the Category performance and P&amp;L against key KPI deliverables.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Thorough analysis and understanding of the category and market dynamics - measuring the category performance and maintaining an optimal balance between the long-term view and business demands of the annual targets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Developing profitable category business plans and ensuring all performance levers are optimized eg range, merchandising, price, promotions, operational excellence etc<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Owning the relationships and negotiation of trading terms with suppliers or alliance partners and identifying opportunities to drive efficiencies. Building appropriate JBPs with the supply base.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> As part of a global business, work collaboratively with the global category management team to unlock broader opportunities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and implement appropriate seasonal or event driven activities to maximise incremental sales and revenue (incl. identification of untapped seasonal and event driven trading opportunities)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effectively manage relationships with broader stakeholders and other teams within the business to deliver against our objectives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide an agile response when required to respond to changing market and business dynamics.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Experience as a category manager or buyer in a retail environment or experience working with these functions from an alternate background such as an FMCG account manager.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Result driven mindset; able to deliver against or support delivery of stretching business targets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactive in approach<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong commercial acumen, strong understanding of sales, margin and profitability metrics, supported with understanding of all factors that can influence performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong negotiations skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analytical skills, robust analytical skills demonstrable across different tools with high attention to detail<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A willingness to take ownership to deliver against the targets set.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent relationship management skills; able to adapt approach to different audiences or circumstances<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong interpersonal skills, able to communicate, engage, influence or challenge different stakeholders where required<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborative; able to work across multiple external and internal touch points, an effective team player and contributor<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Agility, able to respond at speed to changing business demands, reacting to challenging or unforeseen circumstances in a calm and measured manner, solving a problem firsthand if one should arise<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilience, up for a challenge and able to prioritise workload when under pressure from different stakeholders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attention to detail; ensuring all tasks are accomplished within the appropriate timescales.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
