<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Customer Identity and Access Management Analyst role is to be responsible for how we design, implement, and continually improve Customer Identity and Access Management (IAM), and Identity Governance. Administration used across external facing applications, products, services and backend technologies.Customer identity is key to Shell’s ensuring we connect, collect, protect our customers identities <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Define how our Identity Platform integrates with each platform<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for capturing and documenting all requirements from business in Opportunity framing documents and driving to completion and delivery to ensure value realization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with our Marketing team to ensure the platform delivers the required outcomes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Own any issues related to Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM), and maintain a backlog of continual improvements required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with software vendors to ensure processes and governance are in place, used and monitored to safeguard the deployment of IAM across different platforms<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand usage of the platform and costs associated with different actions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Being the expert for customer experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive xperience working in the area on the areas of Identity and Access Management (IAM), and Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) and with expertise in a global company with both internal and external relationships is required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in CIAM, digital and cloud identity will be particularly useful, this includes open standards as OAUTH, OIDC and API security Identity &amp; Access Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience delivering CIAM strategies, managing projects, teams and budgets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A relevant professional qualification such as CISSP, CISA or CISM is a strong advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS across main cloud service providers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stays current on IAM market trends and developments by means of conferences, competitive intelligence, and via a network of peers in external companies. Brings the external market view into IAM improvement and strategy discussions to ensure Shell is aware of potential market levers that can be exercised<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Pro-active and self-motivated<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy - Europe &amp; Africa (SE-EA) markets and trades natural Gas and Power across Europe and Africa. Shell Energy is growing fast with the expansion of Power and cleaner fuels as part of Shell’s strategy to thrive through the Energy Transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy has embarked on a significant change programme, looking to improve the systems and processes for Energy Trading in the UK, Europe and Africa. Shell Energy is seeking a talented Project Manager to lead and support a workstream building out the Trading\u002FAsset Optimisation &amp; Analytics Solution suite within the Power Trading business. This is an exciting, high profile, high impact role, leading significant strategic change through a complex organisation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shell Energy Power Project Manager will play a key role in Shell’s overall Transformation into a global Power business by supporting the building of elements of a Trading, Optimisation, Forecasting and Risk Analytics functions as well as leading new market expansion initiatives that will support Shell’s future business growth and ambitions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is business based, working closely with, but not within, IT. The Power Project Manager will capture and analyse business ambitions and requirements, evaluate the existing portfolio of initiatives and capabilities, identify gaps, recommend suitable actions to support and then lead elements of the required work through to delivery.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Manage Business and functions stakeholders; ensure stakeholders\u002Fdecision makers are sufficiently informed such that efficient delivery is realised. Stakeholders will include subject matter experts in Manual\u002F Algorithmic Trading, Asset Management, Optimisation, Virtual Power Plant, Forecasting, Business Development, Risk Management, amongst others<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide change leadership throughout the E2E change lifecycle within both the agile and waterfall methodologies, including requirements definition and articulation, design, development, testing, implementation, business readiness and embedding lasting business improvement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Process Management: The Power Project Manager will be responsible for creating robust, scalable, optimal and effective processes and ensuring that these are rolled out and practiced by the business and functions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Devise and validate delivery plans for various initiatives, manage and drive those plans to delivery<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide accurate, timely, relevant and transparent status and Management Information<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The SE-EA Power Project Manager will work closely with the IT Project Managers to plan, cost, resource, lead and deliver the changes required into this complex Trading\u002FAsset Optimisation &amp; Analytics Solution space.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As well as managing elements of delivery, the role also incorporates a significant analytical component and requires a drive to find pragmatic solutions to what will be complex, multi-dimensional challenges across technology, process, policy and politics.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> This position will report to the Power Transformation Programme Manager. The position is a leadership and analytical role, managing deliveries from IT, third party vendors, third party consultants, Portfolio Companies, the business, functions and process analysts but also providing analysis to provide solutions to business challenges.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Travel may also be required to other Shell Energy business hubs, if necessary, to ensure the effective implementation of Shell Energy projects and initiatives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Specifically, the successful candidate should have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Project delivery experience and qualifications, with a deep understanding of different delivery methodologies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A strong track record of delivering projects, ideally in an energy trading context<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong communication, stakeholder management and negotiation skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Determination, drive, and resilience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A strong desire to solve complex, data driven problem statements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A strong set of personal values<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good Knowledge of:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> The Energy Transition<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> EU Energy markets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> EU Balancing and Ancillary Services<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Vertically Integrated Energy Trading Companies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Physical Generation Assets (Renewables &amp; Flex)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Regulatory Change impacting the Energy Industry<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of managing complex 3rd party relationships (supplier, customer etc.)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> The ability to galvanize a multi-disciplined team behind a vision and drive to an outcome.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The primary accountabilities of the Power Quantitative Analyst are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Build pricing, modelling, and aid in automating execution across the Power space (Trading, Business Development and Origination), but with a lens across the entire LoaD<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Build a standardised platform for forecasting across assets \u002F intraday \u002F curve trading to optimise Power positions accordingly<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Look to provide digital solutions to all business development &amp; trading areas, including developing an automated trading strategy on initially short term, but increasingly longer dated positions \u002F markets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support in-flight projects to standardise processes and platforms across EMEA trading &amp; BD<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be able to contribute to enable high quality, shared understanding of market opportunities, trends, and value potential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Streamline and enhance the product array and functionality of the Power desk, including management of asset optimisation and all facets included; forecasting, intraday trading, balancing, etc<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work as a focal point for new and innovative solutions for the desk, as well as how to translate these into industrialised and repeatable processes for IT to standardise and further automate<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand the deal funnel in order to appropriately prioritise new opportunities into the portfolio across the team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor ‘deal stabilisation’ after deals move into the delivery phase ensuring operational excellence and excellent customer experience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Key “pre-trade” focal point on the desk for relevant quantitative information and queries<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitor model performance and use data \u002F KPIs to understand efficiency &amp; profitability of deals to help advise on commercial decisions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capture and share learnings from both internal and external experiences to Shell to help improve commercial and operational decision making in Shell Energy<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partner with IT, Business Excellence \u002F Commercial Delivery to select and implement (full lifecycle; scope, design, build test &amp; deploy) new IT solutions and enhancements to existing IT solutions in readiness for new value propositions or enter new markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bring rigour\u002Fgovernance to the delivery structure and where feasible drive towards full automation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Quantitative background: MSc in Mathematics, Engineering, Science or Operations Research<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Relevant front-office work experience in energy markets. Preference will be given to candidates with extensive experience in European power markets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Solid understanding of energy derivatives products, modelling, pricing, and hedging practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong knowledge of advanced numerical and optimization methods (e.g., Monte Carlo, finite difference, dynamic programming) for pricing and hedging energy derivatives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong coding skills in Python with working knowledge in either C# or modern C++ ( in .Net framework). Practical knowledge in functional programming is a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiar with software design patterns, modern technology stacks or DevOps tools (e.g., Azure, Github) is highly desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Have experience in querying API platforms and databases, and end to end application development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of power fundamentals and stack models is a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Can work autonomously on projects, manage time efficiently and deliver in a timely fashion<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Present experience driving forward with initiatives and projects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Enjoy the challenge of working in a customer focused, fast paced and rapidly evolving business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Social Investment in Shell UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The intent of our Social Investment (SI) programmes is primarily to benefit society and the environment where we operate, and secondly to create a more positive local business environment for Shell. As well as responding to local social investment priorities, we have four global social investment themes: access to energy; science, technology, engineering and mathematics education (STEM); and community skills and enterprise development.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> Generation Net Zero<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell in the UK is making a new £100m commitment to support communities across the UK by powering lives through jobs and skills. As part of this commitment, Shell will support 15,000 people into jobs, with a particular focus on the energy transition. Shell will showcase the opportunities available to people, inspire them to make career choices, invest in new skills to match demands required for the energy transition by establishing educational skills centres across the UK.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Aberdeen Hub Overview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As expectations for the Energy Transition (ET) continue to accelerate, we believe our existing UK oil and gas (upstream) footprint centred in Aberdeen (the so-called “Aberdeen hub”) increasingly represents a competitive advantage which can be leveraged by Shell to move fast in pursuing our ambitions to position for and develop low carbon energy opportunities, notably offshore wind, and CCS\u002Fhydrogen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are using the Scotwind opportunity as a live pathfinder to operationalise the hub concept over the course of 2022. Our Scotwind position (a 50\u002F50 partnership with Scottish Power Renewables) comprises two large-scale floating offshore wind projects totaling 5GW; these are long-term investments taking FID in approximately 2027-8 and will require around £20 billion (100%) investment in the coming decades.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> The Aberdeen Hub is a visible demonstration of the energy transition in action.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We are using the skills, relationships and assets that we have developed in our North Sea business over decades to accelerate the development of our emerging low carbon businesses such as offshore wind and CCS.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Our ambition is to be a significant contributor to the UK and Scotland’s net zero journey, share our learnings with other heartland oil and gas location in Shell and give people line of sight to future career opportunities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This role will sit in the Corporate Relations Social Investment Team and will be based in Aberdeen, sitting alongside the Corporate Relations Upstream team. The role will involve extensive travel across the UK to manage the development of critical skills across society. The primary focus of the role will be to manage National Skills programmes by partnering with external organisations to advance our Generation Net Zero goals. The role will also be a focal for the Aberdeen Hub and provide support to the Head of Corporate Relations for Upstream.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Corporate Relations team in Aberdeen provides support to all of our North Sea operations in the UK. The key dimensions of this team include maintaining license to operate for our conventional oil and gas operations, supporting the development of the regulatory and policy framework for emerging low-carbon opportunities such as CCS and hydrogen and providing CR support to projects and operational issues across the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p><b> Design and oversee delivery<\u002Fb> of UK-wide Skills strategies and programmes for the benefit of society. These should address key strategic themes such as demand and supply of skills, making an inclusive transition by support DE&amp;I objectives, deliver cross sector partnership (including with other energy businesses) and leverage funding where possible to advance common goals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Monitor evidence-based performance<\u002Fb>, ensuring robust measurement and insight programmes are in place and that data is used as the foundation of continuous improvement on drive skills outcomes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Ensure compliance<\u002Fb> with the Shell Social Investment framework by understand our investment approaches, partner identification and management of external partnerships for mutual benefit.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Stakeholder lead on skills<\u002Fb>. Engage with external stakeholders (communities, government, NGOs, coalitions) to identify common key skills issues and opportunities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Operationalise external commitments<\u002Fb> such as the NESA Skills MOU for ScotWind.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Primary UK lead for Skills and Portfolio Manager<\u002Fb>, manage a national programme of thematic skills investments across the UK to deliver towards our ambition skills goals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Ensure senior Shell UK leaders are fully engaged<\u002Fb> on Generation Net Zero strategy and key skills programmes and ensure a strong interface with the Global SI team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Manage skills budget<\u002Fb> and ensure effective and compliant contract management with external agencies, suppliers and partners, and seek alignment on our Ethical Conduct and HSSE standards and supplier principles with our contracting partners.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Act as a skills role model and thought leader<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p><b> Ability to deputize for CR Manager for Upstream internally<\u002Fb>; e.g. supporting SVP Upstream, representing CR at leadership team meetings and representing Shell externally.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As many of the following as possible:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Educated to degree level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide on the ground team leadership while CR Manager is on leave or traveling<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be confident, dynamic and have the ability to quickly gain the trust of stakeholders both internally and externally.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to build coalitions to progress complex multi-dimensions initiatives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be able to scan the ecosystem internally and externally on CR policy topics with focus on skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Must be at ease with identifying the challenges and opportunities for Shell in the UK and finding projects, investable ideas and ability to implement at scale<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Relevant experience of building social investment and skills strategies, managing budgets and overseeing programmes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong inter-personal and stakeholder engagement skills, ability to build trust and experience working in challenging external environments and in conflict resolution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong strategy, planning and team management capabilities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including and ability to deliver simple and understandable technical messages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of energy industry and stakeholders an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be the primary subject matter expert within Global Credit with respect to knowledge of European Crude, Products, Freight, LNG, Gas &amp; Power 3rd party overdue receivables, status and actions required to resolve for the respectful businesses\u002Fcommodity under T&amp;S (Trading &amp; Supply).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This includes maintaining consistent contact with finance operations, traders, regional team leads, operational support, finance managers, and legal to drive desired outcomes. Consistently provide vision and recommend\u002Fdeliver business strategies up to Global Head of Receivables Risk Management which will increase efficiencies and the effectiveness of collection efforts to support long term sustainable performance results.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As European Receivables Manager, your main responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Proactively managing a multi-billion global 3rd party receivables portfolio for European Crude, Products, LNG, Freight, Gas &amp; Power trading and supply.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continually reviewing KPIs and global aged receivables data to drive desired results, review, assess and submit provisions for doubtful debts or write offs to appropriate finance managers per MOA, ensure proper collateral utilization when delinquencies occur.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coordinating with respective underwriting analysts for actions to reduce\u002Famend credit terms or tenors in response to payment issues liaise with Shell legal for bankruptcy proof of claim submittals and status of existing claims, initiate external attorney placements assuring proper internal approvals and legal remedies are utilized to recover overdue receivables timely.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Appropriately escalating\u002Fcommunicating knowledge of customers which threaten non-payment or potential for default to leadership including respective finance operations management, finance managers, commercial management and legal.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Driving global targets (Reduction of overdue values\u002Fcount, Overdue %, Bad Debt %, WADD) to ensure we are maximizing cash flows and minimizing bad debts for business growth.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Producing global performance reports\u002Fdashboards to stakeholders, finance management and operations to provide transparency and maintain a consistent pulse of the Trading and Supply receivable health as well as concerns.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><br> On a wider level, you can look forward to a role that will be accountable for:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b> Acting as primary focal point with respect to global trading &amp; supply receivables <\u002Fb>to all commercial and financial stakeholders for the European Trading portfolio of businesses including VP\u002FGMs of Crude &amp; Products Trading and subordinate Finance Managers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Connectivity with FO\u002FCommercial\u002FFinance\u002FDemurrage\u002FCredit <\u002Fb>to ensure synchronized strategies; provide guidance to relevant analysts to ensure zero gaps, timely collection of receivables and ultimately, payment driven to terms:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Coordinate the activities required for dispute resolution to cancel and re-issue invoices timely.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist\u002FGuide\u002FTrain Chennai FO analysts in understanding the reasons for the overdue, and in wording e-mails to be sent to counterparties.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor items that are approaching time bar and discuss appropriate actions with the desk.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Pursue a selected number of the most difficult counterparties directly, i.e., those requiring more intricate knowledge interfacing with FMs and Commercial Credit Managers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Undertake monthly desk reviews to ensure desk leads\u002FRTLs are aware of delinquent issues and taking appropriate actions on overdues in a timely fashion; facilitate links with Legal, Tax, Compliance and Operations to drive recovery.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Leverage best practices across different portfolios &amp; countries re: successful collection strategies.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure adherence with local laws &amp; regulations, including training FO staff where necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Co-ordinate with Underwriting on any urgent need to reduce\u002Famend credit terms in response to evidence of delayed payment, and implications for counterparty’s fundamental creditworthiness.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide routine presentations with respect to RRM results\u002Fstrategies\u002Fvision to Credit\u002FRisk peers, FiB, Demurrage and Commercial.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Overdue exposure monitoring:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Analyze on weekly basis the existing Top 20 highest overdue\u002Fother reporting from FO, provide feedback on &amp; inquiries into the new\u002Frecurring\u002Flegacy overdues to drive appropriate recovery strategies and work with FO to amend or streamline existing processes that yield improved results.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Reporting:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> In depth Monthly\u002FQuarterly reporting of overdues by VP\u002FGM\u002FRTL, trends, highlight concerns and\u002For challenges related to overdues (Top 20, RPM PPT’s, Credit Committee slide decks, Doubtful debt provisions\u002Freversals, write offs, as well as ad hoc requests from stakeholders regarding receivables exposures tied to specific businesses or desks).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review &amp; continuously suggest improvements to KPI reporting to drive desired results which reduce overdue exposures.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Present results\u002Fconcerns to various stakeholders within the business through reporting and presentations in meeting sessions.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Security Management\u002FUtilization:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Checks with Collateral management for LC’s or cash available as potential leverage\u002Fresolution to overdue receivables based upon contractual language.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Bad Debt Management:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Construct promissory notes, payment plans or other structured solutions, working alongside relevant Commercial Credit Managers, to assist customers experiencing short term cash flow issues to ultimately obtain funding and avoid a bad debt.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Produce contractual Notices of Pending default to allow for Shell to legally terminate if necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Liaise with legal, finance, contracts, the desk and the counterparty to assist in the submission of claim exposures and track status in bankruptcy cases\u002Fdisputes pursued through the courts.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review, assess and submit provisions for doubtful debts (SOX Control) and write-off requests for approval by Business owners, FMs and Accounting Operations based upon age\u002Fviability of receivable collection. Work with FO and Financial Accounting to ensure appropriate bookings are made in line with policy, and that bad debts flow down to the P&amp;L of the relevant desk.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform monthly reconciliation of bad debt provision balances to question completeness, value accuracy as per accounting standards, sufficient documentation as support, confirmed expected partial\u002Ffull recovery in future.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Complete ad hoc request and special projects as assigned<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from professionals ideally having:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Degree in Accountancy or Finance, ACCA is an advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant years of levant experience in full-fledged Settlements\u002FAccounts Receivable (AR), preferably in the oil &amp; gas \u002F commodity trading or banking industry<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with SAP system<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proficient in excel and comfortable with data analytics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in Credit Risk and Analysis, Corporate Bankruptcy and Debt Recovery, or other relevant related functionalities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good communication and interpersonal skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Self-starter, highly motivated, outcome driven<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SE-EA is part of the Shell Trading &amp; Supply organization with a focus on European gas and power markets. As such, SE-EA trades natural gas, power, green power certificates, voluntary\u002Fcompliance driven environmental products with counterparties including major resource holders of gas, upstream producers, investment banks, trading houses, utilities, power generators, large as well as up-and coming retail gas and power marketing companies, regional and local gas and power distribution companies, gas storage operators, and large industrial and commercial gas and power users.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful applicant will sit on the UK Power Trading Desk, focusing on pricing and managing short and long term renewable PPAs in the UK market across multiple technology types and pricing structures.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The UK Power Trading team itself, part of Shell Energy Europe &amp; Africa’s (SE-EA) European Power Trading team, is responsible for the proprietary trading, and the management of a growing portfolio comprising customer demand, renewable, batteries and thermal generation. The team manages exposures down the curve through to delivery.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Owning the pricing of a growing pipeline of long and short term UK market PPAs, as part of the UK power trading desk<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Driving the assessment and ongoing review of long and short term technology specific PPA risk premia, working closely with fundamental analytics, deal structuring and origination<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Designing dynamic short term and curve hedging strategies to be implemented by the desk to manage associated PPA exposures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contributing to the optimization of the renewable generation forecasting process for the existing PPA portfolio, and exploring how learnings can be applied to new deal pricing<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Observe and strictly comply with all regulatory guidelines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You are likely to be a strong contender if you can demonstrate the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A deep understanding of the fundamental drivers of long term PPA risks and how these translate into PPA pricing<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of pricing renewable PPAs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of a wide variety of PPA commercial pricing structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of designing or implementing renewable PPA hedging strategies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An understanding of UK power market fundamentals (short and long term) and PPA market dynamics<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An understanding of Python or other coding languages may be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Our workplace is changing quickly in many exciting ways, but also needing to perform in an increasingly complex environment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The way we work is critical, whether that is:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> innovating how we work<\u002Fli>\n   <li> the day to day basic of running and improving our operated portfolios performance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> developing oil and gas reserves economically to meet the external promises Shell has made and<\u002Fli>\n   <li> responding to new challenges in securing wind and Carbon Capture Storage (CCS)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is the chief coach and change management expertise that will further improve performance in leadership and the frontline.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Organisation Effectiveness &amp; Continuous Improvement (OE\u002FIC) Lead is part of the Shell UK Transformation team and will provide Continuous Improvement (CI) expertise to the business and report into the GM Transformation. We are deeply passionate about securing the UK’s future through sustainable change. Your passion is to enable organisations performs by supporting leaders to run their business activity through their people, developing and empower them to do so.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The OE\u002FCI Lead will be the role accountable for practically developing and driving the UK’s cultural and behavioural journey through others. You’ll thrive on taking external concepts and the best of OE and CI knowledge to help define a new culture and leadership journey, bringing that to life through a cross campus implementation plan.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll be responsible for the UK’s capability and competence, ensuring we can deliver and meet current requirements as well as building the plan for tomorrow’s needs. Working with the Transformation Lead you’ll build the CI deployment plan and be accountable for building CI skills and culture through each area of the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specifically, your role will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Identifying barriers to delivery of business goals and objectives by engaging with senior business leaders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Providing deep and meaningful subject matter expertise in cultural change, change management and continuous improvement ways of working.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Developing meaningful solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The way you engage and ask questions will unlock thinking in the business activity and over time you will see the way people work and deliver together improve performance. The impact of your support and interventions will bring to life, in peoples work and leadership the Shell Mindsets and Behaviours that will power our progress.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your input shapes the transformation approach and agenda. You are seen as part of powerful partnerships with leaders to unlock people and the value they create. The role requires understanding of the current business context and external environment, combined with experience in cultural and CI improvement and the ability to translate that knowledge and deliver in a programmatic way.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Furthermore, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Substantial OE experience and practical application across a range of businesses and\u002For industries<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated CI mastery, Experienced Lean Master or Certified Six Sigma (Black Belt)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Track record of delivering sustainable cultural change and business improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent ability to build relationships and influence to deliver change.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Detailed knowledge of organisational design, effectiveness, and transformation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to coach and build capability and competency across an organisation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven leadership and executive coaching skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A broad mindset and background that leverages system thinking, HR and people development to harness the various levers that contribute to successful change delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to connect apparently disparate objectives and solutions and make these meaningful to the business in support of its goals<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Loyalty, CRM and Payment Manager, UK Mobility<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit In <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Mobility is not only Shell’s largest customer-facing business, serving over 30m customers per day through 500,000 service champions in over 44,000 sites across 70+ countries, but also the #1 Mobility business in the world. Still, we are on a significant and ambitious growth journey to double the business and thrive through the energy transition. Achieving our ambitions will mean keeping customers at the heart of our business and treating every interaction as a chance to deliver on our purpose of Making Life’s Journeys Better.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re evolving from ‘fuels retailer’ to ‘mobility retailer’- innovating to meet our customers’ changing expectations around convenience, product quality, digitalization and service. This includes continuing to improve the quality of our current products while expanding our alternative energy mosaic (LNG, hydrogen, EV charging and biofuels).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> People make the difference real! Mobility is the most customer intimate business in Shell and a front seat to the mobility transition seen from the eyes of customers. A career in Mobility is fast-paced and dynamic whether you are creating a rewards program for our service champions, developing an award-winning app for our customers, developing a community engagement program or engineering a safe forecourt. Come join us as we embark on the next phase of our ambition focusing on e-mobility and decarbonization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>A successful Loyalty program is built on the foundations of providing customers differentiated offerings, experiences &amp; compelling rewards which give them reasons to visit again &amp; again, forming specific behaviours which drive value for them &amp; the business. We’re looking for a Loyalty, CRM &amp; Payment manager who wants to lead our business through a step change bringing our traditional fuel and EV loyalty propositions together and working daily to quickly grow &amp; retain the customer base as customer needs &amp; expectations evolve through the energy transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The Shell Mobility business in the UK consists of about 1,100 service stations. This role reports into the UK Marketing Manager and has responsibility for the strategic evolution and delivery of the loyalty space to achieve our ambitious growth targets of tripling our membership base and becoming the #1 industry loyalty programme, thereby generating significant value to the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Mobility in the UK also has strong ambitions to grow its CR offerings, as well as win with energy transition and carbon reduction initiatives such as EV charging and Nature Based Solutions and at the same time maximise the income from our fuel products, including Shell VPower. A strong loyalty proposition has the ability to glue all these pieces together plus extend into other Shell B2C propositions such as home energy and home charging. It requires agile, customer-focused, commercial results-orientated leadership.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Reset the strategic direction of the UK loyalty programme over the next 3-5 years by taking insights from the existing programme and market, and localising and delivering key centralized Loyalty CVPs, Partnerships &amp; strategies to achieve our growth ambitions. A key strategic focus will include incorporating EV charging into our loyalty programme to offer our customers a path through the energy transition.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Translate the strategy into marketing plans and drive the annual implementation in a way that optimises returns from the available investment budgets. Responsible for achieving loyalty KPIs and supporting the wider marketing function achieve theirs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Line management for the UK loyalty, CRM and payment team (currently 5 people). Develop and strengthen an aligned, cohesive and integrated team through actively providing performance management, career coaching and talent development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborate with the broader UK Mobility team (Fuels, Convenience Retail, Brand &amp; Communications, IDT, and Site Operations) to ensure loyalty acquisition, activation &amp; retention is an essential value driver in the business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive the CRM agenda and unlock the value from new global platforms<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Grow the Life Time Value of our customers by giving them credible reasons to stay loyal to Shell through the energy transition and become customers of other Shell businesses too (e.g. Shell Energy Retail Ltd) through integrated propositions. Use the lens of Cash, Carbon, Customer and Collaboration<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Accountable for HSSE, ensuring no data breaches or legal issues and regulatory compliance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contract holding responsibility for loyalty-related agency contracts<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What We Need from You<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role requires an individual who has vision for a new, integrated energy loyalty landscape with the customer at the heart, and strong commercial acumen to deliver it and inspire all stakeholders. Your people skills will make the difference to inspire others, gain buy in and deliver an industry leading programme. Furthermore, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Substantial loyalty experience of launching, developing and operating a large-scale loyalty programme, the customer offer, engagement and earn\u002Fburn cycle, redemption strategies, loyalty performance and liability management, preferably in other B2C environments<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A proven &amp; strong track record of strategic thinking, setting new strategies and delivering a step change in a loyalty programme<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong technical understanding of current digital platforms across end to end as well as marketing opportunities to grow value from loyalty, CRM and payment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Build credible business cases, understand value realization<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong team leadership credentials, able to inspire, develop and manage a team and strong succession planning<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A strong team player with a passion to collaborate across the UK business and with Global colleagues, and strong stakeholder management, communication and presentation skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to grow customer base, grow retention and advocacy, and proven &amp; strong track record for improving program performance against specific business targets. Ideally also brings partnership experience with other brands<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Confidence in evaluating and analyzing complex data - identifying key customer trends<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Exposure to working iteratively in an agile manner with determination to understand quickly what works best for customers, with a fail fast, test &amp; learn innovative mentality<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in developing promotional strategies &amp; Customer Value Propositions as well as executing promotions &amp; campaigns against a marketing plan or calendar<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> In-depth understanding of business operation and execution at frontline.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> London-based with expectations of 3 days\u002Fwk in the office \u002F on site \u002F at agency<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice. We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
