<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re seeking an energetic self-starter relationship builder to take up this exciting new Territory Manager role supporting our Distributors sales teams to retain, develop and grow the Shell brand from a marketing and technical perspective.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be based within the Midlands Territory (Merseyside, Cheshire, Derbyshire, Staffordshire. Nottinghamshire, Lincolnshire, Midlands, Shropshire, Leicestershire, Herefordshire, Worcestershire, Warwickshire, Northamptonshire, Cambridgeshire, Norfolk, Suffolk, Essex, Bedfordshire, Hertfordshire, Buckinghamshire, Oxfordshire, Gloucestershire &amp; Wiltshire).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> As Territory Manager, you’ll be based within the area outlined above and live within the UK, working from your home office. The role will encounter visiting customers within the patch as a minimum of 3-4 days per week. The role will be reporting directly to the UK Indirect Business Manager supporting the passenger car motor oil growth.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is a start-up sales role to learn and understand this vital customer facing role, while developing a career plan within a strong team environment.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A company vehicle will be provided travel for site visits within the region. The key objective of the role is to build strong relationships with a broad range of distributors, branches and independent workshops. Putting customers at the centre, you will be working to develop our distributors knowledge on the Shell Lubricants portfolio, drive successful implementation of marketing initiatives and use your influencing skills to execute more commercial lubricants opportunities and the wider Shell portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You do not need to have pre-existing lubricants knowledge, as the role will be part of the Shell development programme! Your excellent communication skills, strong work ethic and passion for customer service will set you up for success. You’ll thrive nurturing a range of trusted stakeholder relationships, at all levels, that deliver great results.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specific duties include:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Operate in a safe environment and then ensure that health and safety of products is understood across our distributors and end users.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactive customer account management, ensuring Shell is providing top level customer service.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Spot and execute opportunities to grow market share, sharing best practice as you go.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be a brand ambassador, clearing communicating the Shell customer value proposition.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supports system set-ups and changes (pricing, contracts etc.) based on the information provided and assists in analysis of information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Guides internal stakeholders (e.g. Sales team) based on basic data analysis and provides incidental support (in the set up and amendment of contracts etc.).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Handles complex activities with moderate variation. Deals with less straightforward questions, adjustment with many sources of information necessary within and outside business supported.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provides support in managing multiple processes and systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works within a limited variety of well-defined procedures and practices (not necessarily standardized) and is supervised on progress and results by manager. Works autonomously within this defined scope, directly supporting management and specialists.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Naturally, you’ll be a motivated self-starter and graduate, perhaps with some professional experience from a commercial and customer service background, although, this is not essential. Beyond that, we’re keen to talk to men and women with evidence of the following on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ability to develop business relationships with key stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent organisational and prioritisation skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Evidence of strong commercial ability<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An ability to influence others by confidently communicating the benefits of initiatives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Passionate and curious to learn and develop a career within sales environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Clean Driving License is essential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Service Manager – Software License you will actively participate in the day-to-day delivery of the software license management service, acting as a key interface between the Software License Managed Service Provider and Shell service management. This includes, but is not limited to, the successful execution of repeatable and consistent software license compliance assessments, supporting remediation of compliance gaps and driving continuous process improvement. You will also maintain the framework to implement appropriate license cost recovery from the businesses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will form a key interface with the License Managed Service Provider to ensure that supported publishers are managed in a compliant and optimal way in accordance with existing contracts with all control points met. You must manage senior stakeholders both inside and outside IT as software license contracts can be held within lines of business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The successful candidate will have experience with software license management processes and tooling, with particular subject matter expertise across Microsoft products. A proven track record in identifying and driving process improvements is key to success in this role, as are excellent stakeholder management skills.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Understanding a complex Service solution which includes contract advice, tooling for entitlement tracking as well as trending usage of products across multiple environments.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Acting as the escalation point where the Managed Service Provider may need information and or actions from other Shell businesses and\u002For service providers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Validating the correct license consumption logic in Software Asset Management tooling<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assisting Service Provider with manual data gathering of software consumption unable to be performed by available tools<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Translating technical recommendations coming from the Software License Managed Service Provider into business actionable items to maintain compliance and optimize software license costs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Taking initiative and fostering collaboration and communication between natural team members on technical issues, process improvements, remediation actions as well as identifying and escalating risks and issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Dimensions &amp; Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Understanding a complex Service solution which includes contract advice, tooling for entitlement tracking as well as tracking of usage along across multiple tools &amp; providers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assisting with vendor audit requests as necessary<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Aligning key control requirements with processes and procedures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> “Future proofing” the process to keep up with ever-changing technology delivery and translating needs into the reality of the service<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting Service Manager\u002F Finance on cost allocation requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated ability to influence at levels above\u002Fbelow his\u002Fher role in the organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Managing Senior stakeholder expectations and communications requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Managing time and work-life balance is critical<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The core competences required for this role are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Significant experience in Microsoft license management across a complex global landscape<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelor’s Degree in IT or a related discipline<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience of IT service management and delivery in a large business environment Certifications in ITIL, Business Analysis and\u002For Project Management is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in coordinating, planning and delivering with limited direction; able to effectively prioritize tasks and manage time effectively<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skilled in effective problem solving with a keen attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to work under pressure, manage conflicting priorities and take responsibility for delivery to key timeframes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent technical skill in using Microsoft Office Excel (tables, charts, pivot tables), PowerPoint and reporting tools<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal and communication skills using different mediums<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skilled in being able to influence others without formal authority to deliver desired results<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skilled in being able to work independently across different organizational boundaries, cultures and in a global and virtual environment<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will lead the design and development of technical solutions meeting the IT project needs of the business.<br> <br> You will support the planning, development and use of middleware technologies and services for integrating systems and exposing, transporting, and consuming data in a secure and reliable manner across a hybrid of applications, services, and trading partners both on premise and in the Cloud.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We and our extended team in Shell focus on Oil Market Analysis. We build complex data products around the fundamentals of oil market that provides innovative and often industry first insight that supports our commodities trading business. As a Technical Lead, we are looking for an individual with proven experience in providing technical and process guidance and mentoring the team to set them up for long term success. You'll be challenged to think and do differently, with the opportunity to get involved at all stages from discovery and design to embedding and scaling.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> What you will do:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Be responsible for technology, architecture, and overall technical quality of our product.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leading, managing and mentoring a team of engineers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with your users, stakeholders, and delivery team to understand and deliver value through your product.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Align with technical leaders to shape and implement Shell's strategy<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Senior Software Engineer, you would possess the following skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Deep experience in Data Development (T-SQL \u002F SQL \u002FAzure Cosmos\u002F Azure SQL\u002F Mongo etc.)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in Python (for data engineering), Spark\u002FpySpark, Typescript and other programming frameworks and paradigm<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with a leading SPA framework (React, etc)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with C# or other .Net framework languages<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with Jupyter Notebooks and related infrastructure (Databricks, Azure Analytics Services, etc)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of microservice architecture patterns<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to mix strategic and pragmatic approaches to drive product delivery<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in leading an engineering team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> You have a very strong technical knowledge in current web technologies, cloud services, and infrastructure<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong experience in delivering multiple global products<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of other Cloud (Azure etc) is highly desirable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of containers and functions is highly desirable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated application of the best patterns &amp; practices in the software development life cycle<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working in agile teams with demonstrated application of the principles, including facilitation of the planning process<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas, and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The primary accountabilities of the Deal Management Specialist are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Support in-flight projects to standardise processes and platforms across EMEA trading &amp; Business Devlopment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Be able to contribute to enable high quality, shared understanding of market opportunities, trends, and value potential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Streamline and enhance the product array and functionality of the Power desk, incorporate effective controls, particularly for new deals\u002Fprojects done by the team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive LoaD performance improvements across the Power Business, including the interface into the Renewable Energy Solution businesses. Represent Power interests in process, system, tools, or control initiatives done by SE-EA or the wider Shell group<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Champion Operational Excellence, and along with IT and the Functions, alleviate current pain points and look to make the LoaD more efficient, including the use of digital solutions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Represent Power for functional relationships to help in delivering the portfolio of projects across SE-EA<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prompt consistent usage of deal funnel tools (e.g. Salesforce) to enable high quality, shared understanding of opportunity characteristics and value potential. Monitor model performance and use data \u002F KPIs to enhance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Streamline and enhance the customer onboarding and management process, including management of the SE-EA BIAM network and engagement with the central KYC team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Streamline Monthly and Quarterly MI request fulfilment, inclusive drafting and realising signoff of submissions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Power Business Manager this new position will be focal in improving practice and operational excellence to enhance commercial activities within the SE-EA Power portfolio. This role will focus on optimising end-to-end trade capabilities, providing standardisation, consistency, and excellence to BAU operations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate would have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in commercial \u002F operational roles, ideally in the Power market, with a strong track record of performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Market Risk \u002F Finance processes an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactive approach and mindset to propose and drive improvement and changes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Thorough understanding of Operational risk, and LoaD.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience and appreciation of purposeful collaboration<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prioritisation skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commitment to compliance is essential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A “can do” attitude is a must<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> With a perspective across the entire business and functional areas, as well as numerous stakeholder interfaces, this role is well placed to leverage a central position within the organisation to make connections and drive effective change<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Scalability &amp; Robustness: drive step change in these facets of business performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Written and spoken language skills in following languages an advantage: Spanish, German, Dutch or Italian<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>Written and spoken language skills in following languages an advantage: Spanish, German, Dutch or Italian <\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Business Analyst should have expertise in SAP Controlling with development capabilities for the Finance Business area in Oil &amp; Gas industry solution.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in delivering complete Controlling solutions to the business, proficient in analysing and translating Business\u002FProcess requirements to technical requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Certain degree of knowledge in S4 HANA Controlling and other modules is desired.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Performs the configurations &amp; ensures that Build standards are adhered to best practices.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understands the ERP Controlling configurations &amp; master data activities with cross functional area Integration with other modules.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of Business requirements and develop the IT Solution by working along with Process Architects\u002FDesign Authorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Works with Lead Business Analyst\u002FProcess Experts to develop technical design specification for solutions with high complexity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Performs Unit Test and supports Integration Test for the applicable solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Undertake Problem Analysis to identify root causes of incidents, escalating findings within the Line and Business, to minimize such incidents re-occurring.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive resolution of defects during test cycles and hyper care as well as for critical incidents. Supports the resolution of Production issues in meetings with the Run &amp; Maintain organization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Define and Safeguard IT solution to ensure Robust, Supportable &amp; Scalable to ensure IT documentations are updated prior to Change Advisory Board meetings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Propose any possible functional improvement in the existing solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Has detailed functional understanding of the application \u002F module in their scope and how this is supporting the business process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all changes are properly and extensively documented.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fully comply with and adhere to, all Group and Upstream IT standards and Processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Substantial experience in SAP Controlling module configuration and understanding of the associated business processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> End to end implementations in SAP CO Projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong domain business knowledge in Accounting &amp; Cost Accounting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive experience in all aspects of SAP Controlling including CCA, PCA, Product Costing Material Ledger, PAPM Module and Profitability Analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Should have been a Solution architect \u002F Subject matter expert in the areas of SAP CO.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Should have experience in SAP implementations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Should have experience in the planning areas that impact CO including PA P&amp;L.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong understanding of the CO modules integration points between FI, SD, PP and MM<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge in Bank Accounting, Asset Accounting, Account Payables and Special Purpose Ledger Accounting and other modules is desired.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skills with only Support experience or majority of support experience will not be Suitable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Certain degree of knowledge in S4 HANA integration with other modules will be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Well versed with S4 HANA system implementation methodology<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Dedication to meet the customer requirements and expectations, taking ownership of problems and respond in a proactive manner where appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good problem analysis skills and English communication skills, verbally and in writing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to handle concurrent tasks with appropriate priority.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in global implementation\u002Fsupport of an S4 HANA solution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As Microsoft Azure Active Directory and Most Confidential (MC - Sensitive data) you will be focused on the Microsoft Azure\u002FM365 stack. You will be responsible in both strategic and hands on in the Azure platform, needing technical skills as the Microsoft tenant Services lead (MTS) and Most confidential data (MC) lead responsible for any technical duties with cloud computing including design, planning, management, maintenance, and support of Microsoft Azure focused on Integration on Azure workloads to Azure Active Directory. You will work closely with Microsoft on upcoming improvements and Preview testing.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The MTS\u002FMC Solution Architect needs to collaborate with Suppliers and Shell staff to define IAM (Identity and Access Management) solutions and associated architectures to meet Shell business requirements. They need to review and select appropriate Microsoft Azure solutions and when necessary, define Shell standards, Integration Patterns and practices to guide the implementation and maximum utilization of the solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> The MTS\u002FMC Architect is accountable for supporting other Segment Architect in defining the current and target architecture and standards for MC Solutions that are typically offered as services: Identity Management, Authentication, Federation, Identity Governance and Administration, Access Control, Governance Risk and Compliance. This is done in consultation with Shell Architects supporting other segments, Information Risk Analysts, L&amp;R Compliance Analysts, Industry Standards Bodies and Consultants, as well as software and service suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The MTS\u002FMC Solution Architect provides guidance to other Reference and Solution architects on standards, deployment patterns and maintains the domain-specific architecture roadmaps.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The MTS\u002FMC Solution Architect supports the definition of the Shell Target Operating Environment reference architectures for MC.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The MTS\u002FMC Solution Architect works closely with assigned supplier architect(s) and key Shell SME’s and stakeholders to determine potential use of new technologies and solutions for Shell within this area.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The MTS\u002FMC Solution Architect steers the technical aspect of projects, assisting in product selection, consolidating services, consulting on usage of IAM solutions and retiring the legacy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The MTS\u002FMC Solution Architect is responsible for generating and maintaining Technical Architecture Roadmaps for their areas of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Special Challenges:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Defining and implementing the MTS\u002FMC Patterns of integration and Solutions that support the vision and strategy underlying the MTS\u002FMC Reference architecture. Implementation and adoption of services across the enterprise are the desired outcome and define success.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and maintain several components of the landscaping (target \u002F roadmap) MSFT Azure and MC Architecture for the whole of Shell.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Special Challenges:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Defining and implementing the MC Patterns of integration and Solutions that support the vision and strategy underlying the MC Azure Reference architecture. Implementation and adoption of services across the enterprise are the desired outcome and define success.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and maintain several components of the landscaping (target \u002F roadmap) MSFT Sensitive data and RBAC\u002FEntitlement management Architecture for the whole of Shell.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working closely with portfolio, suppliers, partners, supplier delivery, IRM, LOI\u002FFE and others to ensure Reference architecture and roadmaps and plans account for business requirements and can be applied effectively.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the below skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> A university degree, preferably in Information Technology, Information Management, Software Engineering, or related field<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Extensive experience in IT industry focused on MSFT technologies in medium to large enterprises or government sector, or experience in roles where they held similar accountabilities to those listed below – preferably demonstrate experience with ‘enterprise scale’ solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience and Qualifications in the following technologies: Microsoft Azure qualifications<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Aware of Architecture and Business Analysis frameworks, principles, policies, standards and governance processes (or related like TOGAF) – preferably TOGAF 9 certified<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in one or more of the following architecture disciplines - technical, data, application, or integration<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal\u002Fcommunication skills, both oral and written. Good storytelling capabilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p> The world is changing fast, and Shell is changing too, working to become a net zero emissions energy business by 2050, in step with society. Shell’s integrated Corporate Relations function supports Shell’s strategy and sectoral approach to cutting emissions through improved policy and advocacy outcomes.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> The Integrated Power Policy &amp; Thought Leadership Researcher will provide junior policy support to Shell’s centralised team of 6 e-mobility, wind, solar and integrated power policy experts as Shell seeks to build a material global power business.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>Objectives:<\u002Fp>\n      <p> 1. Horizon scanning: Understand and summarise reports, events and viewpoints from key think-tanks, NGOs and academics and rapidly determine how those views should influence Shell’s policy development and advocacy strategies.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> 2. Policy alignment: Help integrate and aligning local market policy positions with Shell’s global positions in the areas of offshore wind, onshore renewables (wind &amp; solar) batteries, microgrids, power trading, electric mobility, and supply to customers. Maintain Shell’s global and regional (EU) advocacy dashboard, flagging where extra advocacy activity or policy development will be required to keep Shell on track to achieve our business objectives.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> 3. Communications &amp; Reputation: Support the wider team deliver events and thought leadership<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Proven experience in developing policy, either in a company, in an agency or as a junior civil servant<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Some experience of any aspect of the power market, climate or energy policy or e-mobility.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Ability to roll sleeves up and support a team of 6 deliver their policy and communications objectives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Excellent communications, writing and editing skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Demonstrated experience managing complex interfaces and building trusted relationships with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders, including executive-level leaders<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> The ability to prioritise competing requests and deadlines effectively.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Demonstrated ability to write, edit and proofread at an advanced skilled level in the English language for a variety of audience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> The ability to work independently and exercise good judgment and decision-making.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Proven ability to work to deadline while managing multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with constantly shifting priorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Strategic and creative thinker and problem-solver.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Strong attention to detail and able to learn new material quickly.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint) require.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Shell UK’s London office (Waterloo) - Please only apply if you have the right to work in the UK<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Monitoring &amp; Surveillance (M&amp;S) team has global responsibility for the monitoring &amp; surveillance of the trading practices and business communications in T&amp;S. The core analyst M&amp;S is a member of the M&amp;S data analytics centre of excellence (CoE) and reports into the CoE Manager M&amp;S.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Core Analyst, you will support the review process for automatically generated surveillance alerts to identify potentially suspicious activity requiring escalation and support investigations and targeted monitoring of T&amp;S activities. You will also support changes to monitoring &amp; surveillance processes to drive effectiveness and efficiency improvements, based on sound market\u002Fproduct and risk understanding.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specific responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Support business-as-usual monitoring of trading activity based on review and investigation of automated alerts to identify potential market integrity or other compliance risks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the review of the firm’s positions against regulatory and\u002For exchange delivery\u002Fexpiry limits to identify potential breaches and understand trading behaviour.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the monitoring of transactions based on review and investigation of automated alerts to identify potential financial crime risks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support business as usual monitoring of business communications based on review and investigation of automated alerts to identify potential market integrity or other compliance risks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work with Senior Analysts to carry out initial escalation of an alert or investigation into suspicious activities and support the ongoing investigation through to conclusion as appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support targeted monitoring of individuals, desks or transactions based on trigger events, including analysis of trading and communications activities and other available data points, to assess for potential market integrity or other compliance risks, particularly as I pertain to data manipulation and analysis-type tasks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop good understanding of market integrity risks and the products and ways in which Shell T&amp;S trades.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work collaboratively with the other analysts in the CoE.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Monitoring and Trade Surveillance: Foundational understanding of market integrity risks and how they would manifest themselves across Oil and Energy markets based on good knowledge of previous cases and the firm’s activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Regulatory Landscape Insight: Desirable: Foundational understanding of market integrity, compliance and financial crime regulations and expectations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Market and Product Knowledge: Foundational understanding of oil and energy products and how they trade, including physical markets logistics (this may be specific to one or two product areas)., and therefore the ability to identify unusual behaviours. Desirable: Proficient understanding of products and how they trade.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Data Manipulation and Analysis: Proficient\u002FAdvanced data manipulation and analytical skills allowing for large data sets to be assessed to identify trends and outliers to support investigations into trading activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Language Skills: Desirable: Additional European or Asian languages<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Core Soft Skills: Proficient communication and collaboration skills, demonstrating the ability to set the right tone and relay information succinctly and\u002For persuasively to get tasks completed in a timely manner. Foundational business analysis and report writing skills to process information, make critical judgements and present findings in a clear and concise manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is part of and supports a global team. This role will primarily work with the Shell Energy business. This includes the domestic gas\u002Fpower marketing businesses in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia, along with the Global LNG (SLMT) business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role offers the candidate the opportunity to participate in the new and growing LNG and Energy businesses. There will be many ‘new’ and ‘first’ for the candidate to be part of. The role is responsible for working with business and IT to deliver solutions in projects or enhancements for the evolving LNG and Energy business needs.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><br> The role is expected to work in predominately the DevOps way of working. The role will be working directly with business to understand business issues, fact finding, analyse impacts and dependencies, recommend end-to-end solution design, independently or work as a team, to implement the solution, or solve an incident or problem.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will work in project and\u002For application support teams in the delivery of projects and may include tasks from every part of the software development lifecycle, including task management, requirements gathering and traceability, prototyping, design and development, testing and release\u002Fpatching.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role may also support turn-key\u002FSaaS solutions, which needs to work with third party suppliers to implement change requests, support end-to-end internal and user testing, testing\u002Ftrials of software patches\u002Fupgrades, support deployment, post deployment validation and business acceptance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role may also involve the prototyping and delivery of a solution or new technology, which may include new development, configuration, and installation of third -party packages, and software integration efforts. It may include tasks from every part of the software development lifecycle, including design, development, programming, and software deployment (both the installation and decommissioning of software).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Deliveries process and activities, standards, and communications, will be in accordance with the enterprise\u002Fteam guidelines, tooling, processes, and norms (e.g., attending and providing sharing sessions, attending scrum calls, process improvements, etc)<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Capture and document user requirements into specifications, from inputs from subject matter experts and Design Authority.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding business requirements, to pilot and prototype new solutions and technologies, including procurement, setup, development, demonstration, and deployment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support Projects and Support teams in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including Requirements Gathering, Analysis, Design, Coding, Testing, Implementation, and Production support for software systems.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Determine and design solutions that are scalable and sustainable for a global business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish and maintain stakeholder satisfaction levels. Build and develop strong trust relationships with the stakeholders demonstrated through clearly owning, resolving, and communicating issues and problems<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute\u002Fparticipate in local and global IT community activities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Intermediate\u002FExpert level of experience in successfully providing application support \u002F development in a corporate setting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Full life cycle development experience in a project development role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in supporting a diverse application landscape, including change management, application testing, data integrity management, patch management and end-user support and training.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience designing or changing business critical reports\u002Fprocesses to gain full value from technology solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Power and Energy trading industry experience required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of valuation and pricing models as they pertain to energy commodities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commodity experience with one or more of the following commodities: Power, Natural Gas, LNG or NGL.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Corporate IT experience as Endur Developer.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Has work experience of the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Openlink Endur (v14+) development experience<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Endur AVS\u002FJVS coding skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> In-depth knowledge of Endur’s DB schema<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Extensive knowledge of Endur’s Simulation Results and AVS\u002FJVS Libraries<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Experienced in handling memory management issues with AVS\u002FJVS scripting<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiar with Microsoft Azure DevOps tools (such as VSTS and GIT)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Familiar with Software Engineering processes (such as Configuration Management, Change Management, Release Management, etc)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Secondary experiences which are valued:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience with software development using MSFT C# and ASP.Net<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with software development using Java<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Crystal Reports development experience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand.
