<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b><i>Technical Consultant<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><b> - Endur – Energy Trading: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>If you’re an <b><i>experienced &amp; exceptional<\u002Fi><\u002Fb> Java software engineer with Endur and energy trading experience, this role will provide you with an opportunity to shape a greenfield Endur implementation. This innovative implementation will define and adopt best practice in every aspect of the project, providing exceptional learning and growth opportunities for the right individual. You’ll be developing your knowledge in areas such as Kafka integration, Azure Monitor &amp; Insights, logging frameworks, and Open Components to build out (and upon) a set of foundational capabilities which will ultimately underpin all Endur instances in the Shell Energy Trading space.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy is part of Shell’s Trading &amp; Supply division. Our focus is on natural gas, power, LNG and environmental products markets through major hubs in London, Houston, Dubai, Singapore and Brisbane. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>We are at the heart of the energy transition; delivering Shell’s ambition to become a provider of more and cleaner energy solutions for the future in a highly dynamic and challenging environment. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Our people are spread across the globe, bringing energy marketing and trading experience, a wealth of market knowledge and a deep understanding of supply chains that allow us to innovate and develop tailored energy solutions and products, while also helping our customers decarbonise their businesses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy has significant growth ambitions over the coming years. In order to meet our company’s growth and Decarbonisation targets, we are embarking on a major programme of work to modernise our <b>Energy Trading Risk Management System<\u002Fb> (ETRM) platform. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This multi-year programme will initially involve the replacement of old, legacy ETRM systems in Europe and North America. Our intent is to implement new cloud hosted (Azure) <b>Endur <\u002Fb>systems, utilizing the latest in streaming data technologies and system integration and connectivity methodologies. At the same time, we need to support our growing Asian and Australian gas and power businesses and our world leading LNG trading businesses by sustaining and enhancing our current version 19 Endur system.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for <b><i>strong<\u002Fi><\u002Fb> ETRM specialists seeking a significant challenge and an opportunity to grow their careers as part of a team intent on pushing the boundaries of ETRM systems. That team sits at the core of an industry leading organisation at the very heart of the energy transition; helping to ensure a brighter future for everyone.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a <b><i>Technical Consultant-Endur<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>, you will join one of several Agile teams. Each team is responsible for the development and maintenance of one or more ETRM feature areas. Feature areas will be aligned to a specific commodity (Power, Gas or Environmental Products) and\u002For a specific functional area (for example, Front, Middle or Back-Office).<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Joining at the start of this ambitious programme, you would work with your team to develop and adopt foundational config, logging, monitoring and integration approaches whilst delivering feature solutions and value to the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Agile DevOps teams will follow CI\u002FCD practices and be responsible for features from inception, through development to deployment, operations and support. A sense of team ownership and empowerment will be fostered.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your role will vary depending on your expertise and experience, however typically you would perform the following day to day activities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Requirements gathering from end-users or business analysts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Formulate design &amp; development based on functional requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generating innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Endur plugin development in OpenJVS &amp; OpenComponents<\u002Fli>\n   <li> External application development in OpenComponents<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Effort estimation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Unit, Integration &amp; Performance testing of developed solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participation in PoCs (Proof of Concepts)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Technical documentation for developed solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Sprint demos and peer code reviews<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Adherence to, and improvement of CI\u002FCD processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Troubleshooting and remediating production issues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coaching and mentoring junior colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Technology Experience<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b><i> Extensive experience in Endur projects &amp; implementations with end-to-end trade lifecycle process<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have a strong object-oriented development background with understanding and experience of concepts like dependency injection and test-driven-development<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have experience following a structured CI\u002FCD process to ensure standards and processes are uniformly upheld<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Java (ideally version 8+)\n    <ul>\n     <li> Multi-threading<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Junit<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maven<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Logging frameworks<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Apache libraries<\u002Fli>\n     <li> GOF Patterns<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> MS SQL Server \u002F SQL &amp; PL<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Kafka<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitoring solutions – Azure Insights \u002F Grafana etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> ETRM\u002FCTRM experience<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Knowledge of the Endur application with experience developing (Open JVS and Open Components) plugin-based customizations in the following areas:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Deal Entry\n      <ul>\n       <li> Operation Services<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Event \u002F Tran Field Notifications<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li> Back Office\n      <ul>\n       <li> Data generation<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Workflow processing<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li> Valuation (Reval, User Define Simulation Results, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reporting<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and configuration experience of key Endur technical components including:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Grid<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Domain Services (APM, Credit, Log Monitor etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Workflows<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience interfacing the Endur application with external components for the purposes of data transfer both inbound and outbound<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Extensive knowledge of the Endur data model for transactional data, with focus on power and gas markets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Extensive knowledge of the Endur data model for static data<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience developing external OpenComponents applications<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience developing OpenComponents extensions e.g. Result Calculator, Curve Constructor etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> About Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development program. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalization and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Trading and Supply is the world’s largest energy trading business and operates in every major energy market around the world. It supports the Shell group businesses by trading natural gas, electrical power, crude oil, refined products, biofuels, chemical feedstocks, freight, and environmental products. Shell Trading and Supply also manages one of the world's largest fleets of liquefied natural gas carriers and oil tankers and provides maritime expertise and logistics to Shell companies and external customers. Our aim is to create value for Shell’s shareholders, customers, and counterparties across the globe by forging successful partnerships that generate mutually beneficial commercial opportunities.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Market Risk Operations Team is responsible for ensuring that risk processes are operated efficiently and accurately, and that controls in both the risk area and front office are performed correctly. The Market Risk Operations Analyst reports to the Manager of Market Risk Operations. The candidate will need to be comfortable with working independently with limited supervision at times and be able to thrive as part of a global team with members in the US, UK, India, and Singapore.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The goal is to ensure that all data needed for portfolio valuation is complete, timely and accurate, and that systems and controls are in place to ensure compliance with the global Risk Management framework.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will work closely with the other risk teams across the Trading and Supply business including a significant Business Operations component, regular discussions with Market Risk, Valuation, Front Office, Finance and Back Office, and be a focal point for forward curve and pricing related queries from across the Shell group.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key accountabilities and responsibilities of the role are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> The Market Risk Operations group ensures Market Risk processes and controls are run accurately, reliably, and right first time.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The Market Risk Operations group is also responsible for maintaining observable valuation inputs e.g. exchange prices, broker quotes, derivable volatilities and correlations to risk calculations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand physical spot price assessments and the construction of forward curves.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working with Market Risk analysts and traders to come up with the best forward curves possible, and to implement them in the trading systems alongside the Business Operations team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Be an end-to-end deal expert understanding risk at all parts during the life of a deal interacting with the functional experts to help identify and suggest remediation to those risks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Implement Shell best practices in commodity trading risk management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure that Risk fulfils its role as an independent “check and balance” function and is viewed as such by other parts of the organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Regularly review assumptions and estimates in our valuation curves to ensure that they are suitable and up to date.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage user testing of systems functionality and enhancements while providing feedback to key stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must be a systems and data expert ensuring that knowledge around market risk reference data &amp; forward curve construction is well documented for the benefit of the wider Market Risk team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure process excellence, identifying bottlenecks in Risk processes. Implementing error-checking as a natural part of all processes so output is ‘Right First Time’.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support digitalization and automation to smooth the flow of information across the business and to remove manual tasks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Map and document processes, clarify accountabilities, and simplify interfaces to allow the smooth running of the Risk organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Promote a culture of continuous improvement by having the courage to challenge established processes. This includes identifying inefficiencies in local and global operations and opportunities to streamline and automate shared processes and interfaces.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The role works closely with risk analysts in all parts of the risk management department including a significant Business Operations component. The incumbent is tasked with ensuring that the business that they cover is widely understood and that any changes to it or the supporting risk management framework are communicated properly to all stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Significant working experience within a trading, financial or risk management organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Candidate must have knowledge of financial, commodity and energy markets, derivative instruments, and hedging which could have been gained in a Market Risk, Product Control or Trade Control role.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Science, Engineering or IT, or workplace experience in the energy trading industry.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Has Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills, such as pivot tables, lookups, VBA macros. SQL and Python an advantage, other coding languages can also be useful.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with Endur, DEX or comparable energy trading risk management system.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Also, this is a role for a person who brings diversity of thought, who is not afraid to speak up and who is comfortable challenging senior stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Skills Preferred<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> The candidate must have the ability to articulate and communicate complex scenarios and ideas in a clear and concise manner while understanding the perspective and experience of others. Ability to challenge sensitive issues constructively while maintaining working relationships.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team player, good interpersonal skills. Flexible to work with colleagues across numerous time zones with both Market Risk at the Trading Hubs in the Americas, Europe and Asia, but equally the Business Operations center’s in Chennai, Manilla, and Bangalore.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication skills - this role will require writing reports and policies and presenting analysis and insights to senior stakeholders. Due to the global nature of the business the role requires communicating using different methods, in a variety of formats, to people in many countries.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Reliable, dependable, and disciplined. Excellent attention to detail, methodical, organized. A trusted partner of the business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilient when working under pressure, with the ability to prioritize tasks to meet key deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good judgement to provide advice, question discrepancies, escalate issues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Continuous improvement mindset: utilizing tools to streamline and automate work to boost efficiency<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Scientific mindset: identify, investigate, analyze, research, discuss, record, and resolve issues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Learner mindset; innovative and creative, excellent problem-solving capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy is a key part of Shell’s industry leading Trading and Supply organisation and provides more and cleaner energy across a global portfolio of LNG, gas, power and environmental products to meet our suppliers’ and customers’ current and future needs for more and cleaner energy. Shell Energy is positioned to play a significant role at the heart of Shell’s Energy Transition. Shell Energy’s Ambitions are to be the Leading Global Provider of Energy Products and Services; the Leader in Cleaner Energy Solutions; the Most Trusted Energy Partner; and a Winning Team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy Europe and Environmental Products (SE-EE) supplies and trades natural Gas and Power across Europe and Africa centred in London, with representation across the markets we trade. We also manage Shell’s Environmental Products supply and trading business globally based in the key global trading markets. We are growing fast with the expansion of power and cleaner fuels along with products such as carbon credits and environmental offsets as part of Shell’s strategy to thrive through the Energy Transition. Our counterparties and customers encompass major resource holders of gas, upstream producers, investment banks, offset developers, compliance entities, trading houses, utilities and aggregators, power generators and large industrial and commercial energy users. Through our people, we promote innovation and a customer centric approach to business as key enablers for our growth and development.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> Gas Origination Team<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Origination Team covers all European gas markets, working in close partnership with the Trading desks to identify, negotiate, and execute structured gas transactions, physical\u002Fvirtual transport and storage positions, LNG regasification capacities and supply agreements. The Team is also responsible for originating tailored Upstream off-take deals, and help the Trading desk optimize the regional portfolios.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Senior Originator (Business Development Manager) is part of the Gas Origination South &amp; East regional team, and is responsible for originating and leading the execution of new structured positions with counterparties in the Italian gas market, looking at long and short term opportunities to grow Shell Energy’s gas portfolio in Italy. Key focus growth areas for the regional team are portfolio building in Southern Europe (Italy and Spain), Eastern Europe, South-eastern Europe and North Africa. The annual target for the team is &gt;$100m.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is an exciting deal making opportunity and offers work in an, experienced and highly driven commercial team, with strong focus on delivering value for Shell. The Senior Originator will be responsible for representing Shell Energy Europe in the Italian gas market, with the opportunity to also work with the rest of the team on a wide range of transactions, including new market entries, new structured supplies, infrastructure deals, options etc.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The primary accountabilities of the Senior Originator are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop a healthy deal funnel in the Italian gas market and focus on efficient deal execution.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead negotiations with external counterparties and work with highly experienced multicultural project teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborate with other Originators to ensure consistency in the deal funnel, with opportunity for learning across regional focus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure alignment with management and Trading desks on deal funnel focus and help develop a strategic view for the growth of the Italian portfolio.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain and develop close relationships with counterparties in Italy.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with the regulatory team, understanding the framework as translating opportunities\u002Frisks for the business and counterparties.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work effectively with other Originators including across other products like Power, EPTB.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will be based in London and will report to the Team Lead Gas Origination SE within SE-EA.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in gas business development \u002F gas origination \u002F gas contract negotiations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commercial acumen backed by in-depth industry knowledge of the Italian market.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record of commercial deal making from deal identification through to delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in supporting or leading multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural deal teams \u002F project teams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal skills with proven ability to manage a wide range of different relationships at all levels, including government, internal and external senior management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to understand, structure and explain highly complex deal structures \u002F strong understanding of trading value drivers and ability to challenge.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong understanding of deal economics with the ability to commission detailed analysis by Deal Structuring and engage in discussion on quantitative insights.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effectiveness in business case preparation, presentation, and discussion with senior management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of price- and volume risk management techniques (e.g. hedging; options etc).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluency in English and Italian are a must, Spanish and French are a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Diversity and differences are seen as opportunities for enhancing Shell’s performance, therefore showing genuine belief in, and respect for, people is considered key and we welcome applications from all backgrounds – please let us know if you need any assistance for, or during, your application.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Trading and Supply is the principal supply trading and shipping business within the Shell Group. With over 7000 staff in diverse locations across the planet, the business integrates a worldwide supply and trading network with an impressive global portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our organisation originates, trades and operates across the energy complex, with industry leading positions in crude, refined products, gas, power, biofuels and environmental products. Collaborating within a global team of diverse and talented individuals, you will have international scope to maximize on trading opportunities inherent in Shell's asset and market positions around the world.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy - Europe &amp; Environmental Products (SE-EE) markets and trades natural gas and power across Europe and manages the environmental products business, globally. SE-EE's counterparts include major resource holders of gas, upstream producers, investment banks, trading houses, utilities and aggregators, power generators and large industrial and commercial gas and power users.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell continues to invest in positioning its portfolio to thrive through the energy transition, with a purpose to provide more and cleaner energy solutions. For our European gas trading and marketing business, this includes building the capability to provide our customers with solutions including Renewable Gas to reduce the carbon intensity of their operations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is focused on achieving Gross Margin targets through origination activity with third parties, primarily looking at building a Renewable Gas value chain through contracting innovative supply side structures and supporting our sales team to offer products that meet our customers’ needs. This role sits within the European gas trading team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Among others, your accountabilities will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Developing and maintaining strong relationships with Renewable Gas suppliers and consumers across Europe to identify opportunities to build structural supply and demand positions in select markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting Sales teams across Europe to develop and market Renewable Gas sales to a customer base including large industrial and commercial accounts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working with Traders to commercially structure and negotiate terms and transactions and create strategies for the monetisation, optimisation and risk management of the exposures generated from these.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing the full lifecycle of deals, including the due diligence and deal execution process with internal stakeholders and ongoing post-contract requirements with counterparts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Communicating with Regulatory and Operations teams to ensure that deals can be managed, risk mitigated and operationalised within an evolving regulatory landscape.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborating with the wider Shell organisation, including Low Carbon Fuels and Downstream\u002FManufacturing, to identify opportunities to extract value from Shell’s portfolio and capabilities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> You will be working in a rapidly evolving business area, often in challenging regulatory and legal environments. You will be a part of a team of capable and motivated individuals and, as such, will benefit from the ability to work and form relationships with a diverse set of individuals. The position calls for a self-motivated, entrepreneurial and responsible individual with the ability to perform well under pressure.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Required:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A proven track record, with experience, in a European Renewable Gas Origination or Business Development role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Strong and existing relationships with relevant decision makers for both supply and demand counterparts within the Renewable Gas market.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of Renewable Energy Directive II and subsequent implementation plans\u002Fregulation at member state level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of specific Road Transport schemes and products across Europe (e.g. Bioquoten, HBE, RTFC), and carbon schemes (e.g. EUETS).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An ability to clearly and efficiently engage with internal and external counterparts to progress and close simple and complex deals, meet challenging timelines and targets, grow the portfolio and business footprint, drive top-line margin growth and realise strong returns on resource.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An ability to understand and idea-generate strategies to monetise and risk manage trading exposures arising from negotiated terms (both for linear and structured transactions).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication, relationship building and presentation skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A willingness and desire to be agile, adaptive and resourceful in light of a fast-paced, constantly changing environment that rapidly presents new, often highly impactful, opportunities and risks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An objective and inquisitive mindset to take full advantage of the rich development opportunities that this role and market area offers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluency in the English language.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Desirable:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Fluency in additional European languages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience structuring and originating options-based transactions and taking these through an internal approval process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Quantitative skills and an ability to model and stress test transactions off term-sheet information.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Previous origination or trading experience in other commodity\u002Fenergy markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Diversity and differences are seen as opportunities for enhancing Shell’s performance, therefore showing genuine belief in, and respect for, people is considered key and we welcome applications from all backgrounds – please let us know if you need any assistance for, or during, your application.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Nature and Environmental Solutions (NES) team leverages our two main current competitive advantages of our leading trading position (helmed by our Environmental Products Trading Business (EPTB) team) in both compliance and regulatory markets and our experience and credibility developing and investing in nature projects (the Nature Based Solutions (NBS) team) that produce high quality carbon credits.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The NBS team is primarily focused on developing projects which protect or redevelop natural ecosystems, such as forests, grasslands and wetlands. These could be projects related to conservation, afforestation or reforestation thereby generating carbon credits in the future whilst benefitting local communities and protecting biodiversity<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell’s Global CO2 Trading team is headquartered in London with desks in Houston, Dubai, Singapore, Beijing and Tokyo. The Global NBS team is headquartered in Singapore with commercial teams placed stretching from Australia to the Americas. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>EPTB is responsible for the management and optimisation of the CO2 exposures faced by Shell assets around the world, and for generating revenue streams from external business development and proprietary trading activities. In addition, Shell has an environmental products team in North America that focuses on broader renewable energy and emissions markets in the US, Canada and Mexico.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> CO2 markets have experienced rapid growth over recent years, and Shell has remained at the forefront of the market since executing the first ever European Union (EU) CO2 Allowance trade in 2003. With CO2 increasingly being embedded into the global commodity mix, the NES team is well positioned to meet the CO2 trading and commodity requirements of new and existing customers over the coming years<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The successful candidate will be expected to be the primary legal focal assisting the EPTB team in Europe. The candidate will provide support in reviewing and drafting bespoke Master Agreements and Deal Confirmations, ISDAs, consultancy agreements, Emissions Reductions Purchase Agreements, credit documents (Bank Guarantees and LCs), land right agreements, Long Term Emissions Offtake agreements and asset purchase agreements. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The candidate will also be required to assist and advice the EPTB team on acquisitions of companies and\u002For their trading books, enforcement\u002F regulatory\u002F licensing issues involving derivatives trading, credit security structures and land rights issues.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The EPTB desk’s increased focus on complex structured finance deals with significant cross jurisdictional implications mean that the candidate shall be responsible for the drafting and\u002For review of a vast array of complex bespoke contracts, including those relating to financing and security arrangements and contracts that have significant embedded optionality.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Such structured finance deals are anticipated to be conducted in various jurisdictions, often involving challenging and unclear legal and regulatory landscapes and the candidate will be required to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide sound legal and commercial advice on deal structuring in light of a challenging commercial and legal landscape<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Address any regulatory issues that may arise from security arrangements or from the deal in general<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with internal functions to ensure alignment and compliance with Shell’s requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> As an integral member of the deal team, lead the deal and be a check on the deal BOM to ensure that deadlines are met and<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Revise deal documents and lead negotiations with counterparties, and ensure that all internal requirements are reflected in the final deal documents<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The candidate will further be expected to have significant exposure to the use of and management of external counsel for structured financing transactions. The candidate will be expected to liaise closely with external counsel and act as an effective conduit between the commercial desk and external counsel to manage workload, procurement of advice and effectively manage the balance between cost effectiveness and fit for purpose external legal service.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate shall be expected to travel occasionally for this role.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The candidate is also required to provide legal support to the EPTB team in their roll out of various global initiatives involving international conventions\u002Fagreements such as CORSIA (Carbon Offsetting Scheme for Aviation) and working with global retail and commercial fuels to deliver on Shell’s CO2 promises. The candidate will also be expected to provide commercial legal advice and support for the EPTB Team’s day-to-day operations including to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Potentially contentious operational matters such as late delivery or failure situations, Force Majeure and breaches of contract;<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Regularly advise and interface with the Contracts Unit, including on master sale and purchase agreements, preparation and updating of standard contracts, knowledge sharing and training, and with other Shell Trading functions, mainly Finance, Credit, Operations, HR and Tax.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> In addition to the above, the candidate will also be the secondary legal focal for the NBS business in Europe. The candidate will be expected the support the NBS team in:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Reviewing NDAs and MOUs, share sale &amp; purchase agreements, share subscription agreements; joint venture agreements; land lease agreements and commodity offtake agreements amongst others;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting and implementing complex structured financing arrangements akin to the CO2 Trading desk’s.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Special Challenges<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A fast-paced environment, innovative business development teams and the challenges arising as the CO2 Trading and NBS businesses continue to adapt to changing industry and regulatory environments will require that this individual is commercially minded, flexible, willing to challenge and learn, and able to work under pressure.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for a Qualified Senior Lawyer with sound knowledge of contract law and sale of goods principles. Ideally, a knowledge of and interest in the legal issues relevant to trading generally and CO2 Trading and commodity trade finance matters.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are also keen to hear from candidates with the following experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive experience in international common law and\u002For civil law contracts.Able to work without direct supervision.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to draft with appropriate understanding and interpretation of the commercial intentions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent drafting skills. Good verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work on a number of issues in parallel.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to understand and take account of business drivers and needs.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to give clear exposition of a legal issue and to provide succinct accurate and comprehensible legal advice.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to coordinate between internal functions and achieve alignment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and experience to identify critical legal risks in the face of deadlines and deal pressures.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Influencing, negotiation and facilitation skills. Capacity for collaborative teamwork and able to act as a network performer to coordinate with multiple contributors.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of the Shell Group structure and the Shell Control Framework.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> This individual must be motivated, self-directed, able to handle multiple streams of work, prioritise workload and to work both independently and as a member of a team, while at the same time knowing when to seek advice from the line manager or other senior colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Based or willing to work in London and preferably, have a right to work there.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Senior Metocean Engineer, you will be responsible in developing, directing, problem solving, and applying technical, scientific, and mathematical knowledge and methods to design, implement, and achieve specified characteristics and criteria for products, processes, or events in the metocean engineering discipline.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Specific responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Data Analysis<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Project and asset metocean support with a focus on UK, Dutch and Norwegian waters<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Development of metocean design criteria for application to the design and re-assessment of fixed jackets, floating production systems, risers, umbilicals and seabed infrastructure<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Development of metocean criteria for new offshore wind (fixed and floating) developments in NW Europe<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Development of operational criteria for application to operability and fatigue assessments.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Weather windows analysis for offshore activities (such as e.g. installation of offshore wind turbines)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Vessel response studies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Writing of reports related to the items listed above<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Measurements and Real-Time Systems<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Managing the deployment and maintenance of stand-alone offshore metocean measurement equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Management of offshore real-time measurement systems on and nearby Shell assets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Oversight of measured data quality and historical data archive<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Overview of HSSE of offshore activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide help to manage data measurement campaigns for new offshore wind developments (wind profiles, waves and currents)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Role<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Internal consultancy to structural engineers, naval architects, pipeline and subsea engineers, marine and aviation logistics co-ordinators<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Consultancy to a wide range of activities in new energies (offshore wind, hydrogen plants, solar farms, etc..)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interpretation and analysis of measured and hindcast metocean data sets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintenance of databases of real-time measured data from meteorological, wave and oceanographic sensors<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaison with external regulatory and standards bodies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Involvement in and steering of metocean Joint Industry Projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Development of methods and technology to support continuous improvement<\u002Fli>\n   <li> HSSE in the context of offshore and onshore equipment installation and maintenance activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contract holder for weather forecast contract for European waters<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contract holder for real-time measurement systems on offshore and onshore assets<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contract holder for oceanographic consultancies supporting Shell metocean activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contract holder for software development team supporting internal technology developments<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Relevant working experience in the field of metocean or meteorology<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A degree in a numerate discipline such as meteorology, oceanography, naval architecture, offshore or coastal engineering<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Candidate will be expected to have:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Familiarity in the use of Word and Excel<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong capability in the use of Matlab<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of metocean measurement devices and systems<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working knowledge of probability and statistics<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working knowledge of wave and crest height probability distributions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good communication skills, both written and verbal<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Good to have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Significant working experience in the field of metocean or meteorology<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Numerical modelling of waves and currents<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of engineering and\u002For vessel response<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of methods related to derivation of structural reliability \u002F probability of failure of fixed offshore structures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Use of vessel response software such as Orcaflex<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working knowledge of extreme value analysis methods<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working knowledge of covariate extreme value analysis techniques and joint extreme techniques such as methods developed by Heffernan &amp; Tawn<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Head of Compliance Strategy &amp; Delivery, the Compliance Project Delivery Manager is a senior member of the Strategy &amp; Delivery team within Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Compliance. You will be a key enabler in the delivery of LOD2 projects and strategic initiatives to enhance to the overall T&amp;S Compliance Framework, the digitalisation of global T&amp;S Compliance processes, and supporting projects under the Risk Portfolio Board programme of work delivered by the T&amp;S business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Compliance Delivery team is a group of highly driven Compliance professionals focussed on using their broad knowledge of Compliance frameworks, risks and controls to deliver solutions to enhance the T&amp;S Compliance Framework.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Compliance Project Delivery Manager will be responsible for supporting the Head of Compliance Strategy &amp; Delivery in planning and overseeing the delivery of all major LOD2 projects and initiatives to enhance to the overall T&amp;S Compliance Framework. In addition, you will be responsible for using your technical knowledge and experience across a broad spectrum of trading compliance functional domains to deliver your own portfolio of cross-T&amp;S Compliance projects in support of the T&amp;S Compliance strategy. The projects within the portfolio will range from initiatives to continually review and improve Compliance tools, processes, and data to the implementation of new regulatory requirements and the integration of new T&amp;S businesses \u002F acquisitions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Assist the Head of Compliance Strategy &amp; Delivery with the recruitment of team resources.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Serve as the delegate to the Head of Strategy &amp; Delivery as needed.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop an annual T&amp;S Compliance projects plan and budget.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Use your compliance risk expertise to establish a projects pipeline in alignment with overall T&amp;S Compliance strategy and priorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive project prioritisation, fit-for-purpose governance, scope, and requirements for any LOD2 compliance or regulatory projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assist the Head of Compliance Strategy &amp; Delivery in overseeing the delivery and managing the risks associated with the LOD2 project portfolio.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide the Head of Compliance Strategy &amp; Delivery with regular reporting on overall project portfolio status, risks, and issues against plan.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver your own portfolio of projects using a combination of other permanent resources within the Strategy &amp; Delivery team, flexible contractor\u002Fconsultant resources and Subject Matter Experts from within the rest of the Compliance team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate and represent Shell in external working groups in efforts to ensure best practices for Compliance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Act as an escalation focal point for advice and support of more junior Delivery team resources.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Along with your bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or equivalent work experience, we hope to see the following in your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Extensive experience in compliance\u002Fbusiness risk and controls roles in consulting, financial services, trading organisations and regulators.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive technical knowledge and experience across a broad spectrum of trading compliance functional domains and knowledge of global financial regulatory compliance requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A broad knowledge of one or more segments of the T&amp;S Businesses (including Crude, Products, Energy, LNG, Shipping, Operations and Supply) and an understanding of trading instruments, trading strategies, and risk concepts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong project management, change management and continuous improvement expertise, with demonstrated ability to manage several projects at once and comfortable working in fast-paced, changing environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to balance execution efficiency with risk mitigation, value delivery, cost, and quality.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills including the ability to design solutions to problems and translate design into implementation actions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to deliver through others outside of a direct of reporting line and remain focused and productive under pressure and recover quickly from setbacks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven leadership experience with a demonstrated ability to motivate, develop and drive performance and encourage positive team dynamics.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Robust written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence at all levels of an organisation, both internally and externally, and engage with a wide range of stakeholders. Credible and persuasive in ensuring the needs of our complex business are fully understood, resolve conflict, and deliver tough messages.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to collaborate and partner effectively within a global leadership team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><br> Compliance is a foundation of the way in which T&amp;S does business and therefore integrity is one of the fundamental values that we are seeking as part of the Compliance LT. We believe integrity is the hallmark of a person who demonstrates sound moral and ethical principles during their work. Integrity is the foundation on which co-workers build relationships, trust, and effective interpersonal relationships. It is essential that the successful candidate will be able to give clear examples of integrity as one of their core values.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) has an integrated global portfolio of crude oil, refined products, natural gas, LNG, electrical power, chemical feedstocks, and environmental products. It trades on average over 12 million barrels of crude and oil products and 5 million barrels of oil equivalent in natural gas and power each day. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This role involves supporting Shell Energy Trading, which is part of T&amp;S and has a significant existing gas trading business, as well as rapidly growing renewable natural gas, power and environmental products trading businesses that are significant contributors to Shell’s energy transition ambitions. Trading and decarbonization are key strategic areas of the Shell Group, so these businesses are expanding rapidly. This will mean there is an exciting but demanding workload, supporting not only in a legal capacity, but also as a business partner assisting with both commercial and energy transition goals. Current developments have a material impact on the gas markets and the energy system in general, and this role will be in the middle of the expected changes as Europe adapts its energy system.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The lawyers supporting Shell Energy Trading are primarily located in London (head office), the Netherlands, Cologne, Hamburg, Paris, Madrid, Milan and Istanbul. This role is based in the London and will report into the Managing Counsel Shell Energy-Europe &amp; Africa, who is also based in London. Flexible working arrangements can be considered. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This position is responsible for providing legal services to the London based gas, power, and environmental products trading business. The focus is on supporting natural gas and renewable natural gas transactions but given the dynamic and integrated nature of the Trading business it will also support (renewable) power and environmental products transactions as necessary. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>In addition to providing legal advice in relation to specific transactions (and participating in negotiations with third parties), the role includes the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Promoting teamwork between lawyers working in different regions and businesses by encouraging a collaborative approach to cross-business and cross-regional matters.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Protecting the rights and reputation of Shell companies in dealings with governmental and regulatory authorities, local communities, and other stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaising with subject matter experts (anti-trust, trade controls, regulatory advisers etc.) to provide tailored support for specific deals.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assisting with on pre-litigation disputes arising out of or in connection with business activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participating in industry bodies to help influence legal developments in the industry and support legal\u002Fregulatory lobbying initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Transactions are inherently fast-moving and complex, many are first time deals and require strategic thinking as well as technical, commercial and contractual experience and knowledge. We are looking for a lawyer with a strong commercial contracting \u002F transaction background and with some experience in the UK\u002FEuropean commodities \u002F energy trading markets. This role is at a relatively junior level in Trading &amp; Supply Legal and there is significant scope to develop, assisted by support from \u002F collaboration with more senior Trading lawyers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Good negotiation and legal drafting skills; preferably with experience in drafting and negotiating energy marketing and trading agreements (physical\u002Ffinancial), structured finance transactions, and\u002For derivative agreements;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to find creative solutions to legal and commercial issues, but within acceptable legal and risk frameworks; as well as to understand and take account business drivers and needs;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A good grasp of business as well as legal issues, industry developments and legal, social and political trends that may have an impact on the business;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to clearly explain legal risks, develop sound mitigation strategies and find acceptable commercial solutions; having a sound judgement on difficult issues;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Some experience in dealing with complex international law contracts as well as dealing with different legal systems;<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Solid communication skills and fluent in English, both spoken and written.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance.
