<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell provides a wide IT solution that will cater needs of End User Productivity, Digital Platforms, Identity &amp; Access Management and Security, and Connectivity. Be a key player in delivering smooth projects and creating value and driving digitalization adoption across the entire Shell Group.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Geneva is an initiative within Shell Trading which seeks to protect and grow $500m per annum by leveraging our full data flow advantage in Crude and Products. To achieve this, we are rebuilding our approach to fundamental analytics from the ground up to strengthen our trading bias. We harness the data available within Shell, along with all relevant external market data, and make use of cutting-edge technology to deliver human-centred, digital products that give our Analysts and Traders an advantage in the market. As Shell Trading, we have more and better market data than anyone else, but we do not take full advantage of it. Yet.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the Senior Designer, you will be hands-on and need to think more strategically about interaction design to the level of design systems. You will lead and experience the workstream of projects, and research empathetically and thoroughly to build the foundation from which to define and design. Be a holistic thinker, looking at, yet also beyond, the digital screen towards all touchpoints that deliver on product experience. As a Senior Designer, you need to be passionate about your craft and strive to make beautiful, engaging, intuitive, modern, and accessible digital products. A shaper who wants to define user experiences of the future and a champion of design that can show the value of experience and interaction design to one of the world’s biggest companies.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the Role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the Senior Designer, you need to have the ability to be highly independent, confident, and flexible to adapt to a fluid landscape. The capacity to learn and adapt to new ways of working and thinking, communicating effectively through storytelling and visuals yet also in a language that resonates with the business. Also, the aptitude to effectively manage and leverage stakeholders illustrates the value that design can bring to the enterprise. You are also expected to research techniques for workshop facilitation to craft prototypes and experiences.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Other role accountabilities are the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Be actively involved in project work\u002Fcreating a product: owning the experience component.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Carry out appropriate research (direct and ethnographic).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Identify use cases, and write epics, user stories, acceptance criteria, content, and requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Produce working documentation\u002Fdeliverables such as experience guidelines, wireframes, UX flows, screens, and prototype(s). Experience of Figma (or equivalent) expected.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Produce deliverables such as design documentation, Wireframes, flows, screens, and prototype(s). Experience of Figma (or equivalents) expected.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working hand-in-glove with technical\u002Fdevelopment teams.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and run prototype testing sessions; A-B testing of design components and flows, information hierarchy validation e.g., card sorting etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Use (and constantly evolve) the UI design language, components, grid structures, icons, and interactions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the facilitation of workshops to prioritise, ideate and define opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working hand-in-glove with technical\u002Fdevelopment teams.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with the wider organisation and cross-functional project teams to clarify business problems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Now and then produce visual design and communication that is engaging and impactful.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with other designers to execute a balanced approach to project work and product build.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Adapt and continuously iterate feedback on the project approach to the design lead.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What We Need from You<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Graduate with a bachelor’s degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial) or equivalent practical experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> With a minimum of 6 years of related experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledgeable in using Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledgeable of Product Management and Agile ways of working including user stories, backlog management, acceptance criteria, SCRUM\u002FKanban, retrospectives etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must be updated on the latest thinking in the world of design. Have a real passion to bring the latest practices and tools in UX and UI to where and how we work. Your experience and ambition are wider than ‘design’ and extend into lean and human-centred innovation as well as an appreciation of business rigour.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> With appreciation and understanding of the service design practices, consideration of the backstage workings and holistic proposition.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledgeable of digital development and technology such that the experience design can be communicated and translated smoothly.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is a global energy company where we work towards powering progress through more and cleaner energy solutions. We use advanced technologies and take an innovative approach to help build a sustainable energy future. In India Shell has its business footprint in Information Technology, Projects &amp; Technology, Finance Operations, Integrated Gas, Downstream &amp; Upstream spread across more than 7 main locations.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> An innovative place to work<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there. We are striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you in finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As an equal opportunity employer, combining our ideas through a creative, collaborative environment and global operations – we have developed and will continue to nurture a unique workplace with an impressive range of benefits to ensure that joining Shell is an inspired and rewarding career choice for everyone.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Senior Functional Analyst (SME): Expertise in SAP S4 Central Finance application development capabilities for the Finance Business area across Shell enterprise. Responsible for identifying and documenting the business needs of their clients and stakeholders. Will be extensively working on SAP S\u002F4 Central Finance project.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your task as a Senior Functional Analyst would include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Understanding of Business requirements and develop the IT Solution by working along with Process Architects\u002FDesign Authorities<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Undertake Problem Analysis to identify root causes of incidents, escalating findings within the Line and Business, to minimize such incidents re-occurring<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate as a member of project teams, either at the Base Location, or where agreed, at another Business location - specific scope or work activities to be agreed as part of the project set-up<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fully comply with and adhere to, all Group and Upstream IT standards and processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><br> As a Senior Functional Analyst, you should have the following skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Must Have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Extensive experience in SAP FI with proven experience in SAP S4 Central Finance (CFIN)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Should have handled 1 or 2 S4 CFIN implementations and have strong experience in providing SAP FICO solutions for Finance business processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work experience on the areas such as handling complex Change requests \u002F enhancements is a must.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Should have good understanding of Finance Close, Consolidation and Group reporting activities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Should be able to drive larger IT teams for resolution of Critical IT issues during Finance Close. *Skills with only Support experience or majority of support experience will not be Suitable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in delivering complete SAP S4 Central Finance solution, proficient in analysing and translating Business\u002FProcess requirements to technical requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p> Desirable:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Certain degree of knowledge in SAP MM\u002FPM\u002FPS modules will be an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Well versed with SAP system implementation methodology <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Dedication to meet the customer requirements and expectations, taking skills, verbally and in writing.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to handle concurrent tasks with appropriate priority.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in global implementation\u002Fsupport of an SAP solution<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Disclosures and Securities Team is a subset of Shell’s Legal Services Corporate and Ethics &amp; Compliance team and comprises of team members in the UK, The Netherlands, and the US. The team covers a wide variety of work relating to Shell plc’s businesses and legal obligations resulting from its listings on the London, Amsterdam, and New York stock exchanges.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Disclosures and Securities Team works closely with the Deputy Company Secretary and his team of assistant company secretaries and company secretariat assistants and the Executive Committee Secretary which are all headed by the Shell plc Company Secretary.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>In this role you’ll be based in London and will report to the Shell plc Company Secretary who in turn reports to the Netherlands based General Counsel Corporate \u002F Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer. Beyond the Disclosures and Securities team, you’ll be engaging with colleagues and stakeholders in Investor Relations, External Relations, Group Reporting, Treasury and Remuneration, Benefits and HR Services and more to cultivate a real spirit of partnership.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is a great opportunity to act as a UK securities legal counsel within the Disclosures and Securities team in London providing advice regarding the Shell plc Group of companies and working as a credible and strategic business partner on a variety of complex and challenging English company and securities law matters and a full range of corporate, commercial, and corporate governance matters arising within Shell plc and its Group.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In this role you’ll have a broad range of accountabilities including:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Advising on the UK legal requirements in relation to the Shell plc Annual Report and Annual General Meeting.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advising on a range of non-mandatory publications disclosed annually by Shell plc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Providing advice on the market abuse regime, its application to Shell plc and on the company’s securities dealing code.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advising on Shell’s Disclosure Standard.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Advising on various elements of the UK Listing Rules, Prospectus Regulation Rules and Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactively increasing awareness within the organisation of disclosure requirements and the market abuse regime via training engagements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitoring and advising on legislative, regulatory, and corporate governance developments and their potential and actual impact on Shell plc and its Group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting the Group UK Securities Counsel and other team members in meeting any other advisory, reporting or compliance obligations of Shell plc and its Group, as required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In this role you’ll need to demonstrate the following experience, skills, and attributes:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> Experience<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> An English-law qualified solicitor with a proven track record at a leading law firm and ideally some in-house experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Significant experience in securities, corporate, contract and commercial law. However, candidates with a different experience profile who meet the requirements of the role will be considered.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Formidable academic record and excellent knowledge of securities, corporate, contract and commercial law together with a willingness to be involved in other areas of work outside of the immediate role.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of providing advice on a full range of corporate and commercial transactions; the UK Listing Rules, Prospectus Regulation Rules and Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules; and corporate governance matters.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> Skills<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication, negotiating, influencing and legal drafting skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to clearly explain legal risks and to offer sound legal and commercial solutions within acceptable legal and risk frameworks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong interpersonal skills, an ambitious, commercial approach and a commitment to excellence combined with the ability to translate commercial imperatives into practical solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><i> Attributes<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team to provide robust and comprehensive advice to stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Confident and credible with an aptitude for rapidly building and maintaining trust with a strong network of contacts within Legal and with key stakeholders at all levels.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Display initiative, flexibility and personal integrity and a strong sense of accountability.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong personal drive and the ability to maintain resilience when managing a varied workload often under pressure with minimum supervision in a complex, demanding, volatile and changing environment.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a global energy company operating in a challenging world, we set high standards of performance and ethical behaviours. We are judged by how we act and how we live up to our core values of honesty, integrity, and respect for people. Our Business Principles are based on these. They promote trust, openness, teamwork, and professionalism, as well as pride in what we do and how we conduct business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Building on our core values, we aspire to sustain a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels respected and valued, from our employees to our customers and partners. A diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are vital to our success, leading to greater innovation and better energy solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re seeking to close the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>What's the role<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    As the Senior Software Engineering, you will provide technical design and development:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide technical leadership for several software products and support the engineers in those teams. In practice, this means you’re responsible for strong architecture, design, and engineering practices.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver hands-on solutions in energy trading, including design, development, and pipelines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant experience in software delivery.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b> What we need from you<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Strong knowledge of mature (C#\u002F.NET), growth (Python, React) and emerging (Golang) technologies used in both green and brown field development.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Able to understand the existing T&amp;S landscape, include ETRM systems (e.g. Endur) while overseeing a transformation in the technologies we used. Significant experience working on projects with a diverse range of data types – ‘big data’, high velocity streaming data including IOT, low latency event triggers, longitudinal time series data, etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong understanding of data management practices – data engineering and pipeline development, warehousing, storage, lifecycle management, privacy, security etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Hands on experience with data engineering tooling such as Databricks\u002FSpark, Azure Data Factory.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong experience with service-based integrations with microservices experience highly preferable. Quality-built APIs and API lifecycle is important.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant experience with Azure Functions, Web Apps, and distributed\u002F event-driven architecture (event hub, event bus, Kafka etc.), ELK, etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure with CI\u002FCD delivery using Git\u002FGitHub, VSTS\u002FAzure DevOps, Terraform, Ansible, etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A standout candidate would have practical agile experience in both start-up and enterprise environments<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Not required, but a standout candidate would have an understanding of data used in commodity trading<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong knowledge of trading and market drivers for gas, power, and environmental products, including the importance of fundamentals (supply \u002F demand \u002F capacity \u002F inventory \u002F prices \u002F trades \u002F etc.) in market price movements and potential sources of this data.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong knowledge of fundamental modelling and curve trading, including the use of statistical analysis in predictive models for supply\u002Fdemand and price forecasting.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Industrial customer portfolios – forecast generation and analysis, customer constraints, tranche pricing, indexation monitor.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Risk metrics (for example - exposure, PnL, M2M, VaR, Score cards, stress testing, M2M\u002FPnL explained, incremental VaR) – how they are calculated and how they are used by trading businesses.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemicals companies with over 90,000 employees in more than 70 countries and territories. We deliver energy responsibly; operate safely with respect to our neighbours and work to minimize our environmental impact. We are in search of remarkable people who will thrive in a diverse and inclusive work environment to deliver exciting projects locally and globally. People who are passionate about exploring new frontiers. Innovators and pioneers. People with the drive to help shape our future. Because remarkable people achieve remarkable things.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is seeking to accelerate its transformation into a provider of net-zero emissions energy products and services, powered by growth in its customer-facing businesses. This includes expanding its European gas and power trading business in existing and into new markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy Europe &amp; Africa Products provides customers with innovative, reliable, and cleaner energy solutions through a portfolio of gas, power, and environmental products. As part of the Integrated Power strategy for Europe, Shell Energy aims to significantly grow its regional Power trading business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role provides insightful analysis into the financial performance of the Shell Energy Trading Europe &amp; Africa (SE-EA) organization for internal management and external analysts and both historic (actuals) and forward-looking (LE, plan, strategy). Primary customers are VP Shell Energy Trading Europe &amp; Africa, General Managers within Shell Energy Europe &amp; Africa, VP Finance SE-EA, FP&amp;A Director for Shell Energy Trading. Other key stakeholders include the Renewables &amp; Energy Solutions Europe business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a member of the Shell Energy FP&amp;A team, you will engage with counterparts in different businesses with the opportunity to share learnings across businesses as well as Technical &amp; Derivative Accountants – to ensure a holistic understanding of commercial and accounting drivers underpinning the performance and commitments of SE-EA.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> A focus area is to drive momentum on remedial action addressing shortcomings in underlying data, processes, and systems, which represent a major challenge to delivery of the above. This also means working closely with the Digitalisation, Data &amp; Process Integrity Lead as well as colleagues in Energy Risk &amp; Accounting (ERA), Reporting &amp; Analysis (R&amp;A) and the Risk organisation to ensure that solutions that will improve bottom-up the flow of data across all relevant systems are ultimately consistent with being able to provide more insight to decision-makers at all levels.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Preferred location for this role is London but other locations in Europe will be considered. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Successful candidate will be accountable for the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> This role works in collaboration with the FP&amp;A Advisor for Shell Energy Trading Europe &amp; Africa to support the Shell Energy Trading Europe &amp; Africa business.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> As a trusted advisor to the SE-EA leadership team, ensure ultimate delivery of insightful, accurate and timely business performance reporting and enable greater transparency of value drivers that improve decision making.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Key deliverables include the Monthly Financial Results packs and Quarterly Performance Appraisals (QPA). Analysis needs to cover both internal Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) performance metrics (Scorecard on Fair Economic Value basis) as well as external\u002Fpublished financial metrics (e.g. Adjusted earnings, CFFO).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver all forward-looking business performance analysis (Latest Estimates, Annual Operating Plan, and 10-year strategic plan) that enables the SE-EA leadership to make timely decisions regarding priorities, constrained resources and response to external opportunities &amp; threats.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Partner with the Shell Energy FP&amp;A team based in Chennai to deliver setting clear prioritisation of delivery required and coaching the wider team to ensure the highest level of performance and their long-term skills and experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Adopt a Controllers’ mindset throughout the quarterly financial reporting process and remain vigilant to gaps or errors in existing processes and data integrity as\u002Fwhen these arise in close collaboration with the Technical &amp; Derivative Accounting teams, but also other Finance &amp; Risk colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> As required, assist Group Reporting, Investor Relations, Strategy and the external auditors in securing answers to questions related to SE-EA , where necessary working with Finance Advisors or other internal stakeholders and co-ordinating the responses to ensure completeness.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrate and pro-actively champion a continuous improvement mindset throughout the Shell Energy FP&amp;A team (i.e. including R&amp;A as well as Technical &amp; Derivative Accounting). Challenge the status quo to free up time for structural improvements, constantly looking to streamline, simplify and - where feasible - standardize processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver various ad-hoc analysis as required for Group and T&amp;S stakeholders. Recent examples include performance insights for Strategy Day 2021 and deep dive reviews into impact of exceptional external market circumstances.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Interfaces<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Primary customers are the VP SE-EA, VP Finance SE-EA, and Shell Energy Trading FP&amp;A Director. Other key stakeholders include Investor Relations, Group Reporting, Strategy, and external auditors.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Role is heavily supported by extended team in Chennai; leveraging the combined capability of finance organization to act as one integrated team. To be successful in this role, the incumbent will need to work effectively virtually, including strong relationship building across cultures.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Role will collaborate with the extended finance community supporting SE-EA and Renewables and Energy Solutions to support the Integrated Power Europe Performance Unit.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> This role works closely with all aspects of the Trading &amp; Supply and Renewables and Energy Solutions businesses and therefore the incumbent will need to be an effective communicator and collaborator across all levels of the organization and exercise strong influencing skills (without formal authority).<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with the following qualifications and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Preferably with accounting qualification (ACCA, CIMA or equivalent). Energy risk professional will be an added advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experienced finance professional with prior experience in FP&amp;A, business finance partnering roles, accounting\u002Fcontrollership.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prior experience in Trading will be an added advantage.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong leadership qualities and high personal integrity. Ability to effectively challenge and influence whilst remaining commercially\u002Fbottom line focused<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Effective customer\u002Fbusiness focus both internally and externally.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to work under pressure and across cultures in a global team<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The digital transformation strategy of Shell requires an increasingly flexible, agile and secure IT environment to enable best use of data, cloud services, personalization of user experience and connectivity of devices. Keeping our business goals and user experience in the forefront, Shell IT has taken the decision to insource or directly procure a number of connectivity services. By taking greater control over key aspects of connectivity we can provide our users with better user experience, speed and agility, while maintaining operational effectiveness and efficiency. As a result, we are building a partially insourced and multi-vendor ecosystem for our connectivity products and services and will be developing new skills and capabilities. Come join us on this exciting and ambitious journey.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>This role is part of the Connectivity Portfolio with focus on Enterprise Network infrastructure technologies<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Design Assurance Engineer is expected to be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) covering the application of telecommunications technology deployed across the Shell Group. This includes both onshore and offshore facilities and the SME will also provide project design assurance and support for Capital Projects and IT Project \u002F Programme domains.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The purpose of the Design Assurance Engineer is to manage the end-to-end technical delivery of the telecommunications systems required as part of Company Capital Projects. This can include both Construction Telecoms (Temporary telecom used during the project phase) and the Permanent Telecoms facilities which are part of the built facility for use in the OPERATE phase<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The team’s key Accountabilities are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Perform network security and telecom design assurance on projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accountable for security and field telecoms provisioning projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assurance throughout the project in support of target operating environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your Key Responsibilities &amp; Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Review and approve detailed designs for network and telecom system produced by Design Engineer.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver and execute the Discipline Controls and Assurance Framework (DCAF) for Telecoms as a Design Assurance (DAE) throughout the project phases with assurance of supplier plan and solution designs on robustness of solution from a design, operability, and maintainability perspective<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Deliver and execute the project control documentation for networking with assurance of the supplier plan and solution designs from an operability, affordability, and maintainability perspective<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Review and approve detailed designs for network and (field) telecom projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Review and approve Implementation plan for Network Security and (field) telecom projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assure the architecture via network and communication systems drawings<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Integrate Shell Network Security Design standards and best practices into the design and contribute to the development and\u002For revision of standards and practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Specify\u002Fverify Acceptance Test and Acceptance Criteria to ensure project deliverables are in line with business requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Engage with operate teams to ensure handover ownership is defined at early phase of projects and ensure designs are supportable by the operate team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contribute to the annual performance goals and personal development plan cycle<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Network security, we are looking for “design experience with next generation firewalls and proxies and more specifically Palo Alto Networks L7 firewalls and Zscalar”.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Mandatory Skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive experience in leading and executing Enterprise Network Security project delivery, operations, or IT consultancy assignments to design, develop and deliver viable network and telecom solutions, preferably in Oil and Gas or similar industry with offshore experience preferred.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A high degree of technical network knowledge on traditional (IP) networks and systems<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding of OSI Model, TCP\u002FIP protocol suite (IP, ARP, ICMP, TCP, UDP, SMTP, FTP, TFTP)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Layer-2 Switching, VLAN’s and Access-list, SD WAN<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Multi-Protocol Label Switching (MPLS), Voice over IP (VoIP).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Back-up and restore of all critical resources including router IOS<\u002Fli>\n   <li> IP addressing and subnetting and routing concepts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Implemented SNMP on devices to allow for network management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated hands-on experience designing and engineering networking and security systems in previous roles including experience in managing telecom requirements (design and operational) for local site facilities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Extensive Network and Network Security Deployment and Implementation utilizing Routers, Switches, NG Firewalls, VPNs, IDS\u002FIPS Realtime Traffic Inspection\u002FAnalysis tools and Application\u002FService Analysis tools<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Project Delivery methodology for managing Capital Projects in Oil and Gas<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Consistently delivered results in a matrix, global virtualized organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience of managing contracts and working closely with suppliers to ensure the delivery of IT services<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven experience in stakeholder and relationship management including external vendors<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to translate technical requirements and specifications into easily understood business concepts and vice versa<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience on cloud technologies (AWS, Azure and GCP) and SDWAN (Viptela)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience on tunnel infrastructure with IPSec and GRE protocols<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Security Protocols and Services:<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Firewalls, VPNs (L2, L3, MPLS), Authentication (TACACS, AAA, PKI), 802.1x, NAC (Cisco ISE). Also, should have excellent implementation and troubleshooting skills for, L2\u002FL3 VPN, IPSEC and SSL VPN, Cloud Proxy,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Radius, RSA, PKI, 2 factor Authentication, Encryption, Remote access VPN, Clientless VPN and IPSec protocols, Web Proxies, DNS and DHCP design and IPAM tracking, IDS\u002FIPS, Firewall Rules Management, Security Flow, NGFW, ClearPass, End Point Visibility, Authentication, End Point Blocking Policy Enforcement, PKI environments, Endpoint 802.1X, EAP supplicant methods and certificate integration. Firepower, Threat Protection,<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Security Vendors : Checkpoint, Juniper, Palo Alto and Cisco ASA, , Fortinet, Bluecoat, Macfee, Cisco ISE, F5, NetScaler, Zscaler, Symantec Proxy, Bluecoat, F5 LTM, A10<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Wireless – Aruba, Cisco<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitoring and Management Tools: Solarwinds, LiveAction, Riverbed, HP Openview, Cisco ISE, SNMP, Netflow, IPSLA, Netbrain, Lumeta, Algosec etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Preferred Skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Cisco certifications – CCIE Security<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Palo Alto Certifications – PCNSE<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Zscaler Certifications – ZCCP IA\u002FPA<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge on Voice, Load Balancer, Infoblox, Proxy and WAF.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working in an outsourced environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Project Management certification like PMP, PMI, Prince2<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Service Management processes (Support Models, Service Level Management, Contract Management and Supplier Management)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Legal Counsel role is to independently provide regional and global Intellectual Property (IP) agreements support to the Shell Group and commercial legal support to PTX, including the Shell Catalysts &amp; Technologies business (SC&amp;T). This includes drafting and negotiating technology agreements, providing IP and commercial legal advice, support regulatory and compliance matters. The successful candidate will also have expertise to identify legal trade controls, data privacy, litigation, digital risks, and general liabilities and manage these in accordance with Legal processes and\u002For coordinated with other Legal departments.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Legal Counsel will lead other lawyers and colleagues in relation to their IP agreements matters, through use of the Shell Control Framework, Intellectual Property Standards, and implementation of work processes for IP agreements as well as act as the Legal Integrator (lead Legal contact) for IP agreements or projects providing a unique expertise in intellectual property. The position includes independent work, but also leading co-owned projects undertaken by Legal and seizing opportunities for further continuous improvement and simplification.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> These responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Providing IP agreements and commercial legal advice, drafting and negotiating with internal and external parties regionally and globally technology-related agreements, including technology licensing, services, sales, collaborations, and IP assignments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensuring legal considerations and impact of decisions, including mitigation of legal risks are identified.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage and collaborate with Shell lawyers globally across the departments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Creating a positive, proactive culture encouraging high performance and collaboration.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Commitment to and focus on continuous improvement and simplification.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Accountable for protecting Shell’s rights and reputation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong management of stakeholders to co-own priorities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will also act as the subject matter expert for English law IP agreements matters and be able to address specific questions from other colleagues worldwide. The Legal Counsel is expected to play an important role in continuous improvement projects to improve our legal service to the business as well as understanding the digital legal aspects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll have a Law degree and professional legal qualification in the UK. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to be a legal integrator and lead the legal drafting and negotiation of technology agreements and the ability to lead a project to completion.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Significant experience with IP law and IP agreements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Possess and have demonstrated good influencing, negotiating and facilitation skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work both individually and as part of a team, with both internal and external stakeholders with diverse cultural backgrounds.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to engage effectively and influence stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilience to keep a calm and balanced approach and maintain a robust stance in respect of allocation of risk for the Group, while balancing that with the commercial and strategic drivers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to ensure that legal risks are identified, appropriate alternative structures and strategies are considered, and documents are drafted at all times consistent with professional standards, legal obligations, the Shell General Business Principles and the Shell Control Framework.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to perform legal activities that include: (i) advice with respect to proposed commercial strategies; (ii) advising on legal rights and obligations under existing contractual arrangements; (iii) the negotiation and drafting of complex contracts; and (iv) resolution of legal and business problems encountered in the promotion of business interests and the protection of its assets and reputation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy Europe and Environmental Products (SE-EE) is part of Shell Trading and trades in natural gas and power in Europe and environmental products with a global scope.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Deal Structuring team within SE-EE is a commercial function accountable for the valuation and risk assessment of new complex contracts that takes ownership of the valuation and deal management methodology.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The main activity of the Deal Structuring team is close collaboration with Originators and Trading desks to develop deal opportunities that add value and to support growth of the portfolio within the Energy product space in Power &amp; Gas in Europe and for Environmental Products across the globe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Deal Structuring team (currently 17 Deal Structurers) operates from the Shell trading hub in London where the majority of the team members are located with some individual ones located in Hague and Singapore. The main commercial stakeholders for the Deal Structuring team are the Power and Gas Businesses in Europe and the Environmental Product Trading Business (EPTB) that operates globally with desks in London, Singapore, San Diego and Shanghai.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To support the growing activities of the business, the Deal Structuring team needs to expand and we are therefore looking for a senior individual who combines the quantitative and analytical skill set of a Deal Structurer with a commercial mindset and the ability to manage a complex stakeholder environment across multiple locations. The candidate is expected to have the necessary experience and self-dependence to quickly build a strong relationship with the business. All business lines, in particular Power and EPTB, work in fast changing and illiquid markets and continuously need to adapt.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The main responsibility of the role is to collaborate with the business developers and support the growth of the portfolio, while being accountable for the methodology of the valuation and risk assessment of complex transactions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role needs to:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Represent the Deal Structuring team and build strong relationships with the business stakeholders and internal functional departments (Risk, Finance, Credit)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborate with originators and traders to create innovative structured products in response to demand and changing market conditions<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide an independent view on structured transactions, with constructive challenge of the deal owner as required and suggest alternative solutions or improvements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and own valuation methods and models for pricing and risk assessment of complex structured contracts. Identify value drivers and risks inherent in the transactions (e.g. market risk, project risk, credit risk, regulatory risk, financing risk).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> As part of the deal team proactively engage with commercial project leaders to (re-)structure non-standard transactions during negotiation phase, be creative to suggest alternative solutions and adaption of contract structures<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with all relevant internal stakeholders during the approval process<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborate with deal owners to manage and extract value from acquired structured positions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain close, collaborative relationships with the wider origination team and other internal partners in the value chain such as New Energies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain an outward mindset and ongoing commitment of Deal Structuring to the One-team approach<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is a challenging position with excellent development opportunities across T&amp;S and the wider Shell group. We require a creative individual with excellent analytical\u002Fnumerical and interpersonal skills. Working under tight deadlines and conflicting pressures, the candidate will prove able to continue delivering to an excellent standard, with clear focus on the bottom line and priorities in hand. The successful candidate will show the will and the ability to contribute to this objective and to constantly improve personal and team performance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are interested in attracting people to our business who share our core working values of honesty, integrity, and respect for others. We also want those who can build on our business vision, are prepared to accept accountability, and can achieve great results through teamwork and generating creative solutions to problems.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role requires:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Postgraduate or professional qualification in numerical subject (MSc, CFA, ACA or similar).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent analytical \u002F financial skills, business acumen, and demonstrated achievement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in financial modelling or risk management in a trading environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with financial terms and metrics (e.g. collateral and accounting treatment).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Good interpersonal skills, both with team colleagues and stakeholders, with a proven track record as a senior team member.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven ability to work within a complex team, experience in working across multiple locations highly desirable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent communication, relationship building and presentation skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluency in the English language<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beneficial skills \u002F knowledge<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Previous exposure to Energy Markets (e.g. gas, power or environmental product markets)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Programming skills e.g. VBA or Python.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
