<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The 'European Gas Operations' team in Shell Energy Europe is an expanding team set up to help the business grow and expand Gas Trading and Operations. The European Gas business's core focus is on Central\u002FEuropean Gas Market entries, trading, and optimization of Gas within Europe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Based in London, the team supports the forecasting, balancing, nominations, and reconciliation of physical gas. The team is responsible for managing the business demand &amp; help the business to generate commercial value.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our growth ambitions mean that a scaling up of capabilities to manage end-to-end operations generation and trade in the fast-paced, highly automated intraday\u002Fday-ahead markets is required. This scale-up is to support the business alongside enhancing and building on existing solutions for operations, trading, and market data.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Energy Europe is looking for a talented IT delivery lead to join our European Gas Operations Team within the Trading division. The Product Manager role is a key leadership role in the IT delivery team, responsible for setting direction and managing teams to create world-class software solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be the Product Manager responsible for managing the various products for Gas Operation within the 'European Gas Portfolio' IT Team, working closely with the Business Owners throughout the IT solution lifecycle. The role requires frequent communication and engagement with senior stakeholders in Shell Energy Europe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The IT products is defined by the actual capabilities that drive business outcomes to expand the gas portfolio and also support Renewable &amp; Energy solutions. The solutions are a combination of vendor products and bespoke solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In addition, you will be responsible for working with internal IT skill pool leads to secure a team with the right skills and capacity to deliver IT solutions. You will also define and lead the ways of working and the culture of how the team will deliver.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your further responsibility includes:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Partnering with the Business Owner to co-create solution vision, roadmap, scope and prioritize the backlog, customer needs, research, maturity of IT Solution, dependencies etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Own full IT Solution lifecycle including discovery, agile delivery, and operations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Serve as a thought leader to the Business Owner on the art of the possible and establishing (and maintaining) IT Solution roadmap, applying design thinking, Agile delivery, and dev ops where relevant.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Take E2E responsibilities for the IT Solution and acts as an escalation point for operational and delivery issues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain an Information &amp; Data strategy for the IT Solution working closely with the Data Analytics team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Managing the supplier relationships related to the solution and inputs into the roadmap<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Progress opportunities, seeking the right resources needed to deliver the roadmap<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from individuals who have proven Knowledge in Gas Trading &amp; Operations. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Must Have –<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive knowledge of European Gas markets, Market communication and trading exchanges.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working with TSO (Transmission System Operator)\u002FDSO (Distribution System Operator) message communication, Capacity &amp; Imbalance management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong IT management, business partnering, forming relationships, stakeholder management, analysis and problem-solving skills, good communication and leadership skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven track record of managing IT Solution development through the entire lifecycle, with a preference of design thinking, agile delivery, and dev ops experiences<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Good to Have -<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Working understanding of settlements and accounting associated with renewable generation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working understanding of how Risk and P&amp;L are captured and represented for assets including interfacing with the ETRM (Energy Trading Risk Management).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong focus on collaboration, team building, and customer service<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>If you're a Credit Risk Professional with proven experience, we can offer you the opportunity to work at the heart of the Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) Credit Risk organisation in one of the world’s largest corporations.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Based in London, you will be part of Shell’s Global T&amp;S Credit Risk organisation, providing credit risk advisory for complex structured (physical, financial, financing) transactions across gas, power, crude, oil products and carbon. The highly structured nature of the transactions, complexity and inherent risks require additional levels of risk management, monitoring and counterparty review and analysis.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role owner is a member of the Credit Risk Management providing credit oversight for new and existing structured transactions across Europe &amp; Africa. You will be supporting Shell’s ongoing Energy transition initiatives across Shell’s Trading &amp; Supply businesses and interact with other businesses across the organisation.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Our team tackles complex problems in original ways. We are a proactive group who are willing to do more than just respond to issues. We thrive on working smart and embrace new opportunities to drive the business agenda.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Bring us a combination of expertise in credit risk, deal structuring, and evaluation and you’ll help us shape our business direction. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The role owner will review, manage and monitor existing and structured transactions, work closely with Trading &amp; Supply commercial, finance and legal teams to execute new transactions, developing bespoke credit structures to manage and mitigate key risks and satisfy commercial objectives.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will act as a team member responsible for all credit matters with regards to high-profile Energy (gas, power, carbon) transactions in Europe &amp; Africa working within a team to help the day-to-day credit duties.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Energy Senior Credit Analyst will be accountable for the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><b> Credit Assessments -<\u002Fb> Assess and judge the creditworthiness of existing and new counterparties and recommend appropriate credit support and limits. Review and challenge analysis produced by team members and offshore support functions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Due diligence<\u002Fb> – conduct comprehensive counterparty review and analysis to identify key risks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Structured Transactions<\u002Fb> – Structure credit solutions that mitigate risks and potential losses, applying credit solutions using a combination of PCGs, cash collateral, security and other credit mitigating solutions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Ongoing Monitoring and Management<\u002Fb> – reporting on the financial \u002F credit performance of counterparties, including exposures and produce MI reports and escalate as and when required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Work-out Management<\u002Fb> – Where the credit risk has increased to unacceptable levels or covenants have been breached, oversee the termination of the contract, work-out management and the recovery of bad debts\u002Flosses where appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Adherence to Policies<\u002Fb> - Ensure all contracts comply with the Shell T&amp;S Credit Policy and the business is protected as far as possible from credit risk events. Enhance and challenge standards as and when required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Stakeholder engagement<\u002Fb> - Engaging proactively with front office to support the structuring of credit solutions for new and revised transactions, in particular the structuring of appropriate credit and financial arrangements along with the internal approvals and stakeholder engagement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Supporting colleagues<\u002Fb> - Work collaboratively with colleagues to achieve team, group and company objectives. Manage, teach, develop, junior members of staff.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Stakeholder management across the business <\u002Fb>- Reporting to key internal stakeholders including the Head of Structured Commercial Credit (Europe and Africa), the Head of Commercial Credit (Europe and Africa) and in some cases, directly to the CCO \u002F CRO to communicate potential risks and likely outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Internal and External relationships development<\u002Fb> - have a detailed knowledge of the required gas, power, oil physical\u002Ffinancial markets, identifying innovative solutions to meet customer and business needs.<\u002Fli>\n   <li><b> Drive business and process improvement <\u002Fb>– through new ways of working, process improvements or contribute to systems enhancements and projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your experience along with your stakeholder management skills will be critical in the development of appropriate credit strategies in cooperation with Business partner and customer portfolio management and analysis.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> When it comes to building and maintaining strong and effective relationships across Finance and the wider business, it's your inter-personal skills that will make all the difference.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You are a thought leader, outspoken, assertive and team player - someone who can bring out the best in others, build communities and encourage sharing of knowledge and best practice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Relevant Skills and Educational Qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Significant credit experience relating to structured credit, energy and financing\u002Flending transactions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Graduate in related degree (Finance, maths, economics or other numerical degree)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communicator and presenter<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Relevant Knowledge: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>In-depth knowledge of credit analysis.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of credit management and mitigations tools eg. margining, LCs, PCGs, security, insurance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understands the General Trading Terms (GTMA, NBP, EFET, GT&amp;Cs, ISDA\u002FCSA etc)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of the European energy markets.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understands hedging strategies &amp; debt management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cash flow forecasting and ability to sense check modelling.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Debenture, charges and covenant structuring and execution.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good industry knowledge (settlement, regulation, cost stack for domestic and SME businesses)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Relevant Experience: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Demonstrable experience with ratings agency, bank, asset manager or commodity trader.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Comfortable conducting due diligence and driving comprehensive credit assessments.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding of financial statements, ratios, and concepts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong proficiency in excel, with the ability to sense check models eg.to estimate cashflows and credit exposure.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding and use of PFE and credit VaR, stress testing<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to effectively manage competing deadlines for projects in a high-pressure work environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> While being able to converse in a core European language (French, German, Spanish, Italian) is not required, it will certainly be beneficial in your application.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Do you enjoy working with a highly motivated and talented team to deliver mission critical software? Shell Renewables and Energy Solutions is growing and we as Power Digital Core Operations Engineer, you will play a key role we help deploy, manage, troubleshoot, and enhance our complex cloud-based services for a wide variety of customers<\u002Fb><b>where you will be focusing and supporting renewable development efforts for Global Renewables. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be joining a company which aims to meet the world’s growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible. Renewables &amp; Energy Solutions (R&amp;ES) mission is to accelerate the energy transition through shaping a market leading, integrated, customer-centric technology vision, and deliver value driven, cost competitive and secure digital capabilities, to meet Shell ambition of being a net zero emissions business by 2050 or sooner.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Global Renewable solutions (GRS) will be the generation Centre of Excellence for onshore power and offshore wind across all regions for Shell. In addition, GRS will be accountable for scaling Shell’s Energy Access business. The landscape is diverse and involves stakeholders globally with predicted growth in the coming few years. The main components of GRS will be Wind (offshore \u002F onshore), Solar and Energy Access, with a strong focus on customer centricity.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Power Digital Core Operations Engineer, we’ll entrust you to work in collaboration with a wide range of IT Operations teams to build innovative automated IT solutions for ‘Global Renewables Solution’ Portfolio. You will help debug and resolve problems in IT Operations and production environment and prevent them from recurring. Further, you will automate, facilitate and manage virtualized workloads in internal and external clouds. You are also expected to improve infrastructure and processes for higher levels of availability and scalability. You are to monitor and administer service performance in cloud. You will also act as a liaison between our customers and support teams.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be collaborating with Supplier and Shell staff to understand requirements for AWS and Azure Cloud services that support Shell requirements and strategies. You will also be working closely with suppliers, partners, supplier delivery, Information &amp; Risk Management, and others to ensure Reference architecture and roadmaps and plans can account for business requirements and can be applied effectively. You will need to lead the implementation of standards, reference architectures and practices to guide the use of Shell IT services in business IT projects. longside, you’ll be covering:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Setup and maintain operational service performance models focused on Global Customer Solutions Operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Keeping services up and running or getting it back up and running quickly when failure occurs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working closely with internal partners and teams to ensure that we ship software that meets security, compliance, and performance requirements.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Writing, updating, and using documentation, including runbooks\u002Fplaybooks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Automating work including infrastructure needs, testing, failover solutions and failure mitigation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Debugging complex problems across an entire stack and creating solid solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide a strategic view on the Cloud based solutions for existing and future projects.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to work with people that are focused on emerging cloud technologies and associated integration capabilities as the market develops. When it comes to nurturing collaborative stakeholder relations, it’s your excellent people skills that will make the difference. Strong communication skills with fluency in English.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from passionate individuals who are highly driven, ‘can do’, inspiring, able to articulate in a crisp and precise manners understood. A professional with a proven track record of IT Operations and commercial acumen. Someone with strong and proven Interpersonal, Influencing &amp; Stakeholder Management Skills. Beyond that, we’d hope to see the following on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University degree, such as Information Technology, Information Management, Software Engineering, or related field;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knows their way around a Unix\u002FLinux shell, can write shell scripts, and understands Linux internals;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> AWS SySOps Administrator \u002F Developer or Solutions Architect Associate certification;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proficient with following technologies Amazon Web Services &amp; or Microsoft Azure. Azure DevOps, Salesforce CRM;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience debugging complex problems;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience designing, building, and operating large-scale production systems;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knows Python, Java, Go, Rust, or similar;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understands networking and messaging, especially between services;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Has hands-on experience using source control (Git, GitHub, GitLab) and feature branching strategies;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Has experience with a variety of open-source databases (Postgres, Redis etc.);<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> ITIL v4 Foundation or higher certification;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Team player, working with the team, as well as the larger organization;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proficient in preparation of reports and presentations;<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to convey complex analysis in a concise, understandable manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemicals companies with over 90,000 employees in more than 70 countries that aims to meet the world’s growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible. We are in search of remarkable people who will thrive in a diverse and inclusive work environment to deliver exciting projects locally and globally. People who are passionate about exploring new frontiers. Innovators and pioneers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To <i>power<\u002Fi> progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right <i>balance<\u002Fi>. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We as a function are responsible for design, implementation, assurance of Common Service Data Model (CSDM)\u002FConfiguration\u002FAsset management &amp; ITOM modules on ServiceNow. We integrate data from ITSM \u002F ITBM \u002F ITOM \u002F SecOps \u002F GRC and provide easy, simplified, and structured access to the data elements across processes and enable data quality to maintain controls.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Discovery &amp; Service Mapping<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Responsible for design &amp; implementation of the discovery \u002F service mapping product areas across IT landscapes in collaboration with the service owners with objective to enable accurate and complete data inventory.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide advisory and guidance to stakeholders on Discovery &amp; Service Mapping process &amp; tooling enabling efficient and effective end to end execution of all ServiceNow modules.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Co-develop vision &amp; roadmap for the asset management strategy through collaboration &amp; alignment with the functional product teams and stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Data Management<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Enable the data story for Information &amp; Digital Services and Operations (IDSO) to strengthen the foundational data management leveraging CMDB &amp; CSDM and also supporting the data needs of the larger ecosystem.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as the delegate for the Information and Data Definition Owner (I&amp;DDO), defining data quality rules and ensuring Data Compliance and accuracy through Information &amp; Data Value Owners (I&amp;DVO).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the development of strong business cases for process improvements based on data, which can be implemented agile or by process release.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Cross Collaboration across Platform<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Enable end to end integration through a thorough understanding and assessment of the (inter) dependencies of the process, data &amp; tools within the IT4IT functions across ITSM, ITBM, SecOps and GRC.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Enable org wide data initiatives through Continuous Improvement using CI techniques to ensure Top Quartile (TQ) performance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Implement market standards, identified internal and external best practices into ways of working.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with the below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Must Haves:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Senior professional, with strong Infrastructure and ServiceNow experience in the Discovery, Asset, Configuration &amp; CSDM processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with IT Operations management processes across value streams (discovery\u002Fservice mapping \u002Fmonitoring\u002Fself-healing)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of OpenGroup IT4IT model, Scrum Product Owner, Agile ways of working, Lean &amp; Continuous improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> ITIL V3 Expert or ITIL 4 Managing Professional.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of Technology such as (cloud) Infrastructure<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Desirable:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Understanding of Technology such as Cyber-defence, GRC (compliance framework) and Application portfolio management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written using different mediums<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skilled in being able to build credible, sustainable relationships with staff, business leaders and suppliers <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Skilled in being able to influence others without formal authority to deliver desired results <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Projects Business Analysis is responsible for identifying and documenting the business needs of their clients and stakeholders and helping to determine feasible solutions to meet business needs or resolve business problems. This position will give you the opportunity to grow to become an active thought partner and solution visionary who shapes the technology demand and direction in the business community.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position has the following accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Precisely capture business problems, value drivers, and functional\u002Fnon-functional requirements, including health, safety, security, usability, data, and supportability considerations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assess and model processes, data flows, and technology to understand the current value and issues, and identify opportunities for improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Create clear documentation to communicate requirements and related information; keep updated to align with the solution over the project lifecycle.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure traceability of requirements from business needs and requirements, through testing and scope changes, to final solution.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interact with software suppliers, designers, and developers to understand software limitations, deliver elements of system and database design, and ensure that business requirements and use cases are handled.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Configure and document software and processes, using agreed standards and tools.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Create acceptance criteria and validate those solutions meet business needs through defining and coordinating testing.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Create and present compelling business cases to justify solution value and establish approval, funding, and prioritization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Initiate, plan, execute, monitor, and control Business Analysis activities on projects within agreed parameters of cost, time and quality.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand and stay abreast of relevant architectures and technologies related to a business area. Research potential solutions and innovative ideas. Guide and manage interactions with technology vendors.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead stakeholder management activities including facilitation of large design sessions.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Special Challenges:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Respond to organizational and environmental changes during in-progress activities.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Guide business stakeholders to gain acceptance \u002F sign-off despite competing objectives. Manage requirements to the smallest set that will provide the biggest impact in advancing business objectives and end-user buy-in.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Describe technology in terms easily understood by business customers and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work closely with stakeholders to build trust and understand their goals, motivations, constraints, risks, and operating environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Significant experience in IT BA role.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Expertise in Core and Advance Business Analysis Skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Agile project experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working in Agile projects and educating stakeholders including Product Owners and Business partners in Agile ways of working<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding of systems engineering concepts and data\u002Fprocess analysis and modelling.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Data reporting, analysis, and visualization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to take a systematic and analytical approach to problem solving and pay close attention to detail.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience analysing the alignment between business requirements and system capabilities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal and influencing skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong Stakeholder engagement skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good leadership, presentation, and communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) or PMI-PBA certification preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Must have Domain Experience<br> This role is for a Business Analyst in Shell Global functions Information Risk Management (IRM) IT team. You will be working in one of the below portfolios, so IRM domain exposure is key.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Governance, Risk, Controls and Assurance (GRCA)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Cyber Risk Operations (CRO)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy Europe Ltd (SEEL) provides business customers with innovative, reliable and cleaner energy solutions, helping them meet their energy needs and navigate through the energy transition. Shell Energy Europe is committed to meeting its sustainability and carbon reduction targets by contracting long term green energy production, thus assisting with Shell’s transition and rebalancing of its asset portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Shell is growing its power presence in the European power markets, managing a portfolio of generation assets and supplying power to end customers.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> With a focus on low carbon energy sources, SEEL has engaged in long term contracts with renewable projects across Europe, bringing their output to the market and providing green electricity to a growing number of industries.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> What's the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Power Team is responsible for the trading and origination of power across Europe and trading team is responsible for proprietary and structured trading; risk management across Shell’s various business channels and the management of the different assets in Shell’s portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The Continental Power Trader will help to provide the trading and origination expertise behind Shell’s growing power platform – contributing to Shell Energy Europe’s Euro ~350mln\u002Fyear activities. The role is part of a 12 people power trading team, responsible for trading across Continental Europe, Southern Europe and the UK as well as the power origination team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The successful applicant will be part of the Continental power trading team (consisting of five traders, covering activities in North-West Europe, CEE and Scandinavia) and power origination team. The focus of this role will be to grow our flex and renewable positions across all markets. The role involves successful cooperation with the marketing, sales, business development and deal structuring teams, as the power portfolio grows.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The successful applicant will have relevant trading experience, with an excellent understanding of the market fundamentals and trading dynamics. This includes detailed knowledge of the structured products as well as the renewables value chain. A background in management of thermal or renewable assets will give the applicant the necessary experience to identify and evaluate new opportunities, as well as profitably manage SEEL’s existing portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> This position will be based in London, UK.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Analysing fundamental and technical market conditions and devise and implement profitable trading strategies around these.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Executing power trades within mandated authorities.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Managing trading exposure with particular attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Understanding and communicating risks being taken<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Interfacing with customers, both internally and externally.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Enriching the funnel of structured products (VPP, physical toll, cross commodity), working closely with deal structuring<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Originating innovative deals around flexible assets in coordination with the origination team<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Grow the renewable certificate business and optimize it with the European portfolio<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Create a funnel of renewable offtake opportunities<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Sharing information\u002Fintelligence across the trading network, selflessly and efficiently in real-time<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Cultivating a reputation as a valued team player.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Leading by example with error free work<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Observing and strictly complying with all regulatory guidelines<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Coaching &amp; educating colleagues, including those on other teams<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Making time for innovation and discussion of growth opportunities, apportioning time appropriately between real time trading and business development<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Demonstrating safe behavior in the workplace<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are targeting experienced trading professionals. You are likely to be a strong contender if you have hands on experience in the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li><br> Relevant power trading experience, with focus on the NEW, CEE or Scandinavian markets.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Asset management experience in a trading environment is a plus<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Knowledge of the European Power market fundamentals<\u002Fli>\n    <li>In-depth knowledge of market fundamentals in CEE or the Nordpool area would be a plus<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Knowledge of the regulatory environment in the wider European markets<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Market Analysis\u002FPlanning<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Commodity Price Risk Management<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Derivatives Trading\u002Fmarketing - especially if it means customer contact or selling \"creative\" pricing propositions<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proven track record in Trading<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b><br> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then we have grown into a leading innovative energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Fleet Solutions is one of the global leaders in business mobility, operating in 57 markets globally directly and with license partners and agents with approximate 250K direct customers. Shell Fleet Solutions aspiration is to become the Amazon of Business mobility and provide customers integrated Shell and partner offerings<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>IT Portfolio Manager role is to support business ambition of inorganic growth across Fleets and CRT (Commercial Road Transport) portfolios. Person would be involved in developing IT framework for inorganic growth support, providing support and consultancy to inorganic activities across FS &amp; CRT for deals supported by CoB IT team; getting involved to support the implementation of acquisitions, mergers, and other type strategic partnerships from IT perspective. It would also involve supporting post-implementation assurance of inorganic growth activities, including constant revision of framework to apply the latest learnings.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Delivery focused with a customer mindset and vast experience in managing multiple, cross-functional teams.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A commercial mindset enabled by understanding of business, consumer, and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to shape and translate a technology enabled vision into delivery of successful business outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent communication skills coupled with the ability to engage and influence up to senior executive level in a complex organization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to build strong collaborative partnerships with senior business stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resilience, courage, and the willingness to challenge and manage expectations.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in developing business cases and in managing IT budgets through the IT demand management and planning process.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong leader and team player. Able to motivate, collaborate, proactively communicate and share understanding and experience within a team.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with the following skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Background in Mergers &amp; Acquisition processes is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience or background in program management preferred (indirect accountability).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Previous experience of pre deal assessment or post deal company integration is desired.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in developing business cases.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in working with functional support partners like legal, finance, contracting would be beneficial.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Results-oriented, ability to manage time and schedules to meet aggressive deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to deliver through others.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Has a greater risk appetite to be able to drive new and innovative proposition, be able to identify those risks and ensure that the business understands, accepts and signs up to those risks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Can learn quickly and is adaptable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Innate curiosity about consumer problems and ways of resolving them for commercial reward through technological innovation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Balanced commercial, business, and technical skill<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong empathetic characteristics, with collaborative style, and has the ability to build strong and trusted relationships and networks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to inspire others to action and drive quality and pace in equal measure to enable successful outcomes<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Systematic Trading Team within SE-EA seeks to leverage improvements in technology, programming frameworks and state of the art quantitative analysis to develop profitable algorithmic trading strategies in energy futures markets. The key focus for the Algorithmic Trading Developer will be to support the desk in the development and implementation of novel algorithmic trading strategies within the algorithmic trading platform using best in class technology and development practices.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Algorithmic Trading Developer will work in close co-operation with the Algorithmic Traders on the desk and the algo platform project team to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Develop platform improvements and extensions as required to further algo trading activity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Co-operate with algo traders on implementing novel algorithmic strategies for execution and revenue generation as well as support the continuous optimisation of the existing strategies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive initiatives to improve and extend collection of relevant exchange market data including exchange feed handler implementations and data base designs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Essential:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Expert programming skills in C# (or Java\u002FC++)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent software engineering practices<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experienced in algorithm design\u002Fimplementation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Hands-on data base design (SQL, KDB) expertise<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Desirable:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Demonstrable experience in contributing to event-based trading systems’ implementations and a good understanding of related considerations (concurrency, market connectivity, low latency programming, …) highly desirable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> (Energy) Futures markets knowledge incl. relevant trading applications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Skills in Statistics\u002FMachine Learning with applications to time series<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Python programming<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Personal Attributes<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> High degree of pragmatism and the desire to deliver business value whilst maintaining high standards of work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Resilience under pressure and a proactive attitude to overcome hurdles<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Team player with the ability to collaborate across different teams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Uses best practice development techniques but open to change of approach according to conflicting timelines\u002Frisks involved<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Used to working in a flexible, independent manner on a mixture of small unstructured and large structured items<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell Trading integrates a worldwide trading network with an unsurpassed global portfolio renewables, gas, environmental products and crude and products. Shell Trading has hubs in London, Houston, Calgary, Singapore, Dubai, Rotterdam, and Barbados. Shell Trading is one of the world’s largest energy traders and is a key segment of the Royal Dutch\u002FShell portfolio.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy Europe and Africa (SE-EA) sells and actively trades energy related products and services associated with European natural gas, power, and environmental products. SE-EA was created in 2009 through the combination of Shell’s marketing and trading companies in Europe. SE-EA is part of Shell Energy which is the commercial heart of the Integrated Gas Business and aligns all Energy Trading activity throughout the world.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The European power business is a highly dynamic and challenging environment, which requires SE-EA to continuously find new products and solutions to serve and grow its portfolio. This role will be part of European Power commercial business team located in London. This role would work closely with the Power Trading, Structuring, and BD Team, to onboard and optimise the value of physical and financial structured products.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The primary accountabilities of the Power Portfolio Analyst are:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Lead analysis on asset data, positions and P&amp;L to resolve problems and identify opportunities for additional value creation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support in managing new deal pipeline and onboarding of new physical and financial deals<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support in defining and implementing new product structures, ensuring new products work effectively across deal lifecycle<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Use coding to drive automation of activities across portfolio management and trading<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support in streamlining and enhancing the product array and functionality of the Power desk, incorporate controls, particularly for new deals\u002Fprojects done by the team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support in-flight projects to standardise processes and platforms across EMEA trading &amp; BD<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting in contributing to enable high quality, shared understanding of market opportunities, trends, and value potential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support on new and innovative solutions for the desk, as well as how to translate these into industrialised and repeatable processes for IT to standardise and further automate<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bring rigour\u002Fgovernance to the delivery structure and where feasible drive towards full automation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to a Senior Power Portfolio Analyst this position will be responsible for improving practice and modelling to enhance commercial activities within the SE-EA Power portfolio. This role will focus on optimising end-to-end trade capabilities, providing innovative solutions which can then be focused on structural solutions. Grow the power business in the mentioned markets and make them a significant contributor to SE-EA P&amp;L<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role will form part of the Power trading and business development network, acting as a focal point for commercial modelling between these teams. The incumbent will understand the end-to-end process flow of a trade lifecycle, and, through knowledge of the power markets\u002Fbusiness be part of a team to cater to structured, retail, and imbalance products across the Power spectrum.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate would be required to have:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Experience in analysing big, complex data sets and using this to drive additional business value<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in commercial \u002Foperational roles, specifically in the Power market, with a strong track record of performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An ability and willingness to quickly understand and act upon commercial opportunities, often under significant time pressure<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A proactive approach and mind set to propose and drive improvement and changes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A sound understanding of credit, market and financial risk.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience and appreciation of purposeful collaboration<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Prioritisation skills, distinguishing between urgent, important and essential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A “can do” attitude is a must<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A perspective across the entire business and functional areas, as well as numerous stakeholder interfaces, this role is well placed to leverage a central position within the organisation to make connections and drive effective change<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project and\u002For Programme management ensure stakeholders at the working level are sufficiently informed such that greater delivery is realised<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coding language skills an advantage: VBA, SQL &amp; Python<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand.
