<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be part of our Global energy-based trading support IT team in Shell Energy<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> You will be motivated to leverage your experience of energy trading business IT support to make a positive impact on the future of our planet<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will be part of an innovative team of IT supporting application support and Infrastructure, who continuously face the challenges of tomorrow and today.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will be committed to being the best version of yourself and helping others to learn and generate new ideas that make life better for you, your colleagues, and our business<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy: The Shell Energy Operations team is a dynamic, fast - moving team based across the world. The team is responsible for ensuring that our traders can trade global markets 24\u002F7 without disruption or loss of earnings. We work hand in hand with a network or partners and suppliers to ensure that trading systems and connected environments are operate optimally. We work with a rapid understanding of user needs and technology changes with clear accountability for service delivery<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Sr. IT Operations Engineer is a key role responsible for supporting delivery of day-to-day application and infrastructure services, according to agreed Service Levels and\u002For Operate Level Agreements ensuring business continuity. The role also requires review of application functionality\u002Flandscape for continuous improvement and frequent engagement with business, supplier, natural teams and product teams in Shell Energy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position provides an opportunity to work on a wide spectrum of applications developed in new technologies such as Azure data functions and market standard products that bring competitive advantage to trading<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Your key accountabilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Pivotal role as the primary and escalation focal for Shell energy trading applications.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for maintaining the seamless operational delivery of applications and their related back-end technology<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaise with multiple stakeholders including Business Manager and Applications Managed Service providers to remove blockers, drive solutions and meet business need<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support transition of applications\u002Fproducts and enhancements to delivery support.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive incident \u002F problem resolution with internal and external partners<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Steer and embed compliance and audit activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Track operational cost and assist in budgeting <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maintain and advance operational run books, guidelines, and procedures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Represent the team at project\u002F planning meetings, knowledge sharing forums and in service delivery engagements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coordinate disaster recovery plans and test execution for critical applications, including application maintenance, infrastructure landscape documentation and document failover<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Essential requirements <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Significant experience in application support (ITIL - Service Management)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Graduate or Post Graduate degree in Information Technology or similar certification.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong IT service management, business partnering, stakeholder management, analysis and problem-solving skills, good communication skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experienced in IT support &amp; understanding of trading lifecycle of the Trading process - from trade capture, through scheduling the commodity for delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to application development and technologies mainly in Azure data functions \u002F Reporting.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge in any trading business domain: Energy\u002FGas\u002FPower\u002FCommodities\u002FFinancial<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Technical Skills <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Technical skills in .NET, Azure Data Factory, data bricks and CI\u002FCD.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Familiarity with any reporting tools such as BI etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of Kubernetes or another similar toolset<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Desirable Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Knowledge in trading business domain - ETRM (Energy Trading Risk Management)\u002FCTRM (Commodity Trading Risk Management)\u002FAligne\u002FEndur<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Bring us your experience in European Gas Markets and the regulatory framework for certificates for clean energy sources in Europe and we will give you the opportunity to join Shell Energy Europe (SEE), a fast-paced organisation focused on achieving Shell’s strategy to thrive in the Energy Transition. This is a perfect opportunity for those that thrive in a fast-paced environment and wish to develop within an inclusive multinational company.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Joining the Regulatory Affairs Team for SEE, you will join a team that scans the political, legislative, and regulatory landscape for trends and issues that can give rise to substantive value creation or destruction. Working closely with fellow commercial colleagues the team build a case to either pursue the opportunities or mitigate the threats.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your role will focus on the market for voluntary and regulated certificates for clean energy sources in Europe with emphasis on opportunities from gas and power certificates and renewable and decarbonised gas trading in North European markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Regulatory Affairs Manager Clean Energy Solutions based in London, you will coordinate actions across departments to establish efficient and effective processes to ensure that business is conducted with compliance in the areas of renewable and decarbonised gases and certificates demonstrating that energy is sources from a renewable or decarbonised energy source (e.g. licensing requirements, compliance markets requirements).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be accountable for the researching and synthesising regulations to draw out key learnings to support country specific business strategies and commercial opportunities to driving efforts to identify and advise originators and traders on commercial opportunities for existing and new regulations. Further, you will be responsible for influencing the further development of the policy and regulatory framework of these activities through active participation into EU and national regulatory proceedings to protect\u002Fadvance SEE’s interests.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role will require you to have a diverging set of skills where at times you will work on formal regulatory documents with a large amount of complex material to advise on commercial opportunities or draw compliance requirements. Additionally, you’ll need to have the ability to distil information, grasp the commercial concept, build a compelling argument, and execute effective advocacy and lobbying. This will entail communicating messages with confidence and credibility to a wide array of internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Other accountabilities of the role include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Serving as control focal point to ensure compliance (e.g. ability to advise traders and originators on whether proposed transactions fall within the regulatory framework) and suggest possible mitigations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish &amp; maintaining relationships with key internal stakeholders, including Trading &amp; Supply Products team, Products Compliance team, New Energies, Government Relations and Legal.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establishing strong working relationship with national authorities and agencies responsible for the policy and regulatory framework of gas and power certificates and renewable and decarbonised gas trading in North European markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for individuals who have experience of the changing regulatory, commercial, customer and competitor playing field in the gas industry in Northern Europe. Knowledge of the regulatory framework for renewables and related certificates (i.e. Guarantees of Origin, transport sustainability certificates) would be an advantage.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position requires high commercial acumen and creativity allowing you to respond adequately (and in many cases under time pressure and in public fora) to challenges in negotiations with highly experienced and commercially astute regulatory professionals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Further, due to the external and European nature of this role there may be significant travel involved and working non-standard hours.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beyond that, we’re keen to see as many of the following attributes on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in written and spoken English essential with proficiency in either the German or Dutch language a strong advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> University educated, ideally with a post-graduate qualification having a strong analytical component with evidence of strong academic performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project management\u002Fcoordination skills.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong influencing skills; ability to inform &amp; influence multiple stakeholders (internal &amp; external).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive and proven experience reviewing\u002Finterpreting regulations. Ability to synthesize relevant information from review of lengthy\u002Fcomplex regulations and draw commercial implications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated ability to formulate opinions and advise on commercial impact to existing and\u002For regulatory feasibility of new commercial activities given evolving legislative landscape.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Self-starter, able to initiate new opportunities from a broadly defined set of objectives, meet\u002Fexceed performance targets and motivate others to do likewise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Reporting to the Finance Manager Treasury, the Senior Finance Advisor Treasury is a key role in the UK Controllers team providing financial expertise and core capabilities in the financial management of Shell's critical Treasury companies. The role has a wide number of interfaces into the Holding and Treasury organisation including Tax, Legal, Treasury and Finance Operations. The role provides experience in a set of core finance competences, including accounting and reporting, Governance Risk &amp; Assurance (GRA) and stakeholder management, which are critical to building a finance career.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As Senior Finance Advisor Treasury, you’ll be sitting within the Corporate Controllers’ team in London, as part of our Centre of Expertise (CoE) for technical accounting, risk management and Group structuring. You will also be providing controllership of the Group’s critical holding and treasury companies; these are material companies which are integral to the Group’s performance and several of the holding companies would be in the FTSE and our largest treasury centre is equivalent to a medium size bank. So robust controllership and risk management is a vital part of our roles.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The team is around 15 people based in London with a larger natural working team in our finance operations centre in Chennai where the day-to-day finance processes are run. With your focus on financial management, you can expect to be working closely with Treasury, as well as with colleagues in Finance Operations, Tax and Legal.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’ll be looking to you to provide expert advice and guidance on technical treasury accounting, across multiple Shell financing activities and businesses. As our ‘voice’ of Finance, you’ll quickly understand and guide on the best solutions that will achieve business objectives, add value and drive effective risk management. With an ever-changing business environment, your insight and experience will be essential to prioritise activities according to opportunity and risk.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specific duties might include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Providing expert accounting advice to project teams to ensure that transactions are appropriately reported and understood<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsibility for a number of key treasury areas of subject matter expertise<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maximising the use of Finance Operations in process delivery and supporting knowledge transfer and competency build as more Legal Entity Controller (LEC) work is transitioned<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensuring an appropriate control framework is in place for risk management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Appropriately involving other teams to support financial activities, whilst building overall accountability.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Providing expert Finance Advisor support across a wide range of connected areas such as risk management and group structuring.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Senior Finance Advisor you will also provide support and oversight to the Finance Advisors in the team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You’ll be an expert on technical accounting, supporting direction on a range of technical issues, and helping to implement new financial structures and reporting standards. Your excellent communication skills will be vital to the role, ensuring you effectively articulate value and risks to influence decision making and drive performance whilst also playing an important part in training and giving context to a wide range of stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Alongside experience as a qualified Chartered Accountant (or equivalent), we also expect that the candidate will either have, or be prepared to study towards, a recognised Treasury qualification, (preferably AMCT or equivalent).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beyond financial management expertise and knowledge of business functions and objectives, we’re also keen to hear from candidates with many of the following on their CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Expertise across the spectrum of Finance competences.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in risk management and corporate structuring would be an advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A proven record of continuous improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> An ability to use analytics and insights to resolve problems, with a view to influencing and supporting the decision-making process and risk management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skills within project management.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Candidates will build the following finance competencies through this role:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Accounting &amp; Reporting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Business Performance Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Corporate Treasury<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Finance process Excellence<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Financial Controls<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Governance &amp; Assurance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Risk Management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Tax<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Value Management<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role involves supporting Shell Energy Europe (“SE-EE”), a part of Shell Trading &amp; Supply (“T&amp;S”), which has rapidly growing renewable power, gas and environmental products trading businesses that are significant contributors to Shell’s energy transition ambitions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Trading and decarbonisation are key strategic priorities of the Shell Group, which has created the need to build its functional and business capabilities, including this senior legal counsel role. This is an exciting role supporting not only in a legal capacity but also as a business partner. It is an excellent opportunity to play a major part in the realisation of Shell’s energy transition goals and make a real difference.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The lawyers supporting SE-EE are located in London (head office), the Netherlands, Cologne, Hamburg, Paris, Madrid, Milan and Istanbul. You will be a senior lawyer within SE-EE’s power trading legal team working closely with, and reporting into, the Managing Counsel for Power to support T&amp;S in the delivery of its targets. This role is based in London.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SE-EE is building a European power business, as part of Shell’s integrated power strategy and has industry leading energy transition ambitions. As part of this target, SE-EE plans on expanding rapidly with a strong appetite for executing an increasing number of structured deals. Several of these opportunities are first time deals for SE-EE and require strategic thinking as well as technical, commercial and contractual experience and knowledge.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In addition to providing legal advice and business partnering, this role includes the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> promoting teamwork between lawyers working in different regions and businesses by encouraging a collaborative approach to cross-business and cross-regional matters<\u002Fli>\n   <li> protecting the rights and reputation of Shell companies in dealings with governmental and regulatory authorities, local communities and other stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> liaising with subject matter experts (anti-trust, trade controls, regulatory advisers) to provide tailored support for specific deals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> assisting with pre-litigation disputes arising out of or in connection with business activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> participating in industry bodies to help influence legal developments in the industry and support legal\u002Fregulatory lobbying initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What are we looking for?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking for an experienced lawyer with expertise in the legal aspects of the UK\u002FEuropean power markets who can provide support on power related trading activities. You will have detailed and demonstrable knowledge of a wide range of power origination and trading documentation such as negotiating and drafting PPAs, route-to-market arrangements, optimisation, battery storage and ancillary services arrangements, energy management services agreements, structured physical or financial commodity products and innovative producer or aggregator service arrangements.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We would like to hear from you if you have the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Demonstrated and recent power industry expertise in the UK\u002FEuropean power markets. Experience of working within a power trading role and\u002For for renewable developers, battery owners\u002Fdevelopers or similar are an advantage<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent negotiating and legal drafting skills; preferably with experience in drafting and negotiating energy marketing and trading agreements, PPAs, structured transactions and derivative agreements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> International transactional experience and excellent grasp of legal as well as business issues, industry development and legal, social and political trends that may have an impact on the business<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to find creative solutions to legal and commercial issues, but within acceptable legal and risk frameworks; as well as an ability to understand and take account of business drivers and needs<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to deliver effective legal advice, identify and clearly explain legal risks and develop sound mitigation strategies; having a sound judgement in sensitive areas and difficult issues as well as managing stakeholder relationships<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supporting new business initiatives in the form of new products and entry into new jurisdictions, including the expansion of T&amp;S’ offtake capabilities in Europe<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Motivated with a direct, action-oriented approach to achieving legal and business objectives and an ability to build credible relationships with a variety of stakeholders across the legal function, T&amp;S and Shell generally<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Solid communication skills and a willingness and ability to coach and develop more junior\u002Fless experienced colleagues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Highly strategic legal outlook and commercially savvy<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to build, maintain and instruct a network of in-house and external counsel<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The ability to ensure that legal and compliance issues are taking into consideration and fully complied with<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluent in English, both spoken and written<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is an international energy company that aims to meet the world’s growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible. It is one of the world’s largest independent energy companies, operating in more than 70 countries.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell has a global target to become a net zero emissions energy business by 2050. This means that Shell aims to be net zero on all emissions generated by its operations and the energy needed to power them. The company is working with customers, business, and governments to address emissions across different sectors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In March 2022, Shell UK announced an ambition to invest between £20 to £25 billion in the UK energy system over the next decade, more than 75% of which is intended for low and zero-carbon products and services including offshore wind, hydrogen and electric mobility. These investments, which are subject to board approval, aim to propel the UK closer to net zero whilst intending to stimulate economic growth and jobs.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be part of a community of experts in different capabilities in Information Digital Engineering driving ideas to reality embedding AI in every part of our organisation from making our existing businesses more effective and efficient and make us competitive as we accelerate the development of the next generation of clean energy solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Information Data &amp; Analytics (IDA) family is a family of Data experts who create business value every day with their cutting-edge knowledge. We maximize value from information &amp; data, using our domain knowledge &amp; deep technical expertise in market leading information &amp; data tools, to deliver actionable data driven insights for Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Want to join us at Shell to enable Powering Progress for a better future?<\u002Fp>\n  <p> With you part of our team, we will accelerate our digital journey at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join our Information and Data Community: You will be part of a community of experts in different capabilities in Information Digital Engineering driving ideas to reality. The Information Data &amp; Analytics (IDA) family is a community of data experts in Shell who create business value every day with their cutting-edge knowledge. We are looking for more members to join the IDA Family. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As a Senior Data engineer, you are a subject matter expert who is curious and an innovative thinker to mentor young professionals. You are a key person to convert Vision and Data Strategy for IT solutions and deliver them. With your knowledge you will help create data-driven thinking within the organization, not just within IT teams, but also in the wider Shell stakeholder community.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Communicate with both technical developers and business managers and gain respect and trust of leaders and staff.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Actively deliver the roll-out and embedding of Data Foundation initiatives in support of the key business programs advising on the technology and using leading market standard tools.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coordinate the change management process, incident management and problem management process.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure traceability of requirements from Data through testing and scope changes, to training and transition.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive implementation efficiency and effectiveness across the pilots and future projects to minimize cost, increase speed of implementation and maximize value delivery<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be an asset in our team bringing deep technical skills and capabilities to become a key part of projects defining the data journey in Shell, keen to engage, network and innovate in collaboration with companywide teams. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>We focus on continuous learning of new technologies to make you future ready.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are looking forward to hearing from the candidates with below skill set:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Substantial experience in IT Industry with University degree in any IT discipline.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven technology champion in working with relational, Data warehouses databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases. Experience\u002FKnowledge in working with NoSQL databases and can create E2E pipelines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Highly Experienced in building and optimizing complex queries. Good with manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven Experience in working any one of the data engineering technologies and ADLS, ADF, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL, Synapse, SAP HANA. Your experience in handling big data sets and big data technologies will be an asset.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven champion with in-depth knowledge of any one of the scripting languages: Python, SQL, Spark-SQL\u002F PySpark.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Very Good understanding in Data Foundation initiatives, like Modelling, Data Quality Management, Data Governance, Data Maturity Assessments and Data Strategy in support of the key business stakeholders<b>.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Nice to Have Skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Gas\u002FPower Trading knowledge - Short-term trading, physical assets trading (CCGT, Wind, Solar, Battery)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Risk - Modelling &amp; understanding of risk &amp; risk management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Quantitative Skills - Statistical methods to check and investigate numerical data for practical insights.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Commodity Modelling - Energy (power, gas, environmental products) and meteorology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Previously created or enhanced CI\u002FCD build and releases pipelines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in working with scripting languages such as YAML, PowerShell, Terraform etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with big data tools: Kafka, Hadoop, Spark and similar technologies. Experience with stream-processing systems.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow and more.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Core Python skills like: Numpy, Panda, Django<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Certification in Azure<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Leadership Skills:<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We value Leadership in Shell and have opportunities for you to explore, develop and build on your abilities. As part of our team, you will:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Be self-motivated, innovative, and very good in taking up new initiatives and driving them to closure.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Communicate skilfully with both technical developers, architects, and business stake holders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understand well- data foundation initiatives like data modelling, data quality, data governance, data maturity assessments and data strategy in support of the key business stake holders.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Work with source control technologies (such as GITHUB, Azure DevOps)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Have experience in working with AGILE, KANBAN methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The 'European Power' team in Shell Energy Europe is a rapidly expanding team setup in 2018 to help the business grow and expand Power Trading and Renewable Power Generation. The European Power business's core focus is the trading and optimisation of electricity within Europe.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Based across London and Bangalore, the team is responsible for building and supporting the IT platform required to facilitate large scale trading of power and associated fuels as well as any associated operational activities in European markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role is for an experienced Product Manager who will join a Scrum Product team which is delivering software solutions and applications. It is ideally suited to someone who can work in a fast-paced environment and able to solve complex business problems.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Product Manager is accountable for the value delivery of the product to the business. He or she collaborates with the Product Owner to set the product vision, brings forward the best technology\u002Fsolutions to solve business problems (e.g., technology and innovation funnels), cocreates the product roadmap and success metrics, fulfils the product lifecycle within Enterprise compliance and controls framework, creates value delivery through product development, performs financial management, and sets the right product environment and mindset for the product team.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Builds, leads, and inspires a team to deliver the Product roadmap against the prevailing lifecycle, sourcing capability from across the organisation. Focus actions against product attributes of desirability, feasibility, and viability.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manages the product team of their day-to-day delivery accountabilities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Co-creates with the Product Owner a compelling vision for the product through intimate understanding and appreciation of the market, business value stream, and user\u002Fcustomer journey.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Seeks to work with Finance to select the right funding and recovery model, informing decisions around product investment through defined roadmaps and backlogs.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrates strong commercial acumen and industry\u002Fmarket curiosity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Inspires the use of and selflessly share into the Product team a range of insights (internal and external, quantitative, and qualitative) to inform product vision, innovation, discovery and delivery work.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Frames what success looks like and ensure the Product team understand and apply Product success metrics to their work<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Champions preferred ways of working into the Product team, ensuring best use of agreed agile and devops approaches, methods and frameworks – driving alignment with IT Engineering and ITSO for certainty of throughput and flow during discovery, development and release activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Engages and utilizes the cross-functional natural team to manage risk and assures product management in line with agreed ways of working, soliciting input from stakeholders as required in line with the prevailing product framework and practices.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drives, through the cross-functional natural team, compliance to agreed technical Enterprise standards, promoting understanding of architectural roadmaps into the Product team.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Seeks user value and understands how to translate this into commercial value for Shell across the Product lifecycle. Reprioritises where Product development is not fulfilling success metrics or target value yields (qualitative or quantitative).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Role-models, champions, and advocates for collaborative and open ways of working and behaviours built on trust and driven by empathy.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Promotes a culture of experimentation within the Product team as well as the use of ‘scale and replicate’ techniques within the Product by sourcing what’s good from elsewhere across the Product landscape and corresponding technology stack.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from the candidates with below skill set<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Essential:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Deep understanding of European power markets, including physical power<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience working in a fast-paced trading environment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant experience recently in delivering digital products with proven business impact, Significant experience in a leadership position<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven leadership skills, with vast experience in managing multiple, cross-functional teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven ability to master the complexity of interactions, demonstrating strong communication skills, among IT, digital and business stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Practical experience of working in and with techniques such as agile, scrum, lean start-up or design thinking and in creation of Minimum Viable Products\u002FPropositions (MVPs)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven people development skills and coaching experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Results-oriented, ability to manage time and schedules to meet aggressive deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated project management skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Desirable:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Experience with large scale ETRMs (Energy Trading Risk Management)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of trading a variety of technologies – wind, solar, CCGTs, batteries<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of standard third party contracting and routes to markets – PPAs, tolling<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p> As a member of the Program and Project Management (P&amp;PM) Capability Centre at Shell, you will have the opportunity to work in a challenging but rewarding environment that is fast paced and changing fundamentally as we transform our business to meet our ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, whilst delivering a world class business case that has a strong societal license to operate. In your program and project management career at Shell you will be expected to enact change and deliver value globally across business lines and geographies.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><br> Project Managers plan, execute, and control a project or set of related projects to meet identified business requirements and deliver business value, through acquiring and utilizing the necessary resources and skills, within agreed parameters of cost, timescales, risk, quality, and benefits.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> You will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Plan, execute, monitor, control, and close all aspects of the project lifecycle adhering to the Shell Project Delivery Framework methodology and other standards at a scale of $2M+.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Quickly build and leverage relationships with sponsors, the Programme Manager and key stakeholders and understand their priorities. Resolve conflict and deliver tough messages with grace to the Decision Review Board.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Agree and build an agreed list of deliverables as defined by the Decision Review Board or Programme Manager, keeping to the time, cost and quality parameters set.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Motivate and lead the project or workstream team through periods of uncertainty, while understanding and reporting barriers so that the team can complete its objectives while managing pressure.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Create and deliver relevant and impactful communications for project or workstream stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support the project team to remain resilient after setbacks and to recover performance<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Manage and report risks at a project level to make timely recommendations that will maximize value.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Understand changes necessary to balance execution efficiency with risk mitigation, value delivery, cost, quality, and benefits.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Understand programme or project goals and business context at all stages of the lifecycle, and particularly when responding to challenges and change. Recommend acceptable courses of action where appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Execute the chosen methodology for the project or workstream to maximize delivery effectiveness.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Execute the required governance approach defined by the Decision Review Board or Programme Manager; and<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Support programme leadership or the natural team to enable the project team to collaborate effectively with business IT, the impacted businesses, wider stakeholders both internally and externally, resolving issues such as financing, risk, resourcing, integrated planning and long-term management of any resulting products and services where appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> As your career in Shell progresses, you will be exposed to opportunities both across our diverse lines of business and in our business IT and enterprise IT functions, as well as progressively more challenging assignments that develop your capabilities.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> As a program and project management professional in Shell, you are also a leader in the natural team and are required to continuously develop your leadership behaviors:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Live our values and goal zero - We do the right thing with respect to our values, safety, and people.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Maximize our performance - We focus on priorities, seek improvements, and work together across teams to close our gap to potential and deliver bottom line commercial results.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Grow trust in Shell - We work outside in and build strong long-term relationships with customers, partners, and external parties and make a positive contribution to society.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Engage &amp; inspire - We engage everyone through our connected purpose and inspire people and teams be their best through development, coaching and honest feedback.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Learner mindset - We have a shared belief that everyone can grow their ability, learn from mistakes &amp; successes, and speak up openly in a safe environment.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Shell is looking for Program and Project Management professionals with proficiency across the following:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> Substantial experience in IT with experience in managing projects through the entire lifecycle (start up to close), ideally in an Energy\u002FCommodity Trading environment.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Experience of delivering projects in Energy\u002FCommodity Trading domain is essential.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Program and project delivery skills in both agile and waterfall methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Technology skills, such as cloud, mobile, software-as-a-service, and digital platforms.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Professional skills, such as leadership, communication, and resilience.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Entrepreneurial skills, such as a business-value mindset, critical thinking, storytelling, stakeholder management, and enabling value creation<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation, and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>You will be part of our Global energy-based trading support IT team in Shell Energy<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> You will be motivated to leverage your experience of energy trading business IT support to make a positive impact on the future of our planet<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will be part of an innovative team of IT supporting application support and Infrastructure, who continuously face the challenges of tomorrow and today.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> You will be committed to being the best version of yourself and helping others to learn and generate new ideas that make life better for you, your colleagues, and our business<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Energy: The Shell Energy Operations team is a dynamic, fast - moving team based across the world. The team is responsible for ensuring that our traders can trade global markets 24\u002F7 without disruption or loss of earnings. We work hand in hand with a network or partners and suppliers to ensure that trading systems and connected environments are operate optimally. We work with a rapid understanding of user needs and technology changes with clear accountability for service delivery.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be responsible to ensure end-to-end service availability and resolve escalated urgent\u002Fcomplex issues to ensure business continuity for applications in Shell “Nature and Environment Solutions” and “Data and Decision Making” portfolio within the overall Shell Energy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Energy “Data &amp; Decision Making” portfolio<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As global energy markets become more interconnected and the business looks for holistic decisions on the journey to net zero, Shell Energy’s ability to ingest, model and visualize data needs to be a differentiating capability.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> D&amp;DM’s role is to enable an IT landscape that provides “workable technology” to improve the time to value of data and analysis and give as much control as possible to the business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> About Shell Energy “Nature and Environmental Solutions”<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell officially launched at the start of January, combining the Environmental Products and Nature Based Solutions businesses.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> NBS comprise all activities related to the conservation and restoration of natural ecosystems – such as forests, agriculture, grasslands, wetlands and blue carbon – to lower concentrations of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Environmental Products Trading Business (EPTB) is a recognised leader in environmental trading, with over a decade of experience in all key global carbon emission markets.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> thought of as voluntary (highly illiquid) and regulated markets. We are primarily trading allowances (an ‘allowance’ to emit pollutants e.g. EU ETS – EUAs) and voluntary carbon offsets (an ‘offset’ that mitigates emissions made elsewhere e.g. VERs).<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Offsets can be generated in many different ways and we source supply from several sources<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Sr. IT Operations Engineer is a key role responsible for supporting delivery of day-to-day application and infrastructure services, according to agreed Service Levels and\u002For Operate Level Agreements ensuring business continuity. The role also requires review of application functionality\u002Flandscape for continuous improvement and frequent engagement with business, supplier, natural teams and product teams in Shell Energy.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position provides an opportunity to work on a wide spectrum of applications developed in new technologies such as Azure data functions and market standard products that bring competitive advantage to trading<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your key accountabilities: <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Pivotal role as the primary and escalation focal for Shell energy trading applications.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for maintaining the seamless operational delivery of applications and their related back-end technology<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Liaise with multiple stakeholders including Business Manager and Applications Managed Service providers to remove blockers, drive solutions and meet business need<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support transition of applications\u002Fproducts and enhancements to delivery support.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive incident \u002F problem resolution with internal and external partners<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Steer and embed compliance and audit activities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Track operational cost and assist in budgeting <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maintain and advance operational run books, guidelines, and procedures<\u002Fli>\n critical applications, including application maintenance, infrastructure landscape documentation and document failover<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from candidates with:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Essential requirements <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Graduate or Post Graduate degree in Information Technology or similar certification.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Substantial experience in managing and maintaining Azure cloud, involving various Azure cloud services and components such as Azure Data Factory, Data Bricks, Azure Databases, Data Lake Analytics, Function App, Web App, Azure Cosmos DB, SQL<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge about Data Analytics and Data modelling tools and techniques used to understand and analyze how an organization collect, update, and store data.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experienced in IT support &amp; understanding of trading lifecycle of the Trading process - from trade capture, through scheduling the commodity for delivery.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Exposure to application development and technologies mainly in Azure data functions \u002F Reporting.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> analysis and problem-solving skills, good communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Technical Skills <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Hands on experience with CI\u002FCD tools like Jenkins, Concourse, Harness, or other similar tools<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with general scripting languages such as Python, JavaScript, React JS, Perl, Bash or other similar tools.<\u002Fli>\n Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.
